title: Praline Grahams
instructions: Arrange crackers side by side as close as you can on cookie sheet covered with foil.
Cookie sheet must have sides.
Put butter and sugar in pan and cook 1 1/2 minutes.
When it comes to a boil, take off heat and add nuts and vanilla, then spread evenly over crackers. Bake 10 minutes at 350°.
When cool, break apart. Can be frozen.
Will not get soggy.

title: Vegetable Pizza
instructions: Unroll crescent dough.
Do not separate.
Press seams together to fill the bottom of a 15 x 10-inch pan.
Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.
Cool.

title: Pumpkin Bread
instructions: Combine all ingredients in bowl and mix.
Bake 1 1/2 hours at 325°.
Makes 1 large loaf or 2 medium loaves.

title: Swiss Chicken
instructions: Place ingredients in order listed in a casserole dish and bake 50 minutes at 350°.

title: Beef Stew
instructions: Mix all ingredients in large casserole dish.
Cover.
Bake at 250° for 5 to 6 hours.
Serve with cornbread.

title: El'S Cole Slaw
instructions: Shred cabbage, carrots and peppers.
(Can use large package of shredded cole slaw, but add peppers to it.) Salt to taste.

title: Coconut Pie
instructions: Beat eggs, sugar and flour together well.
Add milk and pour over eggs, sugar and butter.
Add coconut, add vanilla.
Cook at 300° for 1 hour or until brown.
Makes 2 pies.

title: Fried Tomatoes
instructions: Slice tomatoes 3/4-inch thick.
Dip into beaten eggs and then into fine bread crumbs.
Fry in hot fat (half oleo and half cooking oil) until brown on both sides.

title: Nan Marshall'S Baked Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven
to
Heat
shortening
in
x 9 x 2-inch or 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking pan.
Mix all dry ingredients in bag. Add 2 or 3 pieces of chicken and shake until coated.

title: Mom'S Special Party Cheese Balls
instructions: Cut cheese in small pieces or grate and allow to come to room temperature.
In mixing bowl, beat cheese and mayonnaise until smooth and creamy.
Add onion, Worcestershire sauce, paprika and parsley.
Continue to beat until thoroughly blended.
Shape into 2 balls.
Roll in nuts.
May garnish with olives, cherries or parsley.
Freezes well.

title: Egg Custard Pie
instructions: Combine milk and sugar.
Heat to boiling point.
Mix butter, eggs, salt and vanilla.
Add to milk and sugar.
Place in unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Makes 2 pies.

title: Pasta With Tomato Vodka Sauce
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onion; saute until tender (not brown), 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic.
Add tomatoes, vodka and red pepper; break up tomatoes with side of spoon.
Cook until sauce is reduced by 1/3 and thickened, 15 minutes.
Stir in cream; simmer, stirring (do not allow to boil) 5 minutes. Season with salt.

title: Chinese Barbecued Spareribs
instructions: Place ribs on baking sheet. With sharp knife, cut meat between bones. Crush garlic and blend with other ingredients. Spoon sauce on both sides and into cuts. Bake in 400° oven for 20 minutes on each side. Serves 4.

title: Corn Pudding
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Place in buttered casserole. Bake at 300° for 1 hour.

title: Green Snap Beans
instructions: Clean and snap green beans.
Put bacon drippings in a large pot; add the snap beans and about 2 cups water.
Cook at medium temperature.
Add water as needed.
Just before they are done, add the salt and sugar.
Serve with fresh onions and cornbread. Yield:
6 servings.

title: Rye Rounds
instructions: Mix first 5 ingredients.
Spread on party rye bread.
Top with 1 slice onion.
Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
Makes approximately 16 rounds.

title: Bean Bake
instructions: Brown ground beef; drain.
Add chopped onion and pepper.
Add all cans of vegetables drained.
Add ketchup.
Bake in oven 30 minutes or slow cook in crock-pot until done.

title: K'S Brownies
instructions: Mix cocoa and sugar.
Add flour, melted margarine, eggs and vanilla.
Bake at 375° for 35 minutes.
Add nuts, if desired.

title: Sausage And Egg Casserole
instructions: Brown sausage over medium heat. Drain fat. Place sausage in a greased 2 quart casserole dish.

title: Squash Casserole
instructions: Cook and drain squash.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Mix sour cream, soup and onion in a small bowl.
In another bowl, pour melted butter over dressing; mix well.
Alternate layers (2) of squash, soup and dressing in casserole dish.
Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.

title: Black Bean Chili In 20 Minutes
instructions: Saute onion in oil or wine.
Add green pepper, garlic and cumin.
Stir in chili powder and saute.
Add beans and tomatoes. Stir in brown sugar.
Cover; simmer on low heat for 10 minutes. Serve over couscous or brown rice.
Top with cheese over a baked potato.
Can be used as a dip with tortilla chips.

title: Milk And Egg Free Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Grease either a 9-inch round or a 8-inch square cake pan.
Sift flour, sugar and soda together.
Mix applesauce, oil and vanilla in a bowl; add the dry ingredients and stir just until flour is moistened.
Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake 30 minutes.
For a 2-layer cake, double the recipe.

title: Strawberry Milkshake
instructions: Combine ingredients into blender.
Blend on high until smooth.

title: Cream Cheese Pound Cake
instructions: Cream butter and cream cheese together until well blended. Add sugar and cream well.
Add egg and flour alternately, mixing well after each addition.
Add vanilla.
Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours in greased and floured tube pan.

title: Ice Box Fruit Cake
instructions: Roll graham crackers with rolling pin until very fine.
Melt marshmallows and add milk in double boiler.
Mix all the other ingredients toegther.
Pour melted marshmallows and milk over them.
Mix well and pack in cracker box or roll.
Put in refrigerator 24 hours before cutting.

title: Pork Chops
instructions: Brown pork chops in deep skillet.
Chop onion and add to chops in pan, then stewed tomatoes and rest of ingredients.
Cover and simmer 30 minutes until done.

title: Creamy Pimento Cheese Spread
instructions: Position knife blade in food processor bowl.
Add first five ingredients.
Process until smooth.
Add pimento.
Pulse 4 or 5 times.

title: Lemon Fruit Salad
instructions: Use 2 cups of drained fruit juice and mix with instant lemon pudding.
Let thicken a little.
Combine with completely drained fruit.
Add lemon juice and bananas before serving.

title: Church Window Cookies
instructions: Melt chocolate chips and butter in double boiler.
While melting, prepare other ingredients.

title: Chicken And Broccoli With Mushroom Sauce
instructions: Mix margarine and flour together in saucepan.
Cook briefly over medium heat.
Blend in chicken broth, stirring constantly until thickened and smooth.
Stir in mushrooms and their liquid. Season to taste.
Place broccoli pieces in a shallow baking pan. Cover with sliced chicken and pour mushroom sauce over all.
Top with parsley and bread crumbs.
Bake at 375°, uncovered, for 15 to 25 minutes or until bubbly and brown on top.

title: Stuffed Celery
instructions: Wash celery and cut into small pieces, about 2-inch strips. Combine raisins, olives, cream cheese and mayonnaise and stir until ingredients are mixed well.
Fill celery pieces and chill.

title: Chicken Nacho Dip
instructions: Reserve 1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix; set aside.
Combine remaining taco seasoning mix, chicken, beer and chiles in a large skillet.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes or until mixture is thickened.
Remove from heat; stir in salsa.

title: Sugar-Free Doughnuts
instructions: Cream shortening and margarine in bowl.
Add mashed potatoes, potato water, sweetener and egg; beat well.
Sprinkle with yeast. Stir in gently.
Let stand
for 1 1/2 hours in warm place.
Stir in flour gradually.
Knead on floured surface until smooth.
Let rise, covered, in warm place 5 to 6 hours or doubled in bulk. Roll out on floured surface 1/2-inch thick.
Cut to desired size. Place on floured towel.
Let rise in warm place 1 1/2 to 2 inches or until doubled in bulk.
Deep fry in 375°
oil until light brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Yields 50 doughnuts.

title: Ham Balls
instructions: Roll in balls and bake 10 minutes.

title: Baked Beans With Hamburger
instructions: Use medium skillet.
Cook bacon until crisp; set aside.
Empty grease and use same pan.
Saute onion and beef until brown. Remove onion and beef with slotted spoon.
Put in 2-quart casserole and stir in salt.
Discard drippings.
Add cooked bacon. Preheat oven to 375°.
In skillet add remaining ingredients and heat until hot, stirring occasionally.
Pour into casserole and stir well.
Bake uncovered for 60 minutes.

title: Sweet And Sour Cocktail Meatballs
instructions: Mix beef, bread crumbs, eggs, soup mix and Accent.
Roll into bite size pieces.
Arrange on cookie sheet.
Bake at 350° for approximately 15 minutes.

title: Mock Apple Pie
instructions: Roll out half the pastry and line a 9-inch pie plate.
Place crackers in crust.
In saucepan over high heat, bring water, sugar and cream of tartar to boil; simmer for 15 minutes.
Add lemon juice and rind; cool.
Pour syrup over crackers.
Dot with spread. Sprinkle with cinnamon.
Roll out remaining pastry; place over pie. Trim, seal and flute edges.
Slit top crust to allow steam to escape.
Bake at 425° for 30 to 35 minutes or until crust is golden.
Cool completely.

title: Raisin Cream Pie
instructions: Boil raisins and water slowly until most of the water is taken up.
Add the 1 1/2 cup milk; mix remaining ingredients with the 1/2 cup of half and half and add to the raisins and cook until thick.
Top with meringue from egg whites.

title: Mom'S Meat Loaf
instructions: Put everything in bowl. Mix together. Place in pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Date Roll
instructions: Melt margarine and marshmallows in pan over low heat.
Chop dates and nuts.
Add to margarine-marshmallow mixture.
Spread about 1 cup graham cracker crumbs on wax paper.
Shape mixture into long roll.
Lay on graham crackers and roll up.
Chill; slice thin.

title: Chipped Beef Appetizer
instructions: Combine all ingredients.
Bake 30 to 40 minutes at 350°. Serve with crackers.

title: Sweet And Sour Chicken(Chinese)
instructions: In large skillet or wok, stir-fry onion in garlic and ginger in hot oil for 1 minute.
Add peppers and stir until crisp-tender.
Remove from pan and add chicken.
Stir-fry until cooked.
Return vegetables to pan.
Mix cornstarch with soy sauce, pineapple juice, vinegar and sugar.
Pour into pan.
Add pineapple chunks.
Bring to a full boil.
Serve with hot rice.
Makes 4 servings.

title: Beer Bread
instructions: Mix all ingredients and place in 2 greased 9 x 5-inch loaf pans.
Start in cold oven.
Bake 60 to 70 minutes.
Butter top 15 to 20 minutes before done.

title: Zucchini Bread
instructions: Combine oil, eggs, sugar and zucchini.
Add vanilla and blend well.
Mix dry ingredients together.
Stir dry ingredients into egg mixture, a small amount at a time.
Stir in nuts and raisins. Do not beat.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour in small loaf pans or 1 1/2 hours in large cake pan.

title: Chicken A La King
instructions: Saute mushrooms and green pepper in butter.
Blend in flour and seasonings.
Cook over low heat, stirring, until mixture is smooth and bubbly.
Remove from heat.
Slowly stir in broth and cream.
Bring to boil over low heat, stirring constantly.
Boil for 1 minute.
Add chicken and pimento; continue cooking until meat is heated through.
Serve over noodles.

title: Lemon Salad Supreme
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in water.
Add lemon juice and salad dressing and mix well.
Chill in refrigerator until mixture begins to congeal.
Beat well; add remaining ingredients and mix.
Pour into lightly oiled 2-quart mold.
Chill until set.
Unmold on salad greens and garnish as desired.

title: Lamb And Okra Stew
instructions: Brown meat in oil, then add a small amount of water.
Cover and allow to simmer until almost tender (15 to 20 minutes).
Add okra and garlic to the meat and simmer for another 15 minutes.
Peel tomatoes and whirl in blender, then add to meat and okra.
Add salt, pepper and lemon juice.
Cook on low heat until okra is tender and sauce is set.
Chicken or beef can be used instead of lamb.
Serve over rice.

title: Twinkie Cake
instructions: Slice Twinkies in half and place cream side up in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.
Slice bananas on top of Twinkies.
Prepare pudding as per directions and combine with well drained pineapple.
Pour this over bananas.
Next, smooth Cool Whip over top and sprinkle on nuts.
Keep refrigerated.

title: Sausage Balls
instructions: Mix and shape into small balls.
Cook at 375° for 10 to 15 minutes.

title: Easy Cottage Cheese Loaf
instructions: Mix well and turn into greased pan.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Apple Surprise
instructions: Place pie filling in a 9 x 13 inch cake pan.
Sprinkle lemon juice over the pie filling with.
Add one part of the cinnamon over the mixture.
Cover filling with dry cake mix, do not stir. Sprinkle with the remaining cinnamon.
Drizzle melted butter over the cake mix.
Spread nuts over top of cake.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes, until topping is bubbly.

title: Buttercream Frosting
instructions: In a small mixing bowl, cream butter; add 1/3 of the sugar and beat well.
Add egg, vanilla, salt and cream; beat until smooth. Gradually add remaining sugar, beating until smooth.
If frosting is too thick, additional cream may be added.

title: Creamy Pasta With Mushrooms
instructions: Prepare fettuccine as directed on package.
Drain and set aside. Gradually add skim milk to fat-free mayonnaise and garlic in small saucepan.
Heat thoroughly, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat; blend in Egg Beaters.
Toss with fettuccine and mushrooms until well coated.
Add Parmesan cheese and mix well.

title: Guinea Garbage
instructions: Slice peppers and onions, then saute them in a large skillet with a little oil.
Transfer when tender to a large pot.
Add one can of tomato sauce and the spices listed.
Let simmer after mixing well.
Cook the sausages and drain the fat.
Place whole sausages in the sauce and cover them well with the sauce.
Taste sauce and spice accordingly.
Serve on sub rolls.

title: Strawberry Delight
instructions: Break angel food cake in small pieces.
Layer in pan.
Dissolve jello in hot water.
Allow to thicken slightly.
Add berries to jello, pour over cake and chill.
Mix instant pudding, then whip together with ice cream.
Pour this over jello cake.
Chill until firm, then cover with Cool Whip.
Delicious!

title: Cheese And Sour Cream Potatoes
instructions: Combine potatoes, soup, sour cream, cheese, onion and salt and pepper and put in a 9 x 13 inch greased glass dish.
Mix melted butter and bread crumbs together and spread over top of potato mixture.
Bake for 45 minutes in a preheated 350° oven.

title: Tree Bark
instructions: Line large cookie sheet with tinfoil.
Arrange saltines to cover tray.
Combine butter and brown sugar. Pour over crackers and bake at 400° for seven minutes.
Remove and pour one cup chocolate chips over.
Spread until melted.
Chill 2 to 3 hours. Lift and break into pieces.

title: Mayonnaise Cake
instructions: Mix together.
Bake 25 minutes at 350°.

title: Kahlua Pound Cake
instructions: Mix all ingredients and pour into a greased and floured bundt pan.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.
Check often with toothpick.
If you don't add pecans, you don't have to flour pan.

title: Black Olive Cheese Ball
instructions: Blend together first three ingredients.
Add olives and chives.
Mold into ball and refrigerate.
Sprinkle with paprika and serve.

title: Mexican Dip
instructions: Spread softened cream cheese in baking dish.
Top with chili and then cheese.
Bake at 325° for 10 minutes.
Let cool.
Serve with nacho chips.

title: Wedding Potatoes
instructions: Spread potatoes in 9 x 13-inch cake pan.
Mix sour cream, soup, cheese, onion and 1/2 stick melted butter together.
Spread over potatoes.
Mix 1/2 stick melted butter and bread crumbs and spread over potatoes.
Bake at 375° for 1 hour.

title: Cherry Squares
instructions: Cream butter and sugar until very light.
Add flour, eggs and flavoring.
Beat until light again.
Spread in greased 15 1/2 x 10 1/2-inch pan.
Cut batter into 28 squares.
Spoon pie filling into center of each square.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
Cool. Cut into squares and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

title: Vanilla Ice Cream
instructions: Mix together with mixer.
Pour into 4-quart container and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.
If fruit is added, cut milk to about 4 1/2 cups.

title: Pasta Frola (Guava Torte)
instructions: Sift together the dry ingredients.
Add the margarine to the dry ingredients with a pastry blender.
Add the eggs and the milk. Roll out 3/4 of the dough into a circle.
Save the other part for the top.

title: Texas State Fair Blue Ribbon Chili
instructions: Simmer for 1 hour.

title: Meat Loaf
instructions: Mix all together.
Shape into 2 loaves.
Bake at 350° for 60 minutes.

title: Strawberry Pie
instructions: Boil sugar, cornstarch and water until thick.
Add gelatin; mix thoroughly.
Place fresh berries in pie shell.
Pour gelatin mixture over strawberries.
Chill until set.
Top with whipped topping if desired.

title: Chicken And Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Heat oven to 350°. Cut up sausage into small pieces and cook. Melt cheese, add soup to cheese, stir until well blended.
Cook broccoli. In a seperate bowl mix stuffing, sausage, celery and onions.
Place cut up chicken in bottom of pan, then broccoli, then pour soup and cheese mixture on top. Top with stuffing mixture.
Bake for 40 min. till cheese bubbles and stuffing browns.

title: Pork Barbecue Sauce
instructions: Combine all ingredients and bring to a good boil.
Can also be used for chicken.

title: Mock Whipped Cream Icing
instructions: Put all ingredients together in bowl and beat thoroughly, about 7 minutes.

title: Vegetable Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Use an ungreased 2-quart casserole dish.
Cook broccoli and Brussels sprouts as directed on packages. After 5 minutes add cauliflower.
Cook until tender.
Drain well.

title: Raisin And Nut Bran Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Grease a 2 inch muffin tin. Combine bran and milk in a bowl and let sit for 5 minutes.
Then mash with the back of spoon.
Sift together the flour and sugar and add to bran.
Add the beaten egg and the melted butter and stir until well blended, Do not beat.
Stir in the nuts and raisins. Divide batter amount the muffin cups.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

title: Easy Beef Stew
instructions: Baking Temperature: 300°.
Baking Time: 4 hours.

title: Chocolate Pound Cake
instructions: Cream oleo and shortening with sugar.
Add eggs one at a time and blend well after each.
Sift dry ingredients together and add alternately with milk.
Add vanilla.
Pour batter into greased and floured tube pan.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 25 minutes.

title: Old Fashioned Apple Crisp
instructions: Place filling in shallow one quart baking dish.
In a bowl, combine flour, oats, sugar, salt and spices.
Cut in butter and mix well.
Spread topping evenly over apple filling.
Bake in 375° oven for about 30 minutes.
Serve warm or cold.
Serves 6.

title: Broccoli Cornbread
instructions: Mix together the butter, eggs, cottage cheese, cornbread mix and salt.
Add the broccoli and onion.
Grease dish.
Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes.

title: Our Favorite Pound Cake
instructions: Blend sugar, salt and mace in large mixing bowl. Cream the sugar mixture and butter until light and fluffy.
Add extracts. Beat eggs into mixture, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add parts of flour and milk to creamed mixture alternately, blending well after each addition.
When smooth, turn batter into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan.
Bake in a moderate oven at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean and cake is golden brown.
Allow cake to cool 5 minutes in pan. Turn out on cooling rack.
Cool thoroughly.

title: Green Bean And Mozzarella Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in large bowl.
Cover and refrigerate 1 hour before serving.
Makes 4 to 6 servings.

title: Super Nachos
instructions: In a large skillet, cook meat until brown; drain.
Add seasonings and water; simmer for 20 minutes.
Spread bean dip over large 12 x 14-inch pizza pan.
Sprinkle with cheeses; top with meat and chopped chilies and bake until bubbly.
Arrange lettuce, tomatoes and tortillas around edge and serve.

title: Orange Glazed Carrots
instructions: In a small saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, salt and ginger.
Add orange juice.
Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.
Cook 1 to 2 minutes more.
Stir in butter and pour over hot carrots.
Stir to coat.

title: Pecan Pralines
instructions: Cook sugars and milk until forms soft ball in cold water. Remove from heat.
Add butter and beat until creamy.
Add pecans and vanilla.
Drop on waxed paper.
Makes 30 pieces.

title: Skillet Bread
instructions: Put 1/2 fat in skillet.
Place in preheated oven to heat while mixing bread.
Mix wet ingredients.
Mix the dry ingredients, then mix combine both mixtures.
Pour into hot skillet and bake 20 minutes at 425° or until top is crusty brown.
This recipe doubles and triples easily, but for best results must be cooked in an iron skillet.

title: Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Combine
all ingredients except cracker crumbs and pour into greased
baking
dish.
Sprinkle with cracker crumbs and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Serves 6 to 8.

title: Oven Baked Potato Wedges
instructions: Set oven to 400°.
Melt butter into baking pan.
Set aside. Cut clean potatoes into wedges.
Mix Ranch package, flour and cheese in a small paper or plastic bag.
Shake potato wedges in bag until well coated.
Bake in butter-coated pan until lightly brown and tender in the middle.
You should turn them over while baking to brown both sides.

title: Homemade Canned Spaghetti Sauce
instructions: Boil for 2 hours.
Add 3 cups of sugar and cook 15 minutes more.
Put in hot jars.

title: Lettuce Salad
instructions: Drain pineapple and oranges.
Stir over low heat until coated the almonds and sugar.
Cool and break apart.
Set aside.
Put remaining ingredients in a plastic bag.

title: Cream Of Broccoli Soup
instructions: Fry together butter and onion until brown.
Add flour and stir.
Add canned soup, milk and broccoli.
Simmer 15 minutes or until broccoli is cooked.
Add shredded Cheddar cheese and simmer 10 minutes.

title: Pickled Eggs
instructions: Boil ingredients and place over hot eggs with beets on top in a glass container.
Leave it sit out until cool, then refrigerate.

title: Sunshine Salad
instructions: Dissolve jello in hot water, add cold water; stir. Add pineapple; allow to cool but not gel. Add carrots and stir to distribute evenly. Place in refrigerate to congeal.

title: Easter Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Roll out half of dough and line 9-inch buttered pie pan.
Saute peppers and ham in oil 3 minutes; season with pepper.
Whisk 2 eggs and Ricotta in large bowl.
Spread mixture in pastry shell.
Pat spinach dry.
Sprinkle on top. Sprinkle saute mix over spinach and top with Mozzarella.
Add basil.
Roll out remaining dough and cover pie.
Trim edges.
Cut 4 vents and brush top with beaten egg.
Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until golden brown.
Set 20 minutes and serve.

title: Cousin Carol'S Seafood Sauce
instructions: In a saucepan, add oil and minced garlic.
Chop parsley leaves and add to saucepan.
Stir until parsley is limp.
Add seafood (cleaned and de-shelled).
Add tomato sauce, wine and basil.
The sauce should be a light red-pink color.
Reduce liquid until meat is just showing through the liquid.
If you are using all fresh seafood, add a can of clam juice to add flavor to the sauce. Reduce as noted before.
Cook spaghetti until it is al dente.
Add sauce; toss and serve.

title: Hamburger Pie
instructions: Brown beef, onion and bell pepper.
Add sauce.
Spread crescent rolls in buttered pan, then spread beef mix, then cheese, etc., putting cheese on top.
Cook in oven at 350° to 400° until done, about 20 to 25 minutes.

title: Lemon Squares
instructions: Mix margarine, powdered sugar and 1 cup flour together and pat in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
While baking, mix rest of ingredients together on low speed.
Pour on hot crust and continue baking for 20 minutes.
Dust with powdered sugar while warm.
Cut when cool.

title: Stuffed Cabbage Rolls
instructions: Mix ground beef, rice, onion, salt and pepper well.
Form into good size balls and wrap in cabbage leaves.
Fasten with toothpicks.
Place in large pot; cover with canned tomato soup. Simmer for 45 minutes to an hour.
Shredded cabbage may be placed between layers of rolls to give more flavor to the sauce.
Serves 4 to 6.

title: Cherry Delight Dump Cake
instructions: Dump cherry filling in a 9 x 13-inch oblong pan.
Then dump pineapple.
Then sprinkle cake mix on top of that.
Melt margarine and pour over cake mix.
On top of this add Angel Flake coconut and top with pecans.
Bake for 1 hour at 325°.
Serve warm with ice cream or it's good cold.
Serve from the same pan.

title: Whipped Cream
instructions: Beat the cream, vanilla and sugar to a thick consistency. Refrigerate.

title: Chocolate Bottom Bites
instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl; make a well in the center of mixture.
Combine water, oil, vinegar and vanilla; add to dry ingredients, stirring well.
Spoon batter into paper-lined miniature muffin pans, filling 2/3 full.

title: Mema Weimar'S Macaroni And Cheese
instructions: Bring water to boil.
Add macaroni and cook for about 15 minutes.
Drain.
Place in pan and pour the can of tomatoes (mashed good) over top.
Add bacon grease and grated cheese.
Add salt and pepper to taste; stir all together.
Sprinkle some grated cheese on top and bacon bits.
Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.

title: Meat Loaf With Zesty Topping
instructions: Pour milk over bread crumbs.
Add ground beef, salt, pepper, carrot, onion and eggs.
Mix thoroughly.
Pack in a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.

title: Chinese Barbecued Pork
instructions: Cut pork into long strips about 2 inches wide and 2 inches thick.
Soak the first six ingredients for half a day or overnight.
Rub the meat (at room temperature) with garlic, sugar and honey.
Heat oven at 400°.
Roast the pork for 35 minutes, turning strips over once during roasting process.
Remove pork from oven and slice.

title: Clam Fritters
instructions: Heat oil to 375°.
Mix all ingredients until thick and stays on spoon.
Pat batter into pan to form patty.
Brown on each side. Serve hot.
Good leftover and in sandwiches.

title: Cheese Dip
instructions: Dice tomatoes and peppers.
Combine all ingredients in top of double boiler for 30 minutes.
Serve hot over corn chips.

title: Apple Impromtuv
instructions: Put apple pie filling on bottom of 8-inch square cake pan. Mix remaining ingredients.
Spread mixture over top of pie filling. Sprinkle lightly with cinnamon.
Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.

title: Broccoli And Chicken
instructions: Mix together all ingredients and top with Pepperidge Farm dry stuffing mix.
Top with butter and heat in a microwave to serve.

title: Ham And Swiss Pinwheels
instructions: Sprinkle flour over work surface.
Turn dough out onto floured surface and roll into a 12-inch square.
Combine mustard and honey in small bowl and brush over dough.
Sprinkle evenly with cheese. Top with ham slices.
Roll up jelly roll fashion, pinching seam to seal (don't seal ends).
Cut roll into 16 slices.
Place slices, cut side down, on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray.
Cover and let rise in a warm place (85°) for 45 minutes.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 18 minutes, or until golden.
Serve immediately.
Yields 16.

title: Strawberry Pie
instructions: Mash 1/2 of the strawberries well.
Add cornstarch and salt, then water.
Cook mixture until thick and transparent; cool.
Add remaining strawberries to the cooked filling.
Pour into cooled crust.
Garnish with whipped cream.

title: Special Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Brown onion in hot shortening.
Drain.
Stir in the remaining ingredients.
Turn into a greased casserole and bake for 1 hour in a 325° oven.
Serve hot on cooked rice.

title: Pam'S Meat Loaf
instructions: Soak bread crumbs in milk; add meat, eggs, onion and seasonings.
Mix well.
Form in individual loaves; place in greased muffin pans.
Cover with Piquant Sauce.
Bake in a moderate 350° oven for 45 minutes.
Makes 8 servings.
Or form one loaf in 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2 1/2-inch pan.
Spread with sauce; bake 1 hour.

title: Earthquake Cake
instructions: Mix coconut and nuts.
Press into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix cake mix as directed.
Pour over nuts and coconut.
Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and margarine.
Drop by teaspoonfuls on top of cake mix (will almost completely cover top).
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: Tropical Coconut Pineapple Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Lightly grease 9 x 13 pan.
Prepare cake mix using 1/2 cup yogurt and 1 egg.
Spread batter onto the bottom of prepared pan.
Bake 10 minutes.
While baking, in a bowl mix remaining yogurt, egg, pineapple, brown sugar and coconut. Carefully spread yogurt mixture on top of partially baked batter. Bake bars 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.
Mix confectioners sugar and 2 tablespoons reserved pineapple juice to create a glaze.
Drizzle over cooked bars.

title: Corn Muffins
instructions: Combine all dry ingredients.
Combine milk, egg and oil.
Add to dry ingredients; stir quickly.
Fill greased muffin pans 2/3 full.
Bake at 425° for 12 to 15 minutes.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Fully cook chicken; bone and put into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Pour soup over chicken.
Make stuffing as directed on box; spread over soup.
Bake about 1/2 hour at 375° to 400°.

title: Chicken L'Orange
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and pour over chicken in baking dish.
Bake, covered, at 350° for 35 minutes; uncover and bake for an additional 20 minutes.

title: Confirmation Auction Cavatini
instructions: Brown sausage in skillet. Cook noodles separately until tender. Drain noodles. Mix sausage, noodles and spaghetti sauce in a casserole dish. Sprinkle cheese on top and bake until melted.

title: Finger Paint
instructions: Dissolve soap chips in water until they're not lumpy.
Mix well with starch.
Use on heavy paper with plenty of newspapers underneath.

title: Chicken Spaghetti
instructions: Cook spaghetti and drain.
Mix all other ingredients together.
Add to spaghetti, place in a 13x9 casserole dish.
Cook for 30 minutes at 350 degrees.

title: Turkey Tetrazzini
instructions: Cook noodles, uncovered, in boiling water for 20 minutes. Drain.
Combine soup, milk, water and Cheddar cheese in 3-quart saucepan.
Cook over medium heat until cheese melts and sauce is hot; stir constantly.
Stir in cooked noodles, turkey, peas, carrots and pimento.
Spoon mixture into greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish.

title: Buckwheat Pancakes
instructions: Mix dry ingredients.
Add buttermilk to pour consistency.

title: Fresh Coconut Cake(16 Servings)
instructions: Sift flour, baking powder and salt together.
Grease and lightly flour three 9-inch cake pans.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar, using an electric mixer if possible.
Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
The mixture should be smooth and creamy.
Using a spoon, add one-third of the milk.
Repeat until flour and milk are incorporated.
It is important that ingredients be folded in; batter should not be beaten after flour has been introduced.

Stir in vanilla. Distribute batter evenly among three cake pans and bake in a preheated 350° oven for about 30 minutes, or until layers are golden brown and spring back when gently pressed in the middle. Cool for about 5 minutes and turn layers out of pans.

title: Sloppy Joes(Method:  One Pot Or Skillet)
instructions: Finely chop onions.
Brown onions and hamburger in a large pot or skillet; drain fat into heat resistant can.
Stir in tomato paste, water and barbecue sauce.
Cover; simmer until sauce is thick (approximately 10 to 15 minutes).
Serve on hamburger or kaiser buns.

title: Frozen Strawberry Pie
instructions: Put can of milk in icebox over night.
Add sugar and lemon juice to strawberries.
Beat until berries are a fine pulp.

title: Healthy Lasagne
instructions: In saucepan, cook turkey.
Add garlic powder, oregano and basil.
When cooked, add Italian sauce.
In bowl, mix the cottage cheese, egg whites, pepper and parsley flakes.
Layer 3 noodles (uncooked) in bottom of 13 x 9-inch dish, then the meat sauce, cottage cheese mixture and evenly sprinkle Mozzarella.
Repeat. Bake at 375° for about 35 to 40 minutes.
Add some water (1/4 to 1/2 cup) during baking if too dry.
Let stand 10 to 15 minutes. Serve.

title: Candy Cane Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Mix thoroughly butter, shortening, sugar, egg and flavorings.
Blend in flour and salt.
Divide dough in half; blend food color into one half.
Shape 1 teaspoon dough from each half into 4-inch rope.
Press together and twist.
Place on ungreased baking sheet; curve top down to form cane.
Bake about 9 minutes.
Sprinkle with candy and sugar mixture.

title: Sausage Zucchini Boats
instructions: Cook whole zucchini in salted boiling water until tender, 7 to 10 minutes.
Cut in 1/2 lengthwise segments.
Scoop squash from shells and mash.
Cook sausage with onion.
Drain off excess fat. Stir in mashed zucchini, reserving 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese. Add remaining ingredients.
Mix with a spoon into shells.
Place shells in a shallow baking dish.
Sprinkle with remainder of Parmesan cheese and dash of paprika.
Bake in moderate oven at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.

title: Jalapeno Cornbread
instructions: Combine eggs, oil, sour cream, corn, baking powder and salt. Add peppers and half of cheese. Spread in well-greased 12 x 8 x 2 pan and cover with remaining cheese. Bake in 425° oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Serves 8 to 10.

title: Spinach Bread
instructions: Cook spinach 7 minutes. Saute onions in butter and add cheese. Combine spinach with cheese mixture. Spread on French bread. Bake 5 to 10 minutes at 350°.

title: Hash Brown Casserole
instructions: Grease 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
Mix all 6 ingredients and pour into dish and top with crushed corn flakes.
Bake 45 minutes at 350°.

title: Cajun Chicken Casserole With Cornbread Crust
instructions: Combine chicken, soup, celery, green pepper, onion and pimentos in a large bowl.
Stir well.
Pour into a 9 x 14-inch pan or individual casserole dishes.
Combine cornbread mix, chicken stock and melted butter in a large bowl.
Stir well.
Sprinkle over casserole.
Bake in a 350° oven until crust is golden and casserole is bubbly, for about 15 to 20 minutes.
Yields 10 servings.

title: Baked Potato Soup
instructions: Place bacon in large, deep skillet. Cook over medium heat until browned. Drain, crumble and set aside.

title: Blueberry Tarts
instructions: Combine cornstarch, sugar and water.
Add washed blueberries and butter.
Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture is thickened and clear.
Cool slightly.
Fill tart shells with blueberry mixture and top with whipped cream, if desired.
Makes 6 servings.

title: Company Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.
Layer 13 x 9-inch baking pan with dried beef.
Place chicken breasts on top.
Cut bacon in smaller pieces, putting a small strip on each breast.
Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
Mix soup and sour cream.
Remove pan from oven and cover chicken well with soup mixture.
Cover chicken and return to oven for 30 minutes more.
(By covering chicken with tinfoil, your gravy will not cook away.)
Remove and serve with rice or noodles.

title: Broccoli-Rice Casserole
instructions: Cook rice per directions on box.
After rice is cooked, combine all ingredients, except margarine, in 2-quart casserole. Melt margarine and mix in.
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

title: Herbed Yogurt Dressing
instructions: Crush garlic and salt in a mortar and pestle or small bowl until a paste forms.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.

title: Pumpkin Pudding
instructions: Combine milk, brown sugar, orange peel, ginger, cinnamon and salt.
Stir thoroughly and add eggs and pumpkin; blend well.
Beat until smooth.
Pour into a greased shallow 1 1/2-quart baking dish.
Place the dish in a large pan in the middle of the oven; pour enough boiling water in the pan to come halfway up the sides of the baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 1 1/4 hours or until a knife inserted in the center of the pudding comes out clean.
Remove the baking dish; cool the pudding to room temperature before serving or refrigerate at least 3 hours.
If cooked in six (4-ounce) individual glass molds, bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

title: Gonga'S Fudge
instructions: Mix sugar, butter and milk.
Bring to boiling point and let boil gently for 9 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in chocolate chips, nuts, vanilla and marshmallow cream until melted over low heat.
Pour into 9 x 12-inch buttered dish.
Let cool and cut into squares.

title: Lemon Lush
instructions: Combine the flour, butter, 1 tablespoon sugar and nuts. Spread the
mixture
in a 13 x 9-inch glass pan.
Bake at 350° until brown.
Combine
the
cream
cheese, powdered sugar and Cool Whip. Spread
this
mixture
on	top of the crust.
Whip lemon pudding and
milk
and
pour over the other two layers. Cover with additional Cool Whip and chopped nuts.

title: Million Dollar Cookies
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
Roll into small balls and place on lightly greased cookie sheet, well apart, flatten with glass bottom or fork dipped in sugar.
Bake 10 minutes at 350°.

title: Date Walnut Balls
instructions: Melt butter in heavy skillet.
Stir in sugar, egg yolk and dates.
Cook and stir over low heat 5 minutes or until mixture is thick.
Remove from heat.
Stir in lemon juice, peel and nuts. Cool.
Drop or roll into balls and roll in powdered sugar. Delicious!!
I double this recipe.

title: Quick Red Velvet Cake
instructions: Heat oven to 350°.
Grease and flour two 9-inch round or heart-shaped pans.
In a large bowl, combine all cake ingredients at low speed until moistened; beat 2 minutes at high speed.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 35 minutes or until top springs back when lightly touched in center.
Cool 15 minutes; remove from pans. Frost with Cream Cheese Frosting.

title: Coconut Cake(4 Layers)
instructions: Cook until bubbly and slightly thick.
Add 1 teaspoon of vanilla and begin to stack cakes.
Soak by punching holes and dipping on caramel sauce.
Cover with Seven Minute Frosting and sprinkle with coconut.
Repeat until all is used and cover top and sides with frosting.
Cover with coconut.

title: Taco Salad
instructions: Fry hamburger:
drain.
Rinse with boiling water to remove all grease.
Add to lettuce, tomatoes, onion and Cheddar cheese which have been mixed together well.
Add kidney beans, drained and rinsed.

title: African Chop Suey
instructions: Brown meat; add onions, celery, soups, water, mushrooms, molasses, rice, salt and pepper.
Bake 2 hours, uncovered, at 325°.

title: The 3 Bears' Porridge(Children'S Recipe)
instructions: Bring water to a boil.
Add oatmeal and salt and boil one minute, stirring occasionally.
Cut apple into small pieces and add to cooked oatmeal.
Add milk, brown sugar, raisins and cinnamon.
Cook slowly, stirring often, for 10 minutes.
Makes 10 servings.

title: Ice Cream Dessert
instructions: Heat liquid to boil.
Dissolve Jello and let cool slightly. By spoonful, add ice cream until all is in and melted.
Chill for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes and fold in fruit.
Mix well.
Chill till set.

title: Butterscotch Pound Cake
instructions: Beat butter and cream cheese at medium speed about 2 minutes or until soft.
Slowly add sugar and beat about 7 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating until yellow disappears.
Gradually add flour until blended.
Add flavorings, pecans and morsels. Spoon batter into a greased pan.
Bake at
325° for 1 hour and 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool a little. Pour the topping over cake while warm.

title: Oven Barbecue Hamburgers
instructions: Mix all ingredients and make medium size patties.
Brown in small amount of cooking oil and set aside.
Make the sauce.

title: Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Fry beef and garlic gently and keep juice.
Also add mushrooms and big onions.
Mix ingredients and place in casserole.

title: Green Beans With Bacon
instructions: Saute bacon and onions.
Add 2 cans of green beans and 1 can of juice.
Add sugar and vinegar.
Add salt and pepper.
Simmer for 15 to 30 minutes.

title: Beef And Potato Pie
instructions: Heat oven to 450°.
Oil a 2-quart casserole.
Chop onion and garlic.
Cook in oil the onion, then garlic, for 1 minute. Crumble beef in pan.
Add salt, pepper, thyme and marjoram; cook until browned.
Peel and thinly slice potatoes.
Drain and chop tomatoes.
Add tomatoes and bread crumbs to beef.
Arrange 1/2 potatoes on bottom of pan, overlapping halfway up sides.
Pack beef into pan.
Cover with remaining potatoes.
Bake until browned, for 30 to 35 minutes.
Serves 4.

title: Squash Patties(Serves 8)
instructions: Place squash and onion in a colander and sprinkle with salt. Let set over sink until all moisture is gone. Add flour, corn meal, pepper, cheese and egg and mix together. Form into patties and fry in butter.

title: Hot Fudge Sauce
instructions: Combine all ingredients.
Cook in a double boiler until thick, approximately 20 minutes.
Sauce will get very thick as it cools, not to worry!
Reheat in microwave or over hot water and it will thin down again.
Sauce will keep in the refrigerator for weeks.

title: Meringue
instructions: Beat egg whites, water and salt until stiff.
Gradually add sugar, then baking powder.
Beat one minute.
Bake at 400° for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Hamburger Casserole
instructions: Brown hamburger and onion; drain.
Pour spaghetti sauce into hamburger.
Mix well.
Pour in baking dish.
Mix cream potatoes as directed on box and layer on top of hamburger mixture.
You can sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Pumpkin-Pecan Tea Loaf
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, beat together shortening and sugar until well blended.
Beat in eggs.
Add pumpkin and water and stir until blended.

In another bowl, combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, soda, salt, baking powder, cardamom, cloves and cinnamon; add to pumpkin mixture and stir just until well blended. Stir in raisins and chopped pecans.
Pour batter into 2 greased and flour-dusted pans, each about 5 x 9-inches (or in 3 pans each about 3 3/8 x 7 3/8-inches).
Bake in a 350° oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes (or about 1 hour for the smaller pans), until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool in pans 10 minutes; then turn out on a wire rack and cool thoroughly. Makes 2 medium or 3 small loaves.

title: Diabetic Apple Pie
instructions: Pare apples and slice thin.
Combine Sugar Twin, flour, spices and salt.
Mix with apples.
Line pie plate with pastry.
Fill with apple mixture and dot with butter.
Adjust top crust. Sprinkle with Sugar Twin.
Bake at 400° for 50 minutes or until done.

title: Cooked Frosting
instructions: Cook the first 3 ingredients until thick.
Cool.
Add sugar and shortening; beat until smooth.

title: Smoked Salmon Spread(Low-Fat)
instructions: Place all ingredients in food processor and blend to smooth spreading consistency.
Smoke your own salmon to reduce the cost of this recipe.
Makes 8 ounces of spread.

title: Broccoli Corn Bread
instructions: Melt butter in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Beat eggs. Add all other ingredients to the beaten eggs.
Pour excess butter into mixture and mix well.
Pour into buttered baking dish. Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

title: "Tuck'S" Cow Pies
instructions: In a double boiler over simmering water, melt the chocolate chips and shortening, stirring until smooth.
Remove from the heat; stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Chill until ready to serve.
Makes 2 dozen.

title: Fruitcake Cookies
instructions: In large bowl, combine pecans, cracker crumbs, raisins, cherries and pineapple.
In large saucepan, combine marshmallows, milk and butter and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until melted.
Pour over pecan mixture and blend thoroughly.
Shape into 1-inch balls and roll in coconut.
It will be necessary to rinse your hands frequently.
Makes 7 to 8 dozen cookies.

title: Coca-Cola Salad
instructions: Drain juice from pineapple and cherries.
Combine and add 1 package each of cherry and strawberry jello.
Bring to a boil, stirring lightly just to mix.
Put in refrigerator; chill until it begins to thicken.
Fold in pineapple, nuts and cut up cherries. Add the 2 regular size bottles of chilled Cokes.
Stir lightly to mix, then chill for several hours until firm.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Place chicken pieces in 9 x 12-inch dish.
Mix soups and milk together and pour over chicken.
Spread dressing over chicken mixture.
Gradually pour broth over dressing until moistened. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Baked Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Wash mushrooms and remove stems.
In a bowl, mix clams and wine.
Cut a few mushroom stems and add 1/3 to 1/2 cup Italian bread crumbs.
Spoon stuffing into mushroom caps.
Place in baking pan and pour 1/4 cup melted butter over them.
Cook in oven 20 minutes at 375°.

title: Nut And Apricot Rolls
instructions: Mix all ingredients and refrigerate overnight.

title: Chewy Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: Beat margarine
and
sugars
until fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla.
Beat.
Add
flour, soda, salt and spices.
Mix well. Stir in
oats.
Drop by teaspoonful on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8 to 9 minutes at 375°.
Makes 4 1/2 dozen.

title: Winter Guacamole
instructions: Pit and peel avocados; mash pulp in medium bowl to chunky consistency.
Add lime juice, scallions, jalapeno chiles and tomatoes, then fold in cheese, bacon and coriander.
Season to taste with salt.
Serve as soon as possible to keep bacon crisp. Use your favorite chips for dipping.

title: Polynesian Pork
instructions: Trim any excess fat
from chops.
Brown in 1 tablespoon cooking oil, season meat
with
salt to taste.
Combine plums, coconut, water, vinegar, soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon salt, ginger, lemon peel and pepper, pour
over
chops.
Cover and simmer 35 to 40 minutes or until meat is tender.
Remove to warm platter with sauce spooned over.
Makes 6 servings.

title: Vegetable Oil Biscuits
instructions: Combine
dry
ingredients;
stir in oil and milk at the same time.
Roll
out dough between sheets of waxed paper on a dampened surface.
Cut rolled out dough with a floured biscuit cutter or cut
into squares with a knife.
Bake at 450° on an ungreased pan for 10 to 12 minutes.
Makes about 1 dozen.

title: Pumpkin Cranberry Muffins
instructions: Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and allspice. Preheat oven to 350°.
Grease or fill 20 muffin cups.
Mix oil and sugars; add egg and pumpkin.
Stir in dry ingredients and mix thoroughly.
Last, add cranberries, stirring only to mix.
Bake 20 to 25 minutes in oven.
These may be frozen for future use.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Melt butter in skillet and cut up onion. Cook until the onion is tender. Add soups; stir until smooth. Add 1/2 cup of milk. Debone chicken; layer chicken, rice and soup mixture. Top with cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Crab Meat Casserole
instructions: Make a basic white sauce using the first 3 ingredients and pour into casserole dish; top with bread crumbs.
Warm slowly in 350° oven.
Serve over rice.
Serves 6 to 8.

title: Layered Taco Dip
instructions: Using a 9 x 13-inch pan, first layer the bean dip, then browned hamburger, then sour cream and cream cheese (creamed together with 1the taco seasoning), then spread 1 jar of salsa over top.
Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, onions, shredded cheese and olives.

title: Ambrosia
instructions: *If you don't like coconut, but like the flavor, use 1/2 teaspoon coconut flavoring.

title: Corn Fritters
instructions: Measure water into large mixing bowl.
Add yeast.
Stir until dissolved.
Stir in sugar, shortening, salt and egg.
Add flour and beat until smooth.
Cover.
Let rise in warm place for 40 minutes.
Stir down.
Stir in corn.

title: Crockpot Chicken Breast
instructions: Combine soup, sour cream, wine and mushrooms.
Place chicken breast in crockpot.
Sprinkle with salt, pepper and paprika.
Cut onion into 1/4 inch slices and break apart into rings.
Spread over chicken.
Pour soup mixture over all and spread evenly. Sprinkle some more paprika over top.
Cook on low setting 6-8 hours.
Serve over rice.
Yield: 4-6 servings.

title: Pumpkin Crunch Dessert #2
instructions: Grease 9 x 13-inch pan.
Combine first 6 ingredients; mix well.
Spread in bottom of pan.
Sprinkle dry cake mix over top. Sprinkle on pecans.
Drizzle margarine over top.
Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes.

title: Vegie Pie
instructions: Spread out crescent rolls on large cookie sheet.
Push dough up sides of pan slightly.
Bake 7 to 8 minutes at 375° until golden brown.
Cool.
Blend cream cheese, mayonnaise and spices.
Spread over rolls.
Top with vegetables, then sprouts.
If made in advance, add tomatoes just before serving.

title: Bubble Bread
instructions: Cut dough into squares 1-inch size.
Layer nuts, raisins, dough and dry mixture.
Then pour 1/4 cup melted butter on, then repeat layers.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

title: Sausage Strata
instructions: Line a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan with bread (may take more than six slices).
Spread cooked, drained sausage over bread; sprinkle with cheese.
Combine remaining ingredients.
Beat well. Pour over sausage and cheese.
You can make the night before and refrigerate.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
Let sit a few minutes.

title: Zucchini Casserole
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and put into greased casserole. Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour at 350°.

title: Million Dollar Pie
instructions: Mix together and pour into crusts.
Chill until firm, at least 4 hours.
Makes 2 pies.

title: Blond Brownies
instructions: Cream butter and brown sugar.
Add beaten egg and then dry ingredients.
Add nuts and chocolate bits last.
Bake in a square pan, 8 x 8-inch.
Bake 25 minutes at 350°.

title: Chicken Divan Pot Pie
instructions: Heat oven to 425°.
Place cookie sheet in oven to preheat. In a medium saucepan, combine oleo, flour and pepper.
Cook over low heat until mixture becomes thick and bubbly.
Gradually stir in broth and milk and stir until mixture begins to thicken.
Add cheese and stir until melted.
Stir in chicken and broccoli.
Pour mixture into pie shell.
Remove second crust (frozen); place on top of filled pie.
Let thaw 10 to 20 minutes.
Crimp edges together.
Cut slits in top crust.
Place pie on cookie sheet. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until crust is brown.

title: Scalloped Corn
instructions: Saute margarine, onion and green pepper.
Put in greased casserole dish.
Add 2 cans of corn, corn muffin mix and eggs. Mix all together in casserole.
On top, spread sour cream and on top of that Cheddar cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes at 350°.

title: Million Calorie Bars
instructions: Melt caramels with milk in microwave.
Mix flour, oats, sugar, soda,
salt
and butter.
Press 3/4 of mixture into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake	at
350° for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with
chocolate chips and nuts.
Drizzle caramel over top. Crumble remaining crumb mixture and bake 12 more minutes at 350°.

title: Italian Ice
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth and pour into plastic container.
Freeze for several hours or overnight before serving.

title: Apple Nut Cake
instructions: Combine oil and sugar; beat on high for 3 minutes.
Add eggs and vanilla and blend; sift flour, salt and baking soda.
Add sifted mixture to egg mixture.
Add nuts and apples.
Grease a 10-inch tube pan well; bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Cool in pan 10 minutes; invert on rack.

title: Apple Pie Candied Crust
instructions: Slice apples directly into pie plate.
Mix remaining ingredients to a crumbly consistency and spread on top of apples. Bake for 1 hour at 350°.

title: Country Cottage Bake
instructions: Prepare dinner as directed on package, except use only 1/2 cup milk.
Add cottage cheese and celery, mix lightly.
Spoon into 10 x 6-inch baking dish.
Arrange sausage links on top of dinner mixture.
Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
Yields 4 to 6 servings.

title: Potluck Vegetable Casserole
instructions: Drain whole kernel corn, cooked cauliflower, cooked broccoli and mushrooms.
Cut up large pieces of cauliflower.
Combine cream-style corn, cheese and soup.
Fold in drained vegetables. Turn into a 12 x 7 1/2 x 2-inch baking dish.
Melt butter.
Toss with crumbs.
Sprinkle atop mixture.
Bake uncovered in a 375° oven 30 to 35 minutes or until hot.
Serves 12 to 15.

title: Potato Smoked Sausage Casserole
instructions: Pare and slice enough potatoes to equal 2 cups; set aside. Cook onion in 1/4 cup margarine until tender.
Blend in flour and seasonings.
Gradually add milk, stirring until smooth.
Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture is slightly thickened.
Place half of sausage in bottom of 2-quart ovenproof casserole.
Add half of potatoes, half of peas and half of sauce.
Repeat layers with remaining ingredients, ending with sauce.
Combine crumbs and margarine; sprinkle over sauce.
Bake at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes or until crumbs are lightly browned.
Makes 4 servings.

title: Chocolate Sheet Cake
instructions: Sift flour with sugar and cocoa.
Combine margarine, water and oil in saucepan; bring to a boil and pour over flour mixture. Combine buttermilk in which soda has been dissolved with eggs and vanilla.
Add to mixture; beat well.
Pour into 11 x 16-inch baking pan.
Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.

title: Chicken Kabobs
instructions: Combine first 3 ingredients.
Cut chicken into 1/2-inch chunks and place in marmalade for approximately 6 to 8 hours.
Wrap each chicken chunk with 1/2 slice of bacon.
Thread chicken, mushrooms and onions on shish-kabob skewers alternating chicken, mushrooms and onions.
Cook 30 to 35 minutes, baste while cooking with leftover marmalade.

title: Best Bran Muffins
instructions: Add baking soda to boiling water and set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs, flour, buttermilk, salt and water.
Mix well, then add remaining ingredients.
Bake at 375° for 20 minutes.
Refrigerate dough up to 6 weeks in covered bowl. Do not stir.
Makes 72 muffins.

title: Tomato And Pear Chutney
instructions: Mix all ingredients except pimentos.
Boil slowly for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Add pimentos; boil for 5 minutes more. Pack into jars and seal.

title: Queen Of Hearts Tarts
instructions: Cream together thoroughly the butter and sugar.
Stir in the egg yolk and vanilla.
Sift together the flour and salt and add to creamed mixture.
Mix well.
Shape into 3 dozen small balls and dip each into unbeaten egg white.
Roll in chopped nuts (pecans or peanuts) and place 2 inches apart on lightly greased cookie sheet. Do not flatten balls.
Bake at 300° for 30 minutes.
After baking 10 minutes, remove pan from oven and with a thimble, make a dent into each cookie.
Return pan to oven.
Work as quickly as possible and if the thimble sticks, dip into cold water.
When cookies are done, remove to cooling rack and fill each dent, while warm, with jam or marmalade.
A tart jam is best (plum, apricot or pineapple).

title: Brown Rice #3
instructions: Brown onions in margarine.
Add to remaining ingredients. Pour into casserole dish.
Cover and bake at 250° for 1 hour.

title: Mom'S Cake
instructions: Cream shortening and sugar.
Beat in whole egg and 2 egg yolks.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt.
Combine 2 mixtures; blend.
Grease and flour 13 x 9-inch pan.
Sprinkle nuts, chocolate pieces and marshmallows over batter.
Beat 2 egg whites very stiff.
Fold in brown sugar.
Spread over cake.
Bake 30 to 40 minutes.

title: Reuben Dip
instructions: Heat all in pan.
Thin with milk if necessary.
Serve warm with rye or pumpernickel crackers.

title: Snack Crackers
instructions: Combine crackers and dressing mix; drizzle oil over top and just blend.
Stir occasionally until oil is absorbed.
You may add tiny pretzels, little fish or Rice Chex to make a party mix.

title: Hawaiian Delight
instructions: Let jello start to jell; mix in drained pineapple.
Then add banana slices.
Mix well.
Let jell, then top with Cool Whip.

title: Veggie Appetizer
instructions: Pat out crescent rolls in 9 x 13-inch pan to make crust.
Bake as directed; let cool.
Top with room temperature cream cheese, buttermilk dressing and dill weed.
Spread over cooled crescent rolls.
Top with chopped vegetables, then grated cheese.
Chill 1 hour.
Serves 24.

title: Chicken And Rice Casserole
instructions: Pour rice into buttered casserole dish; sprinkle with soup mix.
Add water.
Place chicken pieces on top.
Pour soup over chicken.
Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
Serves 4.

title: Easy Chicken And Rice Casserole
instructions: Put rice in 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix all liquids together.
Pour 1/2 of liquids over rice and mix well.
Place chicken, uncovered, on top of rice.
Cover with remaining liquids.
Sprinkle cheese and almonds on top.
Bake at 350°, uncovered, for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

title: Millionaires Pie
instructions: Mix Eagle
Brand
milk and lemon juice.
Add Cool Whip, pineapple and nuts.
Pour into graham cracker crust.

title: Chicken Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Cook broccoli in water in a covered saucepan or microwave until crisp-tender; drain. Place broccoli in a greased 11 x 7 x 2-inch (2-quart) baking dish; set aside. Combine chicken, soup, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese and curry powder; spoon over broccoli. Top with bread cubes and butter. Bake chicken casserole, uncovered, at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until heated through. Chicken casserole serves 4.

title: Vegetable Burritos(Low-Fat)
instructions: Cook mushrooms, onion, green pepper and garlic in olive oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium high heat, stirring constantly until tender.
Remove from heat; drain.
Combine cooked vegetables, drained kidney beans, olives and pepper.
Spoon about 1/2 cup bean mixture evenly down center of each tortilla. Top with 1 tablespoon sour cream, 1 tablespoon salsa and 1 tablespoon cheese; fold opposite sides over filling.
Coat a large nonstick skillet or griddle with cooking spray.
Heat over medium-high heat until hot.
Cook tortilla, seam side down, 1 minute on each side or until thoroughly heated.
Top each tortilla with 1 tablespoon salsa.

title: Hot Rolls
instructions: Dissolve yeast in 1 cup warm water, 1 more cup water. Mix and let rise in double size, then knead down and put in rolls. Let rise until double in size. Bake in 350° oven until golden brown. Brush with butter.

title: Chocolate Biscotti
instructions: At medium speed beat sugar and butter.
Add 1 c. flour and then the rest of the ingredients.
Add the other 1 1/2 c. flour.
Pat dough into 2 (12x3) loaves.
Bake on cookie sheet for 25-30 minutes at 350°.
Remove and cool for 20 minutes.
Remove loaves to a cutting board and cut slices about 1/2-inch wide into cookies. Place flat on a cookie sheet and bake again at 350° for 20 minutes. Cool completely.
Melt chocolate in a double boiler and brush each cookie with the chocolate and sprinkle with the chopped almonds.

title: Corn Bake
instructions: Combine all ingredients in 9 x 13-inch baking dish, sprayed with Pam.
Mix well.
Bake at 400° for 45 minutes or until golden brown ontop.

title: Praline Pound Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.
Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan. Sprinkle 1/2 cup chopped pecans in pan.
Set aside.
Cream the butter or margarine and cream cheese.
Add brown sugar and cream until light and fluffy (about 5 minutes).
Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Fold in flour just until combined.
Do not overmix.
Stir in vanilla and remaining 1 cup chopped pecans.
Spoon batter into prepared pan and place on baking sheet in oven.
Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until wooden toothpick inserted near center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove to rack to cool completely.
Yields 16 servings.

title: Easy Pizza
instructions: Spread biscuits on bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Spread sour cream over biscuits.
Brown hamburger with onion, Italian seasoning to taste, salt and pepper to taste.
Drain and pour over sour cream.
Add tomato sauce and top with Mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Easter Bread
instructions: Combine warm water, 1 tablespoon sugar and yeast; let stand for 15 minutes.
Combine remaining sugar and rest of ingredients in large mixing bowl.
Add yeast mixture.
Knead and turn dough until it becomes dry and springy when pushed down.
Fold dough over; sprinkle with a small amount of flour.
Cover; let rise in a warm place for 3 hours or until doubled in bulk.
Knead again; let rise for 1 hour.
Shape dough into 7 round loaves; cover.
Let rise for 2 hours.
Brush top of loaves with additional beaten egg. Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes.

title: 7-Up Pound Cake
instructions: Cream together first 3 ingredients.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Add flour.
Fold in 7-Up and vanilla.
Pour into a greased and floured tube pan and bake for 1 hour at 300°.
Test for doneness before removing from oven.

title: Caramel Brie With Fresh Fruit
instructions: Place Brie on large serving plate.
Melt butter and brown sugar in saucepan; add corn syrup and flour, stirring well. Bring to boil; reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat; cool to lukewarm.
Gradually stir in milk.
Pour caramel over Brie.
Sprinkle with pecans.
Combine lemon juice and water.
Toss with fruit wedges.
Drain.
Arrange around fruit.

title: Asparagus Casserole
instructions: Drain asparagus, reserving liquid.
Melt butter; blend in flour, salt and pepper.
Add evaporated milk to asparagus liquid (enough to make 1 1/2 cups.)
Stir into flour mixture; blend until smooth.
Cook 2 minutes.
Spread asparagus in bottom of greased shallow 1 1/2-quart casserole.
Reserve a few asparagus spears for top.
Sprinkle half cracker crumbs over asparagus.
Add eggs and half of sauce.
Sprinkle with remaining crumbs.
Arrange rest of asparagus spears over top.
Pour remaining sauce over top. Sprinkle with grated cheese.
Bake in 350° oven about 30 minutes or until casserole is bubbly.

title: Chocolate Clair Cake
instructions: In saucepan, bring water and butter to the boil until all butter is melted.
All at once, add flour and salt; beat until mixture forms a ball that leaves the sides of the saucepan.
Cool slightly.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating thoroughly after each addition.
Spread pastry mixture onto an ungreased jellyroll pan or cookie sheet.
Bake in 400° oven for 35 minutes.
Remove from oven; pierce bubbles with fork while hot.
Cool completely.

title: Black Bean Soup
instructions: Soak the beans overnight; drain.
Add the water.
Add the cloves, bay leaf, garlic, celery, carrot and onion.
Cook slowly for 3 hours.
Mash beans.
Add the beef broth.
Combine the flour and melted butter; add to soup.
Add the sherry wine to taste. Adjust seasoning.
Serve with slice of lemon.

title: Deer Jerky
instructions: Cut meat into strips.
Combine ingredients to create a marinating sauce.
Marinate meat for 12 to 24 hours in refrigerator.
Hang strips of meat on toothpicks on oven rack. Cook at 150° with oven door cracked open 1-inch for 3 to 6 hours.

title: Raspberry Cake
instructions: Follow directions on cake mix for two 8-inch or 9-inch layers. Allow cakes to cool.
Whip one container of cream, 1 tablespoon of sugar and 1 teaspoon of extract.
Use a serrated knife to cut each cake into two layers.
Line a 2 1/2-quart bowl with plastic wrap. Place one layer in bowl and spread 3 tablespoons of jam over layer and then 1/3 of whipped cream over jam.
Repeat until all layers are used.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap while pressing down layers. Chill in refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
Whip second container of cream with remaining sugar and extract and a few drops of food coloring.
Invert cake onto plate and cover with whipped cream.

title: Brownie Cake
instructions: Sift together sugar and flour.
Bring to a boil the oleo, cocoa and water.
Add milk, soda and vanilla.
Add to flour mixture.
Add eggs and beat.
Bake in greased and floured jelly roll pan (16 x 11 x 1 1/2-inch) at 400° for 20 minutes.
While still hot, spread on icing.

title: Sesame Chicken
instructions: Cut chicken wings in half at the joint and cut off wing tips. Blend the next 5 ingredients in processor.
Pour over chicken and marinate overnight.
Remove chicken from marinade; pour egg into marinade.
Combine bread crumbs and sesame seed.
Dip chicken into crumb mixture; set them in a buttered baking dish.
Pour melted butter over and bake at 400° for 40 to 50 minutes.

title: Shepherd'S Pie
instructions: Cook ground sirloin in skillet; drain fat.
While meat is cooking, peel and quarter potatoes.
Place in large pot of water and boil for 25 to 30 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and mash using small amount of milk, butter, salt and pepper.
Dice onion.
Add onion to meat after it has been drained.
Cook a little longer and add the soup and sweet peas.
Mix altogether in skillet.
Put meat mixture in casserole dish.
Place mashed potatoes on top of meat. Do not mix.
Place in broiler to brown tops of mashed potatoes. Enjoy.

title: English Muffin Bread
instructions: Combine 3 cups flour, yeast, sugar, salt and baking soda.
Heat liquids until very warm (120-130 degrees F).
Add to dry mixture, beat well.
Stir in enough flour to make a stiff batter.
Spoon into 2 (8 1/2 x 4 1/2) pans that have been greased and sprinkled with cornmeal.
Sprinkle tops with cornmeal.
Cover and let rise in warm place for 45 minutes.
Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes. Remove from pans immediately and cool on racks.

title: Delicious Vegetable Dip
instructions: Mix ingredients in a large bowl.
Then serve with fresh vegetables.
Mixture is best made day before and refrigerated overnight.

title: Oven Roasted Ribs
instructions: Saute onion in butter.
Add all other ingredients.
Simmer 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Can be refrigerated up to 2 weeks.
Preheat oven to 450°.
Salt and pepper ribs; place on rack and pour 3 cups water in pan.
Bake 30 minutes.
Pour out water; reduce heat to 300°.
Brush ribs with Vera's Barbecue Sauce.
Bake 25 minutes.
Turn; baste with sauce and bake 20 minutes.
Broil a few minutes on each side before serving.

title: Corn Bread
instructions: Heat oven to 425°.
Grease small baking pan.
Blend all ingredients about 20 seconds.
Beat 1 minute.
Pour into pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes.

title: Pudding Puzzle Cake
instructions: Heat oven to 325°.
Grease six 6-ounce custard cups.
In saucepan, melt butter and chocolate, stirring until blended and smooth.
Remove from heat.
In bowl, combine flour, 1/2 cup sugar and baking powder; stir in milk, vanilla and chocolate mixture. Blend thoroughly.
Spoon batter into custard cups.

title: Mississippi Mud Cake
instructions: Sift the flour, sugar and salt.
Put the margarine, water and cocoa in a saucepan; heat to boiling.
Pour over flour mixture and mix.
Beat the eggs.
Add the soda, buttermilk and vanilla, then add to cocoa mixture.
Pour onto greased cookie sheet; bake for 20 to 25 minutes at 350°.

title: Spat-Alls
instructions: Combine ingredients and drop by teaspoon into boiling salted water. Cook 20 minutes.
Drain and add butter.

title: Seafood Macaroni Salad
instructions: Cut large size shrimp into bite sized pieces.
Sprinkle with lemon juice.
Mix all ingredients together.
Chill.
Serve on salad greens.
Garnish with tomato wedges.
Serves 12 to 15.

title: Jello Jigglers
instructions: Mix boiling water and Jell-O and let cool until room temperature.
Then add milk and pudding.
Put in 9 x 13-inch pan. Refrigerate.
Cut into squares.

title: Frosted Molasses Creams
instructions: Thoroughly cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs and molasses. Mix well.
Add coffee, then sifted dry ingredients.
Beat until smooth.
Pour into greased pan (12 x 18-inch).
Bake in moderate oven (350°) for 25 minutes or until done.
While still warm, frost with confectioners sugar and butter or confectioners sugar with a little spoon of milk.
Cool and cut in squares.

title: Lemon Cake
instructions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, lemon extract, flour and 7-Up.
Grease and flour Bundt pan very good.
Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes at 325°.
Do not underbake.
Make sure all ingredients are room temperature.

title: Baking Powder Biscuits
instructions: Heat oven to 450°.
Cut shortening into flour, baking powder and salt with pastry blender until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Stir in just enough milk so dough leaves side of bowl and rounds up into a ball.
Turn dough onto lightly floured surface.
Knead lightly 10 times.
Roll 1/2-inch thick.
Cut with floured 2-inch biscuit cutter.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet about 1 inch apart for crusty sides, touching for soft sides.
Bake until golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes.
Immediately remove from cookie sheet.
Makes about 1 dozen biscuits.

title: Punch
instructions: Mix first five ingredients.
Add ginger ale and soda water last.
Makes 40 to 50 (4 ounce) cups.

title: Crock-Pot Pepper Steak
instructions: Slice steak into narrow strips.
In skillet, brown steak in oil.
Combine with garlic, salt, pepper, soy sauce and sugar in crock-pot.
Cook on low 6 to 8 hours.
Turn control to high.
Add bean sprouts, tomatoes and green peppers.
Dissolve cornstarch in water and stir into pot.
Cover and cook on high 15 to 20 minutes. Serves 4.

title: Gina'S Ranch Crackers
instructions: Throw all ingredients in covered bowl and shake to mix well. Then shake again.
Let marinate in fridge overnight.

title: Cherry Cream Cheese Crescents
instructions: Soften cream cheese.
Mix sugar, vanilla, egg and cream cheese in medium mixing bowl.
Place 1 roll of crescents in 9 x 13-inch pan.
Press in firmly.
Spread cream cheese mixture over crescents.
Spread cherry pie filling over cream cheese mixture. Place last roll of crescents over top.
No need to pat down. Bake at 350° until top is golden brown.
Cool, chill and serve.

title: Pasta Salad
instructions: Boil snow peas and broccoli 1 minute each; drain.
Combine peas, broccoli, tomatoes, olives and mushrooms in large bowl. Cook pasta according to directions, drain and cool.
Mix pasta and vegetables together with cheese and dressing.

title: Mandarin Salad
instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a jar.
Shake well.
Pour over lettuce and other ingredients in a large salad bowl.
Toss and serve.
Makes 4 to 6 servings.

title: Mississippi Mud Cake
instructions: When cake is cool, mix icing and put over Marshmallow Creme.

title: Pumpkin Pies(For Diabetics)
instructions: Beat pumpkin, evaporated milk and eggs, then beat in remaining ingredients. Pour into 9-inch pastry shell. Bake in 425° oven for 15 minutes; reduce heat to 350° and bake about 40 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes our clean.

title: Fruit Salad
instructions: Mix together; add salad dressing.

title: Chocolate Chip Butter Cookies
instructions: Cream together oleo and sugar. Add salt, vanilla and flour. Mix until blended. Mixture will be stiff. Stir in chocolate chips. Roll into balls (3/4 inch) and flatten with a fork. Bake at 350° about 12 to 13 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

title: Crock-Pot Pork Chops And Stuffing
instructions: Prepare Stove Top stuffing by mixing all ingredients together. Place stuffing in bottom of crock-pot.
Brown and season pork chops to taste.
Place pork chops on top of stuffing.
Cover and cook on low until meat is tender, 2 to 3 hours.

title: Glazed Pecans
instructions: 1st bowl - Combine water and egg white and beat until frothy but not stiff. 2nd bowl- Mix together sugar, salt, and cinnamon; set aside.
Preheat oven to 300 degrees.
Pour pecans into egg white and stir with a large serving spoon until the nuts are evenly coated.
Add sugar mixture.
Spread on large cookie sheet that has been sprayed with Pam and bake at 300 degrees for 30 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes-including after the last 15 minutes. Pour onto waxed paper until cooled.
Store in an airtight container.

title: Fancy Rice
instructions: Saute onion, garlic, celery and mushrooms together in margarine until vegetables are tender.
Add other ingredients. Heat to boiling; stir occasionally.
Reduce heat to low.
Cover and simmer 14 minutes.
Fluff with fork.
Cover and let stand 5 to 10 minutes.
Garnish with parsley.

title: Pound Cake
instructions: Beat butter at room temperature.
Beat eggs and mix.
Add sugar, flour and flavoring, beat.
Pour in a tube pan, well-greased.
Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes at 350°.

title: Salmon Cakes Deluxe
instructions: Drain juice from salmon into a bowl.
Set salmon aside.
Add bread crumbs to juice; let stand until thick.
Stir next 6 ingredients and mix well.
Add salmon and stir.
Makes 6 or 7 cakes.
Fry as you would crab cakes.

title: Hot Chicken Salad
instructions: Combine all ingredients except cheese, potato chips and almonds.
Place in large rectangular dish.
Top with cheese, chips and almonds.
Let stand overnight in refrigerator.
Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes.

title: Pony'S Chocolate Pudding
instructions: In heavy boiler, combine flour, cocoa, sugar, egg yolks, milk and water.
Cook on medium heat until thickened; stir constantly. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla flavoring.
Put vanilla wafers in 2 to 2 1/2-quart ovenproof bowl.
Pour cooked mixture over vanilla wafers. Beat egg whites stiff.
Add 1/2 teaspoon flavoring and 1/2 cup sugar.
Spread on top of pudding.
Top brown in oven.
Watch carefully to keep from burning.

title: Black Bottom Banana Bars
instructions: In mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.
Add egg and vanilla. Beat until thoroughly combined.
Blend in the bananas.
Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Add to creamed mixture and mix well.

title: Shrimp Creole
instructions: Cook onion, celery and green pepper in butter until tender, stir in tomato sauce, water and seasonings.
Simmer 10 minutes. Add shrimp.
Cook 10 to 20 minutes.
Serve over hot cooked rice. Yields 6 servings.

title: Cauliflower Carrot Salad
instructions: Clean cauliflower.
Cut into flowerets.
Peel and slice carrots.
Mix Miracle Whip, sugar, vinegar, salt and pepper to taste.
Add cauliflower and carrots.
Mix until well coated.
Add a couple shakes of Parmesan cheese.

title: Mexican Casserole
instructions: In a large casserole dish, layer crushed chips.
Mix one container sour cream, olives, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup and green chilies together; heat.
Layer over chips. Layer in chicken and some cheese.
Add sour cream, more olives and chilies.
Top with cheese.
Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes. Feeds 6 to 8.

title: Barbecups
instructions: Brown beef in a large skillet; drain.
Add barbecue sauce, onion and brown sugar.
Separate biscuits into muffin tin to make a cup.
Spoon meat into each cup.
Sprinkle cheese on top.
Bake at 400° for 10 to 12 minutes.

title: Drop Cookies
instructions: Cream together shortening and sugar; add beaten eggs and blend thoroughly.
Add baking powder and salt to flour and sift.
Add alternately with milk to creamed mixture.
Add nuts and milk only enough to blend.
Drop by teaspoons onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 400° for about 10 minutes.

title: Season'S Greeting Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients, chill and serve.

title: Party Style Hot Chicken
instructions: Combine ingredients; put in greased casserole.
Put in 1 cup potato chips on top.
Cover chips with 1/2 cup grated cheese. Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 450°.
Should be bubbly.

title: Mrs. Whitten'S Happi Time Punch
instructions: Use green food coloring and red cherries for a festive air.

title: Vegetable Pizza
instructions: Line round cookie sheet with crescent roll dough.
Cook according to package directions.
With mixer, combine cream cheese, sour cream and Ranch dressing.
Cool crust and spread with cream cheese mixture. Top with vegetables and cheese.

title: Barbecued Chicken Wings
instructions: Place wings in single layer on baking pan.
Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a simmer.
Pour over wings and bake at 350° 1 hour.
Pan may be covered for first 20 minutes of baking.

title: Butterscotch Brownies
instructions: Mix all ingredients together. Then pour into a brownie pan and bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

title: Coconut Balls
instructions: Melt margarine. Add sugar, milk, coconut and pecans.
Mix well.
Roll into quarter size balls.
Place in freezer overnight or until real firm.
Melt chocolate chips and paraffin in double boiler.
Dip frozen candies in mixture.

title: Patio Potato Salad
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine milk, sugar, vinegar, 1 egg, butter, cornstarch, salt, celery seed and dry mustard.
Cook and stir over low heat until thickened.
Remove from heat; blend in onion and mayonnaise.
Cool.
Combine potatoes and hard-cooked eggs; carefully fold in dressing.
Chill.
Just before serving, sprinkle with paprika.
Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: Meringue - Pillsbury
instructions: In a small pan, cook 2 tablespoons sugar, cornstarch and water until clear and thick; set aside and cool.
Beat the egg whites until stiff.
Combine the salt, vanilla and 6 tablespoons sugar; add gradually to egg whites.
Add cornstarch mixture; mix until thick and stands in a peak.
Be sure to cover dessert completely so that meringue mixture touches and seals edge of crust.
Cook at 250° until slightly brown.

title: Paula'S Chili And Beans
instructions: Mix all ingredients and bake for 30 minutes at 350°.

title: Microwave Cherry Crunch
instructions: Pour pie filling in oblong Pyrex baking dish.
Sprinkle cake mix over pie filling.
Pat mix into cherries.
Sprinkle brown sugar and a little cinnamon over that.
Dot with margarine and sprinkle nuts on top.
Cover with wax paper and microwave on High for 14 minutes.

title: Carrot Bread
instructions: Cream eggs, sugar and oil together.
Mix in remaining ingredients.
Bake for 80 minutes at 325° in a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch bread pan.

title: Ranch-Spinach Dip
instructions: Combine ingredients.
Chill for at least 1 hour.
Serve in hollowed out round bread loaf.

title: Banana Loaf Cake
instructions: Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, well beaten.
Add flour with baking powder.
Sift in.
Add milk and soda mixture.
Add 4 mashed bananas and vanilla.
Bake at 350°.
Do not grease pan.

title: Oceania Chicken
instructions: Mix flour, salt and seasonings.
Coat chicken.
Put chicken in buttered pan.
Combine syrup from pineapple with soy sauce and sugar.
Pour over chicken and cover.
Baste occasionally.
Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Add pineapple slices 15 minutes before done.
Serves 4 to 6.

title: Shrimp Curry
instructions: Prepare patty shells according to package directions.

title: Summer Punch
instructions: In a large pitcher or punch bowl, combine all except sherbet. Stir until all juices are thawed and blended.
Top with scoop of sherbet, if desired.
Makes 18 (4 ounce) servings.

title: Stuffed Peppers
instructions: Cook rice; mix hamburger and rice.
Cut top off green peppers. Stuff rice and ground beef in peppers.
Pour tomato sauce over peppers and bake.
Stuffs about 6 green peppers.

title: Zucchini Casserole
instructions: Steam zucchini, onion and carrots for 5 minutes.
Drain well. Combine soup and sour cream.
Stir in zucchini mixture.
Spread 1/2 of the stuffing mixture on bottom of greased casserole dish. Spoon in zucchini and top with remainder of stuffing.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until bubbly.

title: Cinnamon Rolls
