instructions: Divide dough and roll out on floured table until 1/4 inch in depth.
Spread with melted butter, Land of Lakes is best, and sprinkle brown sugar and cinnamon to cover.
Roll dough up and cut into 3/4 inch slices or larger if desired.
Place on a buttered pan, butter tops and let rise until doubled.
Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes, or golden brown.
Take out immediately and invert on another pan.

title: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: In bowl, combine dry ingredients.
Stir in eggs and bananas. Add melted shortening and nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan and bake 45 to 60 minutes in 325° oven.

title: Pork Pie
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and put in a pastry crust.
Put crust on top.
Bake at 400° for 30 to 40 minutes, or until crust is the same as any pie crust.

title: Chicken Gumbo
instructions: Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper.
Dredge with flour. Fry (saute) in pork fat.
Remove chicken.
Fry onion in fat remaining in pan; add okra, parsley or pimiento and red pepper. Cook slowly 15 minutes.
Add to chicken with tomatoes, water and 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt.
Cook slowly until chicken is tender and add rice.

title: Frosted Deviled Ham
instructions: Mix deviled ham and onion.
Mound mixture on plate.
Mix remaining ingredients.
Frost ham mound with cream cheese mixture. Refrigerate overnight.

title: Fresh Apple Cake(Delicious)
instructions: Blend together the sugar, oil and eggs.
Add the apples, nuts and raisins.
Add the remaining ingredients.
Bake in oblong 13 x 9-inch pan for 1 hour at 325° to 350°.
Can be baked in 6 small pans at 325° for 35 to 40 minutes.

title: Swedish Meatballs
instructions: Mix together beef, chicken rice soup, onions, bread crumbs, egg and seasonings.
Form into balls.
Brown on all sides in small amount of oil.
Place in a baking pan.
Add blend of mushroom soup and water.
Cover and bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
Uncover and bake 20 minutes more.

title: Instant Potato Bake
instructions: Prepare potatoes as directed on package, except skimp on milk.
Add onions, cottage cheese and sour cream.
Mix well and place in baking dish.
Put lots of butter and paprika on top. Bake until hot.

title: Pita Bread
instructions: Mix ingredients together and add more flour if necessary.
Make into 2 balls.
Knead each ball, then divide into 12 smaller balls. Cover.
Let rise about 30 to 40 minutes.
Flatten balls to about 6 inches in diameter with rolling pin on a lightly floured board. Cover and let rise slightly.
Flip the dough so that the bottom side of the bread dough is on the top side of baking sheets. Preheat oven as hot as it bakes.
Place sheet on lowest rack.
Bake about 2 to 4 minutes.
Makes 24 pita breads.

title: Cocktail Meatballs
instructions: Mix hamburger, garlic powder and garlic clove.
Shape into small balls.
Pan-fry until well cooked; drain.
Mix barbecue sauce and jelly.
Add meatballs.
Heat mixture on medium heat, then reduce to low heat.

title: Pecan Pie
instructions: Brown butter in skillet to develop the rich flavor; remove from fire, add sugar and beat in the whole eggs one at a time.
Add syrup and nuts.
Add 1 tsp. vanilla if desired.
Pour into uncooked pastry.
Bake at 375° for 40-50 minutes, until custard sets and is browned.
Makes 1 large or 2 small pies.

title: Baked Macaroni And Cheese
instructions: Grease a 2-quart baking dish.
Prepare elbow macaroni according to directions.
(Undercook a bit, since the macaroni will be baked with liquid later.)
Simmer stewed tomatoes and onion.
Preheat oven to 350°.
Mix macaroni, tomatoes, onion and most of the grated cheese.
(Save some to sprinkle as a topping.)
Season to taste. Pour mixture into baking dish.
Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. (Dot with margarine or butter, if desired.)
Bake approximately 1/2 hour until bubbles and golden brown.

title: Stuffed Green Peppers
instructions: Wash peppers, cut a thin slice from stem end and remove seeds. Cover with boiling salted water and simmer 5 minutes.
Drain.

title: Fabulous Fruit Dip
instructions: Mix ingredients until creamed.
There may be a few lumps of cream cheese but that's okay.
With an assortment of fruits, dip in!
(Best if refrigerated overnight.)

title: Corn Bread
instructions: Mix corn meal, flour, baking powder, sugar and salt.
Beat eggs; add milk and stir into corn meal mixture.
Heat fat in a 9 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan in a preheated 425° oven until hot.
Tilt pan to coat with fat, then pour off and stir excess fat into batter.
Pour batter into pan and bake for 25 minutes or until bread pulls away from sides of pan.
Cut into squares and serve hot with butter.
Makes 9 servings.

title: King Ranch Casserole
instructions: Mix all ingredients, except cheese and tortillas. Dip tortillas in reserved chicken broth and line casserole dish. Add layer of chicken mixture, top with cheese. Add another layer of tortillas, etc. until dish is filled, ending with a layer of cheese.

title: Easy Cobbler
instructions: Melt margarine in bottom of Pyrex pan.
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and milk and pour into pan.
Top with fruit.
Bake at 325° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: Sliced Baked Potatoes
instructions: Peel potatoes if the skin is tough; otherwise, just scrub and rinse.
Cut potatoes into thin slices, but not all the way through.
Use a handle to prevent cutting through the potatoes. Put potatoes in baking dish.
Sprinkle with salt and drizzle with butter.
Sprinkle with herbs.
Bake at 425° for 50 minutes. Remove from oven.
Sprinkle with cheeses.
Bake for another 10 to 15 minutes until lightly browned and cheeses are melted.

title: Taco Salad
instructions: Brown ground beef; add taco seasoning.
Simmer.
Chop tomato and lettuce; shred cheese.
Put crushed Doritos on plate.
Add meat, then top with salad.
Picante sauce or sour cream can be used as topping.

title: Pepperoni Bread
instructions: Roll dough out into an oblong shape.
Layer pepperoni, American and Provolone cheeses alternately.
Best if cheeses are layed out first, then pepperoni and then cheeses again.
Roll up and seal edges.
Brush with egg white.
Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes.

title: Banana Split Dessert
instructions: Combine graham crackers and 1 1/4 sticks butter.
Press into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Combine sugar with remaining butter and layer on top of crust.
Cut up bananas and place on top of crust.
Spread pineapple over bananas.
Spread Cool Whip on top.
Spoon chocolate syrup over top.
Sprinkle with nuts.
(If you make the night before, soak bananas in pineapple juice before putting on crust.)

title: President Clinton'S Lemon Chess Pie
instructions: In a large bowl, toss sugar, flour and cornmeal with a fork. Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour into pie shell and bake at 450° for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350° and bake for 30 minutes.
Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled.

title: Oven Beef Stew
instructions: Shake meat in soup mix, salt and paprika.
Put in baking dish. Set oven at 350°.
Arrange vegetables around meat.
Mix catsup and soup.
Pour over all ingredients.
Cover with foil and cook about 3 hours.

title: Lemon Meringue Pie
instructions: Combine 1 cup sugar, flour, cornstarch and salt in double boiler; add boiling water, stirring constantly.
Cover and cook 15 minutes.
Beat egg yolks with 1/2 cup sugar and gradually pour hot mixture over this, while stirring.
Return to double boiler and cook 5 minutes longer.
Just before removing from heat, add lemon juice and rind.
Mix well.
Cool.
Pour into pie shell.
Top with meringue.

title: Brown Sugar Baked Oats
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a 9 x 9-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: Red Velvet Cake
instructions: Mix all ingredients except food coloring.
Add food coloring last.
Makes 3 layers. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Wassail
instructions: Place spices in a spice bag.
Combine all juices and simmer with spice bag.

title: Turkey Chili
instructions: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, in hot salad oil, cook turkey, onion and garlic until all pan juices evaporate and turkey is well browned, stirring frequently.
Stir in chili powder and cook 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes with their liquid, water, salt, sugar and crushed red pepper.
Over high heat, heat to boiling.
Reduce heat to low.
Simmer uncovered 10 minutes to blend flavors.
Gently stir in kidney beans and heat through.

title: Sadie'S Pretzel Salad
instructions: Mix these 3 ingredients and set aside for 10 minutes.
Pour over all the other ingredients and let cool.

title: Hot Chicken Salad
instructions: Combine all ingredients except 1/2 cup crumbs for top.
Toss gently.
Spoon into 1 1/2-quart casserole.
Bake at 375° for 15 minutes.
Sprinkle cracker crumbs on top and bake 15 minutes longer.
Yields 4 to 6 servings.

title: Nevada Beans
instructions: Cook bacon and onion about 10 minutes.
Combine with rest of ingredients and pour into greased 2 quart casserole.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 1 hour.
Makes 10 to 12 servings.

title: Good Baked Beans
instructions: Brown hamburger or sausage, whichever you choose.
Drain. Add pork and beans and onion; simmer 10 minutes.
Good over cooked rice or mashed potatoes or biscuits.

title: Corn Casserole
instructions: Mix and bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.

title: Speedy Apple Crisp
instructions: Spread apples in a 9 x 9-inch baking pan.
Cut butter into remaining ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over apples.
Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes or until apples are tender and topping is golden.
Serve warm.
Yields 5 to 6 servings.

title: Low-Fat Brownies
instructions: Combine box mix, yogurt and egg whites.
Place in 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake for 22 to 24 minutes at 350°.

title: Baked Limas
instructions: Combine all ingredients except beans and bacon, mixing well until sugar is dissolved.
Gently stir in beans (with juice) and place in oblong baking dish.
Layer bacon across top.
Bake at 300° for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven; turn bacon slices and spoon off grease.
Return to oven and bake 45 minutes longer.

title: Grape Jello Dessert
instructions: Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water.
Add remaining ingredients and pour into pan.
Chill until set.

title: Beer Bread
instructions: Mix flour, warm beer and sugar together; do not knead.
Put into a greased 4 1/2 x 9-inch loaf pan.
Melt butter and pour over bread after baked.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes, then turn out of pan.
Serve and enjoy.

title: Zucchini Pineapple Bread
instructions: Heat oven to 325°.
Grease bottom only of a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, oats, baking powder, cinnamon and salt; mix well.
In a large bowl, combine zucchini, brown sugar, eggs, vegetable oil and crushed pineapple.
Mix well. Add the flour mixture, mixing just until dry ingredients are moistened.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake 1 hour.
Cover loosely with foil and continue baking 25 to 30 minutes or until wooden pick inserted comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes.
Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

title: Spicy Shrimp
instructions: Coat shrimp lightly with flour.
Melt margarine in large skillet on medium heat.
Add shrimp; cook and stir 5 minutes or until lightly browned, turning frequently.
Mix chili sauce, parsley, lemon juice, mustard and pepper.
Pour over shrimp; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low; simmer 5 minutes.

title: Cabbage Casserole
instructions: Cook cabbage and onion until tender and drain water. Place cooked cabbage in casserole dish sprayed with Pam. In a bowl, mix soup, mayonnaise and salt and pepper. Pour over cabbage. In another bowl, mix crushed Ritz crackers, butter and cheese. Spread over cabbage and soup mixture. Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes or until golden brown. Do not overbake or cheese gets too brown.

title: French Silk Chocolate Pie
instructions: Melt chocolate and set aside to cool.
Using electric mixer at medium speed to cream butter, add sugar gradually.
Blend chocolate in.
Add vanilla.
Mix well, then add eggs one at a time, beating 5 minutes after each egg.
Pour into pie shell and chill.
Top with Cool Whip and chocolate shavings, if desired.

title: Self-Iced Cake
instructions: Combine dates, water and soda; let stand until cool.
Cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs and beat well.
Slowly add flour, salt and cream of tartar.
Stir until well blended.
Add date mixture; mix well.
Pour into a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts over top of cake.
Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes.
Cool.

title: Summer Squash Patties
instructions: Combine first 6 ingredients, beating until smooth. Stir in squash; add onion and pepper. Drop by tablespoon into a hot greased skillet. Cook until golden brown, turning once. Drain. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: Easy Baked Beans
instructions: Saute onion in stock until tender; add to beans.
Bake at 350° for 2 hours.
(May add additional apple juice and 2 teaspoons ketchup.)

title: Microwave Baked Lima Beans
instructions: You will need a 3-quart microwave-safe casserole.

title: "Knock Your Socks Off" Raisin Bread
instructions: Dissolve yeast and honey in water.
Heat milk with butter and pour into large bowl.
Stir in honey, molasses, nutritional yeast, salt, yogurt, applesauce and oats.
Beat in 1 cup flour, eggs and foamy yeast.
Add 1 more cup flour, cinnamon, raisins, sunflower seeds, sesame seed, walnuts and carrots.
Add remaining flour, 1 cup at a time, mixing well.
Knead 10 minutes and let rise until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch down and let rise again.
Shape into 3 loaves.
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
Brush top with butter and cinnamon.
Bake 10 minutes longer.
Cool on racks.

title: Pecan - Cream Cheese Pie
instructions: Beat cream cheese, 1 1/3 cups sugar, 1 egg, vanilla and salt until thick and creamy.
Beat 3 eggs.
Add 1/4 cup sugar, Karo syrup and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Spread cream cheese mixture in bottom of unbaked pie shell.
Then sprinkle nuts on top of pie. Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.

title: Spicy Potato Salad
instructions: Cook potatoes.
Cool, dice and place in a large mixing bowl. Mix in remaining ingredients.
Add more or less mayonnaise until salad is pleasingly moist.
Chill and serve on romaine lettuce.

title: Easy Roast Beef
instructions: Use Dutch oven if not cooking on reflector oven for foil cooking.

title: Coconut Black Walnut Pound Cake
instructions: Combine sugar, oil and eggs; beat well.
Combine dry ingredients.
Add sugar mixture alternately with buttermilk, beating well after each addition.
Stir in nuts and coconut flavoring.
Pour batter into a well-greased and floured 10-inch tube pan.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour and 5 minutes, or until cake tests done.
Pour hot Coconut Syrup over hot cake.
Leave cake in pan at least 4 hours.

title: Tartar Sauce
instructions: Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Chill.
Makes 3/4 cup of sauce.

title: Drop Hermits
instructions: Combine in mixing bowl.
Mix well.
May need more flour.
Drop batter by spoonfuls on greased cookie sheet.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes in 350° oven.

title: Strips Of Meat With Onions And Tomatoes(Venezuelan Dish)
instructions: Make marinade for meat:
Combine 2 tablespoons oil, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, grated onion, garlic (crushed), 3 teaspoons salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper and ground comino.
Mix well and rub it into the meat.
Marinate meat for 1/2 hour.

title: Pineapple Salad
instructions: Drain juice from pineapple.
Put in saucepan and heat.
Mix sugar, flour and eggs; stir into heated juice.
Cook mixture over hot water until thick, stirring constantly.
Cool slightly.
Put 1 cup marshmallows in cooled mixture.
Pour over pineapple in a bowl.
Cool thoroughly, then add another cup of marshmallows. Stir well, but gently.
Need not be refrigerated.

title: Clam Chowder
instructions: Cook clams and bay leaf for 5 minutes with just enough water to cover.
Remove bay leaf.
Saute onion, celery and green pepper in butter and add to clams and clam juice.
Add the thickened milk, potatoes and bacon bits; cook gently until potatoes are done.
Season with salt, pepper and garlic.

title: Upside-Down Pizza
instructions: Cook turkey, celery, garlic powder, salt and pepper in 10-inch skillet.
Pour into 13 x 9-inch pan.
Top with vegetables.
Pour tomato sauce over that.
Cover with Mozzarella cheese, then cover with rolled out crescent rolls.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes, then serve.

title: Raspberry Almond Thumbprint Cookies
instructions: Cream powdered sugar, butter, salt and almond flavoring until light and fluffy.
Stir in flour.
Shape dough into 1 1/2-inch balls.
Roll cookies in finely chopped almonds.
Place on an ungreased baking sheet about 2-inches apart.
Make a depression in the center of the cookie with thumb.
Bake at 350° for 12 to 16 minutes or until edges are lightly brown.
Fill depression with 1/4 teaspoon raspberry jam or enough to fill center.
Melt white confection baking bar in double boiler; drizzle over cookie.

title: Fruit Cheese Ball
instructions: Cream the cream cheese and nutmeg.
Toss fruits with lemon juice.
Stir into cheeses and chill to slightly firm.
Shape into ball.
Combine nuts and parsley.
Roll ball in mixture.
Store in refrigerator.
Allow to soften to room temperature before serving. Serve with crackers.

title: Delicious Chocolate Fudge
instructions: Cream margarine, marshmallow cream, then add chocolate chips. Boil sugar and milk about 6 minutes.
When it begins to boil, pour over margarine mixture.
Stir until chocolate chips are melted. Add nuts and vanilla.
Pour into buttered 7 x 11-inch pan.
Cool, then cut into squares.

title: Company Rice
instructions: Mix together all ingredients.
Bake in covered 2-quart casserole dish 1 hour or until done.
Serves 6.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Cook noodles.
Add to ingredients.
Mix chopped chicken, mushroom soup, Durkee sauce, onion, pimiento, 1/2 cup grated cheese and chicken broth.
Put in casserole dish and add rest of cheese on top.
Bake at 350° until bubbly.

title: Chicken Caesar Salad
instructions: Sprinkle onion powder, garlic powder and salt on cubed chicken breasts to your liking.
Fry until chicken cubes are browned.

title: Oven Fried Zucchini
instructions: Trim zucchini and cut into sticks about the size of French fries.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Beat egg in water.
Roll each zucchini stick in egg mixture, then in crumbs.
Place on a wire rack while oven heats to 400°.
Place baking sheets under the wire racks and spoon margarine over coated zucchini sticks.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.
Serve immediately.
Good with fish and sliced tomatoes.
Serves 4. Makes about 26 sticks.

title: Chicken Tarragon
instructions: Sprinkle chicken with seasoned salt, pepper and paprika.
In skillet, over medium-high heat, in hot butter or margarine, cook chicken pieces until well browned.
Sprinkle tarragon over chicken.
Add onion and mushrooms to skillet.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 25 minutes or until tender.
Skim fat from liquid.
Makes 4 servings.

title: Salsa
instructions: Chop tomato, jalapenos, onion and cilantro into small pieces; add olive oil and season with oregano and salt.

title: Carrot-Pineapple Loaves
instructions: Heat oven to 350°.
Grease and flour four baking pans.

title: Pinwheel Date Cookies
instructions: To prepare filling, cook brown sugar, water and dates for 5 minutes, then add nuts.
Allow to cool.
To prepare dough, cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, then salt and flour, mixing until dough like.
Roll out dough and spread on the filling as for jelly rolls.
Roll up, chill, slice and bake at 400° until done.

title: Sunny Jim Peanut Butter Swirls
instructions: Mix shortening, sugar, peanut butter, eggs and milk.
Add flour, salt and soda.
Melt chocolate chips.
Divide dough and roll each out into oblong.
Spread melted chocolate and roll. Refrigerate for 10 minutes.
Slice and cook for 8 to 10 minutes in a 350° oven.

title: Mom'S Meat Loaf
instructions: Combine all ingredients and pour into a baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Cherry Nut Loaf
instructions: Drain cherries, reserving juice.
Cream butter and sugar; add egg yolks, sour cream and reserved juice.
Sift together flour, baking powder and baking soda and add to creamed mixture and mix well.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter.
Add cherries and nuts.
Bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes in 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.

title: Louisiana Pie
instructions: In bowl, combine butter, sugar and salt; blend well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in vanilla, flour, cream and pecans.
Pour mixture into pie shell. Bake at 350° until done.
Serve slightly warm with whipped cream.

title: Coconut Flan
instructions: Mix both milks, eggs and vanilla until well combined.
Stir in the flaked coconut and pour the mixture into 6 individual custard cups or a larger flan mold.

Place the cups or mold in a large baking pan and fill it with water to a depth of 1-inch. Bake in a preheated 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. A flan mold will take longer than individual cups. Allow to cool, then refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

title: Fried Peach Pies
instructions: Combine flour, baking powder and 1 teaspoon of salt; cut in 1/3 cup butter with pastry blender until mixture is crumbly.
Sprinkle cold milk (1 tablespoon at a time) evenly over surface.
Stir with a fork until dry ingredients are moistened.
Shape into a ball. Chill.

title: Chicken Parmesana
instructions: Put chicken in pan (for oven).
Cover with cheese, ham
and spaghetti sauce and sprinkle with oregano.
Bake 30 to 45 minutes at 325°.
Serve over pasta.
Serve with salad and bread.

title: Cheese-Corn Chowder
instructions: Combine water, potatoes, onion, celery, margarine, basil and bay leaf in a large Dutch oven.
Bring to a boil.
Then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Discard bay leaf.
Stir in corn, milk, tomatoes, salt and pepper.
Heat thoroughly.
Add cheese and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until cheese is melted. Garnish with parsley.
Makes 8 servings.

title: Cherry Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients and freeze.
Serves 12.

title: Old-Fashioned Bread Stuffing
instructions: Cook and stir onion and celery in margarine in medium skillet over medium heat until tender.
Stir in seasonings.
Add onion mixture and add water or broth to bread cubes in large bowl.
Toss to mix.

title: Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Heat soup; add
cheese.
Mix with cooked broccoli.
Top with buttered bread crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

title: Angel Biscuits
instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water; let stand 5 minutes.
Combine flour and next 4 ingredients; make a well in center of mixture. Add yeast mixture, oil and buttermilk; stir until dry ingredients are moistened.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface; roll to 1/2-inch thickness.
Cut with a 2-inch biscuit cutter; place on ungreased baking sheets.
Cover; let rise in a warm place (85°) free from drafts, 1 hour.
Bake at 400° for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
Yields 24 (100 calories per biscuit).

title: Rice Salad
instructions: Mix
together; add enough French dressing to cover all. Serve on lettuce leaves if desired.

title: Baked Haddock Fillets
instructions: Spray shallow pan with nonstick coating.
Place fillets in a pan.
Combine ingredients and spoon over fillets.
Bake at 450° for 8 to 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily.
Serves 4.

title: Limas In Pepper Boats
instructions: Cut peppers in half lengthwise. Remove seeds.
Parboil 5 minutes and drain. Brown onion in fat. Add tomatoes, seasonings and limas. Simmer 20 minutes. Remove from fire.
Add cheese. Fill peppers with mixture. Sprinkle with crumbs.
Place in shallow pan in 1/2-inch of hot water.
Bake in moderate oven 20 to 30 minutes.

title: Walnut Slice Cookies
instructions: Dissolve baking soda in warm water.
Mix all ingredients together.
Roll into a log, approximately 1 1/2 inches in diameter.
Refrigerate overnight.
Slice thin.
Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.

title: Toffee Bars
instructions: Mix all ingredients except chocolate together.
Spread by hand into a greased 10 x 15-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.
Do not overbake.
While cookies are still warm, spread chocolate over them.

title: Chicken Tetrazzini
instructions: Grease long Pyrex dish.
Mix all ingredients together with half of the Parmesan cheese.
Put in dish and cover with remaining cheese.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Cook uncovered at 350° for 20 minutes until bubbly.
Serves 4 to 6.

title: Prize Winning Meat Loaf
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Combine and mix well all ingredients. Press firmly into ungreased loaf pan (2 if needed).
Bake at 375° about 1 hour.
Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes before slicing.

title: Mexican Roll-Ups
instructions: Beat the cream cheese until creamy.
Beat in sour cream.
Add chilies, onion and cheese.
Mix.
Heat the flour tortillas. Spread mixture on the tortillas.
Roll up and refrigerate.
Slice when chilled and serve with salsa.

title: Dump Cake
instructions: Butter bottom of 9 X 13 pan. Spread pie filling evenly over bottom of pan. Sprinkle cake mix evenly over top of filling. Sprinkle nuts and butter over top. Bake at 350° for 50 minutes. When completely cooled, spread with cool whip. Keep refrigerated.

title: Impossible Taco Pie
instructions: Heat oven to 400°.
Grease pie plate (10 x 1 1/2-inch).
Cook and stir beef and onions until brown; drain.
Stir in seasoning mix; spread into plate.
Top with chillies.
Beat milk, baking mix and eggs until smooth, 15 seconds, in blender or 1 minute with mixer.
Pour into plate.
Bake 25 minutes.
Top with sliced tomatoes and cheese, then bake until knife inserted in center comes out clean, 8 to 10 minutes or longer.
Cool 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream, chopped tomatoes, shredded lettuce and Cheddar cheese.

title: Delicious Baked Potato Dish
instructions: Wash and peel potatoes, slicing very thin.
Use 1 tablespoon of the butter and place in a shallow baking dish.
Evenly layer one half of the potatoes in the dish, sprinkling lightly with salt and add 1/2 of the cheese.
Layer remaining potatoes, lightly salt and place remaining cheese on top.
Sprinkle with chopped chives and bake at 450°
for 45 minutes until potatoes are tender and browned on top.

title: Breakfast Bars
instructions: Butter a 9 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan.
In a large saucepan, melt butter and marshmallows over low heat, stirring constantly.
Stir in peanut butter until melted.
Stir in dry milk and drink mix. Remove from heat; fold in raisins and Cheerios.
Butter hands and pat into pan.
Cool and cut into bars.
Makes 1 dozen.

title: Hamburger-Green Bean Casserole
instructions: Cook ground beef with onions; drain well.
Put in a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.
Spread green beans over top.
Spread mushroom soup over beans.
Put sliced cheese over this.
Top with Tater Tots.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Christmas Jello Salad
instructions: Mix 2 envelopes jello with milk.
Add 1 1/4 cups of boiling water and mix well.
Set aside.
Mix red jello and 1 cup of hot water; set aside.
Mix green jello and 1 cup hot water; set aside. Add 1 package of gelatin with first and second jellos.
Place both colors of jello in icebox until firm.
Add milk mixture, then add other color on top.
Chill!

title: Tortellini Salad
instructions: Cook tortellini according to package directions; drain.
Rinse with cold water; drain well.
In a large mixing bowl combine cooked tortellini, sweet pepper, broccoli, carrot and olives.

title: Fluff (Weight Watchers)
instructions: Mix together yogurt, Cool Whip and puddings.
Fold in pineapple and oranges.
Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: Monkey Bread
instructions: Combine sugar and cinnamon. Cut biscuits into fourths; roll in cinnamon mixture before layering in Bundt or tube pan. Put remaining cinnamon mixture in 1-cup measuring cup; add enough sugar to make 1 cup. Add 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Melt margarine and mix with sugar mixture. Pour evenly over biscuit pieces in pan. Bake for 30 minutes at 350°. Remove from pan immediately. No need to cut bread, just pull apart.

title: Veggie Dip
instructions: Mix together. Refrigerate for a couple hours before serving with raw vegetables. Easy to make a half batch.

title: Cheesy Chicken Tetrazzini
instructions: Brown chicken in butter.
Add mushrooms and brown.
Add red pepper and green onions; cook several minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in flour and cook several minutes until blended.
Gradually stir in chicken broth, cream and sherry.
Cook, stirring, until thickened and smooth.
Season with pepper and thyme.
Toss with pasta, Parmesan cheese and parsley.
Spoon into a 1 1/2-quart baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Top with cheese.
Bake until cheese is melted.
Yields 6 servings.

title: Sunset Salad
instructions: Dissolve gelatin and salt in boiling water.
Add pineapple with juice and lemon juice. Add carrots and pour into individual dishes.
Chill until set, about 1 hour.
Garnish if desired. Makes 6 servings.

title: Christian Cake
instructions: Mix thoroughly.
Add tears of joy, sorrow and sympathy for others.
Flavor with little gifts of love and kindly service. Fold in 4 cups of faith and prayer to lighten other ingredients and raise texture of great heights of Christian living.
Bake well at a high degree of human kindness and serve with a warm smile.

title: Beef Stew
instructions: Roll stew meat in flour and brown in small amount of shortening.
Combine all ingredients in large covered pot.
Make sure there is enough liquid to cover all ingredients.
Add water or more V-8 if necessary.
Bake at 275° for 5 hours.
Do not peek.

title: Never Fail Fudge
instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients.
Stir over low heat until blended.
Bring to a boil over moderate heat.
Be careful not to mistake air bubbles for boiling.
Boil slowly, stirring constantly for 5 minutes (soft ball stage).
Remove from heat.
Stir in chips and vanilla until chips have melted.
Turn into a buttered 9 x 9-inch pan.
Let cool.

title: Blueberry Crunch
instructions: Top with 1 can Comstock blueberry pie filling.
Refrigerate overnight.
Cut into squares.

title: Everlasting Rolls
instructions: Put milk, shortening and sugar in saucepan over low heat; let scald, not boil.
Take off heat and when lukewarm, add yeast which has been dissolved in small amount of water.
Place mixture in a large bowl and add enough flour to make dough the consistency of waffle batter.
Let rise for two hours until doubled in bulk.
Add salt, baking powder and soda and enough flour to make dough.
Take half of mixture and place in another bowl.
Cover each bowl with foil and place in refrigerator and let rise overnight.
Dough will keep for a week to 10 days in refrigerator and full recipe does not have to baked at one time.
Take amount of desired dough from bowl. Place on floured board and make rolls into desired shape.
Place on greased pan and let rise for 2 hours at room temperature.
Bake at 375° until brown.
Yields approximately 75 rolls.

title: Easy Pecan Rolls
instructions: Butter pan.
Cover pan with frozen bread dough, then add pudding mix, brown sugar, cinnamon, pecans and butter.
Cover; let sit out on counter overnight.
Cook at 350° for 15 minutes uncovered, then 15 minutes covered.

title: Chocolate Sheet Cake
instructions: Bring to a boil first 3 ingredients.
Mix together the last 6 ingredients.
Pour liquid mixture into dry mixture and beat until well mixed.
Bake in a 15 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch pan at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes.

title: Pineapple-Orange Cooler
instructions: Mix all but ginger ale and soda water.
Add ginger ale and soda water (chilled) just before serving.
Garnish with orange slices.
Add crushed ice.
The best I have ever served.

title: Old-Fashioned Cherry Pudding
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.
Melt butter in 9 x 9-inch pan.
Mix sugar, flour, baking powder and milk into batter.
Pour batter over melted butter in pan.
Do not stir!
Spoon pie cherries, juice and all, over batter.
Do not stir! Sprinkle 1/4 cup sugar over top.
Bake for 60 minutes.

title: Too Easy Peach Cobbler
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Place fruit in a buttered 8 x 8-inch baking dish.
Cut crusts from bread slices and cut each slice into 5 fingers.
Place the bread fingers over peaches.
In a bowl, mix sugar, flour, egg and butter.
Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until golden brown.
Serves 4 to 6.

title: Easy Cream Pie
instructions: Mix together dry ingredients. Gradually add milk and Milnot. Cook on very low heat until thick. Add butter.
Pour in baked pie shell. Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Makes 1 pie.

title: Shrimp Dip
instructions: Melt together cream cheese and soup.
(Do not add water to soup.
Put in as is and melt with cheese over medium heat until smooth.)
Mix gelatine with 3 tablespoonfuls of water.
Add to soup mixture.
Add soup mixture with the rest of the ingredients in a bowl.
Refrigerate overnight (or at least a few hours).

title: Chocolate Chippers
instructions: Cream together butter, sugars, egg and vanilla.
Add flour, chocolate chips and pecans.
Bake at 375° about 10 minutes. (Dough does better if chilled.)

title: Caramel Frosting
instructions: Cook first 3 ingredients together until it strikes a boil, then boil 2 minutes.
Have powdered sugar sifted and remove from heat; stir in.
Add vanilla.
Beat until it gets thick enough to spread.
Makes enough for 3 layers of cake.

title: Cheese Straws
instructions: Allow cheese and butter to soften.
Mix with the rest of the ingredients, roll out and cut into French fries size strips.
Bake on cookie sheet at 350° for 6 to 8 minutes.

title: Gone All Afternoon Stew
instructions: Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes turning once.

title: Better Than Sex Cake
instructions: Combine the first 3 ingredients.
Place on bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes until lightly browned.
Cool.

title: Scalloped Potatoes
instructions: Line oven dish with potatoes.
Spread cheese and bacon on potatoes.
Dot butter evenly over.
Pour milk, salt and pepper. Repeat layers until potatoes are used.
End with bacon-cheese layer.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Bake at 350° for about 45 minutes or until tender.

title: Oyster Crackers
instructions: Combine Hidden Valley Ranch mix and oil; add dill weed, lemon pepper and garlic powder.
Pour over crackers; stir to coat. Place in warm oven for 15 to 20 minutes.

title: Lemon Bars
instructions: Combine first 4 ingredients and pat in 9 x 13-inch cake pan; bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
Combine eggs, flour, sugar and lemon juice and pour on top of crust.
Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar while hot.

title: Peanut Butter Pie
instructions: Mix until crumbly the powdered sugar and peanut butter.
Put in bottom of baked pie shell, saving 2/3 tablespoon of mixture for top of pie.
Combine cornstarch, sugar, milk, salt, egg yolks, butter and vanilla.
Cook until thick.
Cool some.
Pour on top of crumbly mixture in pie shell.
Beat egg whites with sugar for meringue. Cover top of pie.
Sprinkle reserved crumbly mixture on meringue and brown in oven at 400° for 8 to 10 minutes.

title: Classic Stuffed Shells
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Evenly spread 1 cup sauce in a 17 x 12-inch bake pan.
In a large bowl, combine cheeses, eggs, parsley and pepper.
Fill shells with cheese mixture and arrange in a single layer in baking pan.
Evenly top with remaining sauce. Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until bubbly.
Serves 8.

title: Acini De Pepe
instructions: In a pot, cook sugar, eggs, flour and salt; mix well.
Add fruit juices.
Bring to a boil.
Cool well.
Cook and strain acini de pepe.
Stir macaroni into cooked custard juices.
Chill overnight.

title: Fishy Oysters
instructions: Mix crackers together in large bowl with cover.
Mix oil and dressing mix (Mary Anne uses a dash of hot sauce).
Pour over crackers.
Let set for 8 hours, turning bowl occasionally.

title: Sweet Potato Biscuits
instructions: Combine first 3 ingredients.
Cut in butter until crumbly. Stir together sweet potato, sour cream and buttermilk; add to dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead 3 or 4 times.
Pat or roll to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut dough with a 3 inch round cutter, and place biscuits on a lightly greased baking sheet.
Bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Makes 14 biscuits.

title: Spicy Glazed Wieners
instructions: Cut 3 thin gashes on each wiener.
In medium saucepan over medium heat, cook remaining ingredients, stirring, until cranberry sauce melts and becomes smooth.
Add wieners and heat through. Serve hot with cocktail picks.
Makes 48 appetizers.

title: Squash Casserole
instructions: Cut
the squash and onion.
Boil
until
tender.
Drain and mash.
Add
salt,	pepper, eggs, soup,
butter
and
1/2 cracker crumbs;
mix well.	Layer 1/2 of the squash mixture in a dish. Sprinkle this with 1 cup of cheese.
Spread remaining squash
on top of cheese and sprinkle	the
remaining	cracker crumbs on squash.
Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top of the crackers. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

title: Sicilian Cheese Ball
instructions: Allow cheese to soften at room temperature.
Blend all ingredients together until smooth (except nuts).
Chill for 2 hours.
Shape into a ball and roll in chopped nuts.
Refrigerate.

title: Stromboli
instructions: Thaw bread dough.
Flatten on a greased cookie pan.
Make a paste of 2 egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, parsley flakes, garlic powder, oregano, pepper and vegetable oil.
Spread on dough like butter.
Down the center of flattened dough, layer pepperoni, ham, salami and cheese.
Saute onion and pepper.
Place on top of cheese.
Pour tomato sauce over this.
Fold each side of the dough over filling.
Overlap as far as possible.
Pinch edges.
Brush top with slightly beaten egg whites.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.
Serves 6.

title: Hominy Casserole
instructions: Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

title: "Sitting Pretty" Cookies
instructions: Sift together flour and salt; set aside.
Mix together the butter, sugar, vanilla and egg yolk.
Add slowly to flour mixture. Roll into small balls; dip into egg white.
Roll into chopped nuts.
Bake at 350° for 5 minutes.
Remove and make thumbprint in center of each cookie.
Put back in oven for 5 to 7 minutes longer.
Let cool completely, then fill each hole with sour cream frosting.
Garnish by placing 1 peanut M&M in center of frosting.

title: Pound Cake
instructions: Cream butter, Crisco and sugar.
Add eggs, one at a time.
Add flour, a cup at a time.
Add milk, a third at a time, then mix good.
Beat 3 minutes.
Put in a tube pan (greased and floured). Place in cold oven.
Turn to 350° and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

title: Broccoli Quiche
instructions: Beat eggs well, then add broccoli.
Add milk, then fold in mayonnaise.
Add minced onion.
Fold in the cheeses; mix all ingredients well.
(If any of the optional ingredients are used, this recipe will make at least 2 quiches.)
Pour ingredients into unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350° for approximately 40 minutes, or until set and beginning to brown on top.
Make sure that the pie shell does not burn.

title: Miracle Seafoam Icing
instructions: Mix brown sugar, water and vinegar.
Bring to a boil, then cook 3 minutes.
In a mixing bowl, combine egg whites, cream of tartar and salt.
Beat into peaks.
Slowly add syrup, beating all the while.
Beat 5 minutes more.
Add vanilla and blend.
Sprinkle with coconut after frosting cake (if you wish).

title: Preacher Cookies
instructions: Combine butter, sugar and milk in a medium sauce pan; boil 3 minutes.
Stir in cocoa, oatmeal, vanilla and nuts.
Beat well; working quickly, drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Cool 5 minutes.
Yields: 3 dozen.

title: Grilled Pork Chops
instructions: Put salt, pepper and meat tenderizer on chops and place on gas grill.
Cook on low 15 minutes on each side.

title: Frosty Strawberry Squares(Mrs. Martin)
instructions: Stir together first 4 ingredients and spread evenly in shallow baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Let cool. Sprinkle 2/3 of the crumbs in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan.
In a large mixing bowl, beat the egg whites, sugar, strawberries and lemon juice at high speed until very stiff peaks form.
Fold in the heavy cream (whipped).
Pour over crumbs in pan.
Sprinkle remaining 1/3 crumbs over top. Freeze overnight. Cut into squares.
Garnish with dash of whipped cream and a whole strawberry.

title: Boursin Cheese
instructions: Cream butter and cheese together.
Mix in all spices.
Serve at room temperature.
Can be frozen.

title: Marinated Green Beans
instructions: Combine sugar, vinegar, oil and water in a medium saucepan. Boil for 2 minutes.
Combine beans and onion rings; add hot marinade.
Set aside to cool.
Refrigerate and marinate at least overnight.
Yield:
6 to 8 servings.
Excellent for low-fat diets.

title: No Peek Casserole
instructions: Add all ingredients into a Dutch oven with lid; mix.
Cook, covered, in 300° oven for 3 hours.
Do not peek! Serve on hot rice or noodles.
May use sour cream, if desired.

title: Pecan Pie
instructions: Mix sugar, butter and flour, then add eggs and syrup.
Beat together.
Add salt, vanilla and pecans.
Mix and pour into unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350° for about 40 minutes or until almost firm. Makes 1 small pie.

title: Dillicious Pot Roast
instructions: In heavy saucepan, cook bacon until crisp.
Drain off all but 2 tablespoons bacon drippings from pan.
Crumble bacon; set aside. Sprinkle both sides of beef with lemon pepper marinade.
Brown beef in bacon drippings.
Combine mushroom soup, dill pickle and Worcestershire sauce; pour over browned meat.
Cover; simmer for about 2 1/2 hours, or until meat is tender.
Remove to warm platter.
Sprinkle with crumbled bacon.
Skim fat from gravy; serve with roast.

title: Hay Stacks
instructions: Melt butterscotch morsels over hot water in double boiler. Add oil, marshmallows and noodles.
Drop by spoonfuls on cookie sheet or wax paper.

title: Cranberry Salad
instructions: Mix cranberry sauce and jello with hot water.
Add remaining ingredients.
Refrigerate after jelled.
Add cream cheese and 1/4 cup pineapple juice, cream cheese and Cool Whip.
Mix together and spread over jelled mixture.
Sprinkle with nuts.

title: Hamburger Dip
instructions: Brown hamburger; drain.
Add all other ingredients, except cheese.
Melt cheese last, very slowly on low heat.
Serve with corn chips.

title: Peanut Butter Krispies
instructions: Combine margarine, sugar and syrup in saucepan. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and cereal.
Drop by teaspoons on waxed paper. Cool.
Makes 2 dozen.

title: Oriental Chicken Wings And Drummies
instructions: Separate chicken wings at the joints, cut off wing tips and discard.
Mix all ingredients well and pour over chicken wings and drummies in shallow dish.
Cover and marinate in refrigerator overnight.
Place wings on a cookie sheet.
Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.
Remove from oven and put in slow cooker on low until tender.

title: Zucchini Brownies
instructions: Spread on greased and floured cookie sheet.
Sprinkle with 3/4 cup brown sugar and 1 cup chocolate chips.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Pie Crust Recipe(Makes Top And Bottom Crusts For A 9-Inch Pie)
instructions: Mix all ingredients together with a pastry blender in a shallow bowl.
Work quickly; don't mix too much!
Dough should still be crumbly.
Divide into 2 dough balls.
Roll out for top and bottom crusts.
For best results, roll on pastry canvas sprinkled moderately with flour.
A cloth sleeve on the rolling pin helps, too.
Roll outward from the center of the dough ball; roll lightly in all directions.
Overworking crust will make it tough instead of flaky.

title: Yummy Potatoes
instructions: Mix and toss.
Top with buttered bread crumbs.
Bake for 1 hour at 325°.

title: Strawberry Pie
instructions: Mix ingredients.
Pour into a prepared graham cracker crust; freeze.

title: Broccoli And Rice Casserole
instructions: Butter sides and bottom of glass baking dish.
Combine all ingredients in baking dish.
Bake, covered, in a 350° oven for 30 to 45 minutes.

title: Monkey Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

title: Mary'S Goulash
instructions: Cut beef into bite size cubes.

Use a large iron frypan and melt oleo, then add meat, onions, paprika, salt and pepper. Brown until dark brown, stirring often. When meat is brown on all sides of cubes, add water and simmer about 35 minutes, covered with lid. Dissolve cornstarch in milk and add to mixture.
Let simmer 10 minutes longer.
Serve over rice, noodles or hot biscuits.

title: Butterscotch Cheesecake Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
In a medium saucepan or in the microwave, melt the chips and margarine.
Stir in crumbs and nuts. Press 1/2 the mixture firmly onto bottom of greased 13 x 9-inch pan.

title: Pumpkin Whip - Lite
instructions: Mix dry pudding mix with pumpkin. Fold in Cool Whip. Add spices and Sweet 'N Low.

title: Shrimp Canapes
instructions: Toast bread triangles on one side.
Mix mayonnaise, cheese and mustard.
Spread mayonnaise, cheese and mustard mixture on untoasted side of bread triangle.
Place shrimp on top and spread a small amount of additional mayonnaise, cheese and mustard on top.
Place under broiler until lightly browned.

title: Squash Rolls
instructions: If possible, check
temperature of warm water with thermometer.
Sprinkle yeast over water in a large bowl; stir until dissolved.
Stir in sugar and salt until dissolved.
Add eggs, squash, 1/2 cup softened butter and 3 cups flour.

title: Unbaked Fruit Cake
instructions: Crush vanilla wafers. Cut candied fruit into pieces.
Leave nuts whole.
Mix all ingredients except milk and marshmallows. Melt marshmallows in milk and mix with other ingredients.
When mixed well, pack in angel food pan or 3 small loaf pans.
When cool, remove from pan and wrap in wax paper at room temperature.

title: Carrot Tuna Noodle Salad
instructions: Mix carrots, celery and tuna together.
Add mayonnaise.
Just before serving, add noodles.
Serves about 6.

title: Lemon Caper Chicken
instructions: Combine flour, paprika and pepper on a plate.
Press chicken into mixture, coating evenly and then shake off excess.
In a heavy 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat for 1 minute.
Add chicken and cook for 3 minutes on each side.
Do not overcook.
Place on heated platter.
Add chicken broth to skillet, scraping up any browned bits on the bottom. Stir in the lemon juice and capers and heat through.
Pour sauce over chicken breasts and serve.
Serves 4.

title: Deviled Pork Chops
instructions: Season pork chops with salt, both peppers and garlic salt. Heat shortening in skillet.
Brown pork chops on both sides.
Add water.
Add remaining ingredients over pork chops.
Cover and cook over slow heat until done.

title: Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Chop onion, garlic and mushroom stems; saute until just softened.
Add crumbs, cheese and crabmeat.
Fill mushroom caps and sprinkle with more Parmesan and dot tops with butter.
Bake at 350° until mushrooms are tender.

title: Dill Dip
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
Refrigerate for 24 hours.
Yield:
2 cups.
Carbohydrate 0 g, protein 0 g, fat 7 g, calories per serving 63.
One tablespoon = 1 fat exchange.

title: Caramel Apple Coffee Cake
instructions: Melt butter.
Add brown sugar and corn syrup and blend.
Pour mixture into bottom of 8 x 8-inch or 10-inch round pan.
Sprinkle with chopped nuts.
Peel and slice apple.
Spread apple slices on top of nuts.
Dip each refrigerated roll in sugar-cinnamon mixture (one side only).
Place sugar side down in the pan.
After placing all rolls in pan, sprinkle remaining mixture over all.
Bake in 375° oven and turn out onto a large plate or tray.
Let sit for 30 seconds, then lift off and serve warm.

title: Glazed Acorn Rings
instructions: Cut off ends of squash.
Slice crosswise into 1-inch rings and remove seeds.
Place in a single layer in large, shallow baking dish and add orange juice.
Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Combine brown sugar and remaining ingredients; simmer 5 minutes. Pour over squash rings and bake, uncovered, 15 minutes longer, basting occasionally.

title: Broccoli And Chicken Casserole
instructions: Cook chicken 1/2 hour; skin and bone it.
Cook broccoli as directed.
Arrange broccoli in buttered 11 1/2 x 7 1/2-inch dish. Tear chicken in strips and place over broccoli. Mix soups with mayonnaise and spread over chicken.
Sprinkle with cheese and then bread crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

title: Frozen Chocolate Delight(Good Summer Dessert)
instructions: Combine first 2 ingredients in top of a double boiler.
Bring water to a boil.
Reduce heat to low.
Cook until chocolate is melted.
Remove from heat; set aside to cool.

title: Round Steak Bake
instructions: Spread onion soup mix over one-half of round steak.
Fold over.
Wrap securely in foil.
Bake at 350° for 2 hours.

title: Oil Free French Dressing
instructions: Mix well and let stand several hours to improve flavor.

title: Curried Chicken Mole
instructions: Have all ingredients ready to stir-fry in wok or heavy skillet (high heat).
Saute garlic, ginger and fenugreek in 2 teaspoons sesame oil and 2 to 3 tablespoons olive or canola oil for 1 minute. Add carrots and onions.
Saute until onions are golden.
Remove and reserve.
Add oil, heat, then stir-fry chicken fast until very golden and crispy; remove and reserve.
Add oil; stir-fry fenugreek, poppy seed and broccoli or asparagus quickly as bhaji. Add reserved onions, carrots and chicken.
Cover with yogurt (may substitute or use part coconut milk).
Dissolve curry paste and mole paste in a little liquid; add to mix and stir.
Lay pepper over mixture and allow it to steam.
Cumin or paprika may be added. Let simmer for 30 to 60 minutes.
Serve over basmati or jasmine rice.

title: Pickled Beets
instructions: Heat ingredients to boiling and pour over sliced beets. Put in
jars.
Process
in
boiling water bath 30 minutes (or store in refrigerator).

title: Beets A L'Orange
instructions: Drain beets, reserving liquid in saucepan. Add orange juice and cornstarch. Stir until cornstarch is
dissolved. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and translucent. Add beets, butter, sweetener and orange peel. Heat through. Do not boil.

title: Sausage Omelet
instructions: In a 10-inch skillet, melt butter.
Add broken up sausage and chopped onion.
Mix eggs, milk, soy sauce and garlic in a small bowl.
Pour over sausage in skillet, then simmer on low heat until bubbly.

title: Superb Sweet Potatoes
instructions: Wash the unpeeled sweet potatoes.
Cook in a large saucepan in the water with 1 teaspoon salt for about 20 minutes, until tender, but not mushy.
Drain, peel and mash to a puree.
This may be done in a food processor, blender or electric mixer.
Add the remaining salt, butter, pepper and milk.

title: Boston Baked Beans
instructions: Simmer beans in 6 cups of water for 1 hour.
Allow to stand, covered, for 2 hours or until softened.
Drain.
Put all ingredients in a crock-pot.
Add 1 cup of water.
Stir to blend. Cover pot and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours or on high 5 to 6 hours.
Stir occasionally.
Makes 8 to 10 servings.

title: Cool 'N Easy Pie
instructions: Stir boiling water into gelatin in bowl for 2 minutes or until dissolved.
Mix water and ice to make 1 1/4 cups.
Stir into gelatin until slightly thickened.
Remove any remaining ice.
Stir in whipped topping until smooth.
Refrigerate 10 minutes or until mixture will mound.
Spoon into crust.
Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm.
Garnish with additional whipped topping, if desired.

title: Fried Peppers In Tomato Sauce
instructions: Wash and dry peppers; cut in halves lengthwise and remove seeds.
Cut each half into 3 or 4 strips.
Spray heavy pan with Pam.
Add cooking oil and heat until very hot.
Drop in pepper strips.
Reduce heat to medium.
Stir constantly to prevent burning.
Cook until peppers are tender, not mushy.
Add tomato sauce and other ingredients.
Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve with beans or other vegetables.
This can be canned to use throughout the year.

title: Impossible Turkey Pie
instructions: Heat oven to 400°.
Lightly grease pie plate (10 1/2 x 1 1/2-inch).
Beat remaining ingredients after you sprinkle turkey, mushrooms, onions, salt and cheese in pie plate.
Pour into pie plate.
Bake until golden brown and knife inserted halfway between center and edge comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Refrigerate any remaining pie.

title: Goulash(Soup Or Stew)
instructions: Fry onion in melted shortening until golden yellow.
Lower heat, add paprika and stir rapidly.
When meat is browned and liquid evaporated, add caraway seed, finely chopped garlic, small amount of cold water, cover and braise slowly.
Add additional water when necessary.
Just before meat is tender, reduce pan juices and add potatoes.
Let them brown slightly, then add stock, green pepper and tomato.
When potato is almost cooked, add pasta, and if necessary stock or water.

title: Mexican Coffee
instructions: Place coffee and cinnamon in filter basket of coffee maker. Add water and brew. In a saucepan, blend milk, chocolate syrup and sugar, stir over low heat until sugar dissolves. Combine milk mixture and brewed coffee. Stir in vanilla. Pour into cups to serve. Top each serving with whipped cream with ground cinnamon sprinkled on top.

title: Manicotti
instructions: Drain manicotti and place on foil in single layer.
Mix all ingredients together.
Stuff pasta.
Melt butter; add sauce and garlic powder.
Pour some sauce on bottom of baking dish.
Add manicotti in single layer.
Spoon remaining sauce over top. Sprinkle 1 cup Mozzarella cheese over sauce.
Cover.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Uncover last 15 minutes.

title: French Cabbage Soup
instructions: Simmer 1 hour.	Makes 5 quarts.

title: Tomato Stack-Ups
instructions: Cook broccoli using package directions for 1/2 time; drain. Slice tomatoes 3/4-inch thick.
Reserve 2 tablespoons cheese. Combine remaining cheese, broccoli and onion in bowl; mix well. Arrange tomatoes in shallow baking pan.
Spoon broccoli mixture over tomatoes.
Sprinkle with reserved cheese.
Broil 7 to 8 inches from heat source for 6 to 8 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and tomato slices are heated through.

title: Yaki Soba
instructions: Chop shrimp and scallions.
Cut pork, chicken and beef into small strips.
Heat wok with 2 tablespoons oil.
Add shrimp, pork, chicken and beef.
Stir-fry.
Remove.
To wok, add water.
Add noodles.
Cook until soft (3 to 4 minutes).
Add seasoning (from noodle package), the meat, shrimp, spinach and scallions.
Cook 1 minute.
Remove from heat.
Serve hot.
Serves 2 to 4.
Amount of noodles in recipe may be doubled or tripled.
If so, add an additional 3/4 cup water for each package of noodles.

title: 7-Up Pound Cake
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, cream the shortening, butter and sugar.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each one. Add the flour, alternating with the 7-Up.
Add the flavorings and bake in a greased tube pan for 1 hour and 20 minutes at 350°.

title: Chocolate Oatmeal Cake
instructions: Mix oats and water.
Sift dry ingredients; set aside.
Cream shortening; add sugar and one egg at a time.
Beat well.
Add vanilla, then add alternately the dry ingredients and oat mixture. Pour into a greased 8 x 11 x 2-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

title: Church Windows
instructions: Melt chips and butter and cool.
Add marshmallows, nuts and vanilla and mix until all marshmallows are covered with the chocolate.
Sprinkle coconut on waxed paper.
Butter hands and put mixture on top of coconut and shape into roll, having coconut on the outside of roll.
Refrigerate until cold.
Makes about 3 rolls.

title: Heath Bar Cake
instructions: Bake cake as directed on box.
When cake is done, poke several holes in top of cake.
Pour condensed milk over cake.
Pour caramel topping over milk.
Let cake cool completely.
Top with Cool Whip. Break candy bars into small pieces and scatter on top of Cool Whip. Refrigerate.

title: Raisin Pudding
instructions: Stir together bread pieces, white sugar, egg, 1 tablespoon flour and milk. Bake in oven until dry.

title: Tomato And Pasta Salad
instructions: Cook pasta.
Add remaining ingredients and stir.

title: Mock Black Forest Cake For Microwave Oven
instructions: Grease or spray with Pam, a microwave Bundt cake pan. Sprinkle nuts and put cherries in bottom of pan.
Put mixture in pan, only 1/2 full.
Bake on High for 13 minutes.

title: Pizza Burgers
instructions: Combine milk, ground beef, cracker meal, onion, garlic salt, and Parmesan cheese in a large bowl.
Mix well.
Split each bun and toast lightly.
Divide meat mixture into 8 parts.
Spread one part mixture evenly over top surface of each bun.
Place on cookie sheet.
Make a well in center of meat, using the back of a spoon. Combine tomato sauce and oregano.
Spoon 2 teaspoons of mixture into each well.
Bake at 425° for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cheese over each burger.
Continue baking until cheese melts.

title: Jackie'S Quiche
instructions: Combine ingredients and pour into pie shells.
Bake 40 to 45 minutes in 350° oven.

title: Pineapple Delight
instructions: Mix like pie crust (no water).
Press into lightly greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake 15 minutes at 400°.
Cool.

title: Scalloped Potatoes
instructions: Boil potatoes and medium onion; boil until tender.
Pour water off potatoes except 1 cup.
Melt margarine; add flour, milk and water off boiled potatoes and salt.
Cook until thick.
Pour over sliced potatoes; add cheese, more potatoes, sauce, cheese and more potatoes until all is gone.
Cook at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Red Beet Eggs
instructions: Drain beets, reserving juice.
Mix sugar, salt, vinegar, water and beet juice in a small saucepan.
Heat until sugar dissolves.
Peel eggs.
Put beets and eggs in a bowl.
Cover with the liquid and refrigerate for several days.

title: California Pie
instructions: Fold in crumbs and nuts to first 3 ingredients.
Butter pie pan.
Bake 30 minutes at 350°.
Cool; top with Cool Whip, ice cream or whipped cream.
I like it served without topping.

title: Butter Pecan Dessert
instructions: Mix cake according to directions and bake in a 9 x 13-inch pan for 15 minutes.
Cool. Mix the puddings, ice cream and milk; mix well.
Spread over cake and sprinkle with nuts.
Refrigerate 2 hours. Can use different pudding and ice cream flavors.
Keep stored in refrigerator.

title: Fruit Cobbler
instructions: Mix fruit, tapioca and sugar.
Pour in ungreased 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix other ingredients and drop by spoonfuls on top of fruit. Bake 40 minutes at 350°.

title: Egg Balls
instructions: With the back of a wooden spoon, press eggs through a strainer into a small bowl; add the 1/4 cup butter and mix well.
Stir salt, Cayenne, Worcestershire and celery seed into egg mixture.
Shape egg mixture into 3/4-inch balls and chill in the refrigerator 1 hour.
While egg mixture is chilling, prepare bread crumbs.
Heat oven to 375°.
Place bread crumbs and the 2 tablespoons butter in a pie plate or shallow pan; place in oven and bake 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until crumbs are lightly browned.
Remove plate from oven and cool.
Roll egg balls in the prepared bread crumbs to coat thoroughly.
Makes 16 to 18 balls.

title: Snickerdoodles
instructions: Combine caramels, 1/3 cup evaporated milk and 1/4 cup margarine in a double boiler until melted.
Combine cake mix, 1/2 cup margarine, 1/3 cup evaporated milk and 1 cup walnuts.
Spread half in a 9 x 13-inch pan and bake 6 minutes at 350°.
Sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Spread caramel mixture over the chips.
Top with remaining cake mix.
Bake 18 minutes at 350°.
Do not bake longer!
Cut into bars.

title: Squash Casserole
instructions: Cook
squash, onions and pimento together.
Drain well; then add sour cream, mushroom soup and water chestnuts.
Place in
the bottom
of
a 3-quart greased casserole dish, 1/2 the package
of stuffing mix and 1/2 stick of margarine.
Add the squash
mixture. Put
the
other half of the stuffing mix and the
almonds on top of the casserole.
Dot with remaining half stick of margarine. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Mary Bradshaw'S Bourbon Hot Dogs
instructions: Cut hog dogs in bite size pieces.
Put on cookie sheet in 350° oven just until cuts are sealed.
Mix catsup, sugar, rosemary, oregano, basil and bourbon and bring to a boil.
Add hot dogs. Best to do day before so flavor can set in.

title: Carrot Salad(Serves 45 People)
instructions: Put all
together
in
glass bowl.
Mix well; chill and serve. This will serve 45 people.

title: French Onion Soup
instructions: Saute onions in margarine in a Dutch oven until tender.
Blend in flour, stirring until smooth. Gradually add chicken broth, beef broth, water and wine. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Add pepper.

title: Oatmeal Apple Cookies
instructions: Cream Crisco, brown sugar, egg, milk and vanilla on medium speed.
Combine flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, soda and salt.
Beat into creamed mixture at low speed until well blended.
Stir in oats. Drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375° for 13 minutes.
Cool 2 minutes on baking sheet. Remove to cooling rack.
Makes 2 1/2 dozen cookies.

title: Cream Cheese Cookies
instructions: Beat brown sugar and oleo until fluffy.
Stir in baking mix and nuts.
Mix until crumbly (reserve 1 cup).
Press mixture in pan and bake 12 minutes at 350°.
Mix cream cheese and sugar. Beat in remaining ingredients.
Pour over mixture in pan. Sprinkle with reserved crumbs.
Bake 25 minutes at 350°.

title: Mom'S Sugar Cookies
instructions: Cream butter or margarine with sugar.
Then add eggs and vanilla.
Mix well.
Stir in flour, sifted with baking powder and salt.
Chill dough if time permits.
Working with a handful of dough at a time, add extra flour until dough becomes pliable. Roll to 1/4-inch thickness on a well floured board, then cut into desired shapes.
Small cookie cutters work best.
Arrange on a large cookie sheet, lightly greased.
Sprinkle with sugar and bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.

title: Pumpkin Bread(Makes 2 Loaves)
instructions: Combine sugar and shortening; add eggs, water and pumpkin. Sift dry ingredients.
Combine with first mixture.
Add nuts, raisins and dates.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Don Juan'S Sangria
instructions: Squeeze the juice of lime, orange and apple in a large pitcher; add 1/2 cup sugar and fruit pieces.
Pour in the wine, brandy and Triple Sec and stir with a long handled spoon until well mixed.
Taste.
If you prefer the sangria sweeter, add up to 1/4 cup more sugar.

title: Tuna Chow Mein
instructions: Butter a casserole dish and line with half of chow mein noodles.
Mix all of the ingredients, except remaining half of noodles, which you place on top of mixture.
Bake at 375° for 1/2 hour.

title: Sesame Chicken Wings
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, the garlic, the ginger, the honey and the pepper.
Add the wings; toss them to coat and let them marinate, covered and chilled, for 2 hours. Line a baking pan with foil and arrange the wings, drained (reserving the marinade) in one layer on the foil.
Brush the wings with the
oil; sprinkle them with the sesame seed and bake them in the middle of a preheated 400° oven, basting them occasionally with the reserved marinade, for 30 to 35 minutes or until they are browned.
Serves 4 as an hors d'oeuvre.

title: Pear Butter
instructions: Cook 4 hours in crock pot. Put in pint jars and seal.

title: Butter Rum Cake
instructions: Mix all ingredients with electric mixer on medium 2 to 3 minutes.
Bake in a greased and floured Bundt pan in a 350° oven about 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in cake comes out clean.
Bring margarine, sugar and water to a boil.
Remove from heat.
Stir in rum.
Pour this mixture over hot cake.
Let set at least 30 minutes without removing from pan.

title: Nut Roll
instructions: Cut shortening and flour as you do for pie dough.
Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Add eggs, sugar, salt and sour cream.
Mix and add with flour and shortening.
Refrigerate overnight.

title: Dill Dip
instructions: Mix the sour cream and 1 1/2 packages Hidden Valley dressing. Fill sour cream container half full with Miracle Whip.
Add more, if desired.
Chop dill and add more, if needed.

title: Squash Casserole
instructions: Brown beef and onion. Put in casserole dish, mix squash, cheese, crackers, eggs, tomatoes with beef and onion. Bake in oven at 350° for 30 min.

title: Refreshing Strawberry-Spinach Salad
instructions: Clean spinach and strawberries.
Cut strawberries into halves.
Combine in a bowl.
Slice onion into rings and add to spinach and strawberries.

title: Clam Chowder
instructions: Bring clams to a boil.
Drain water off.
Fry fatback meat and brown onion in the grease.
Add meat and onions to clams; add 6 cups water.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Dice up potatoes and add to clams.
Boil for 30 minutes.
Cut biscuits up into quarters and roll into balls.
Drop into boiling clam broth and cook until done.

title: Autumn Apple Cakes(Pancakes)
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together.
Put a little cooking oil in the frypan and make just like pancakes.
Fry and enjoy.

title: Venison Stew
instructions: Heat oil in a Dutch oven.
Brown meat.
Add onions, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, bay leaf, oregano, salt, pepper and water. Simmer, covered, 2 hours or until meat is tender.
Add potatoes and carrots.
Continue to cook until vegetables are tender, about 30 to 45 minutes.
Mix flour and cold water; stir into stew.
Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.
Remove bay leaf.

title: Taco Salad
instructions: Cook ground meat until all red color is removed, but do not brown; drain.
Mix other ingredients and add meat after it has cooled.
This salad is best while lettuce is still very crisp.
It keeps well in refrigerator for another meal.

title: Sweet And Fruity Dip
instructions: Cream the cheese.
Add heavy cream, then the pineapple and cherries.

title: Sweet Pickled Banana Peppers
instructions: Cut peppers in half.
Remove seeds and soak in ice water for 3 hours, then drain.
Make a syrup of the ingredients listed and bring to a boil.
Pour boiling syrup over peppers that have been packed into clean sterilized jars.
Seal at once.

title: Creamed Cabbage
instructions: Chop cabbage; boil in salted water until tender.
Drain.
Melt 6 tablespoons butter.
Add flour; stir and add milk.
Cook until sauce thickens.
Layer cabbage in baking dish with sauce.
Repeat layers.
Cover with bread crumbs which have been mixed with 4 tablespoons butter.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Quick Taco Bake
instructions: Heat oven to 350°.
Brown ground beef and onion; drain.
Spoon into ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.
Stir in seasoning mix (dry), tomato sauce and corn.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Stir remaining ingredients until blended.
Pour over beef mixture. Bake 35 minutes or until light golden brown.
Serve with sour cream, chopped tomato and shredded lettuce, if desired.
Makes 8 to 10 servings.

title: Steak Diane
instructions: Combine margarine and Worcestershire sauce in a large nonstick skillet; place over medium heat until hot.
Add mushrooms and onion; saute until tender.
Place steaks between 2 sheets of heavy-duty plastic wrap; flatten to 1/4-inch thickness, using a meat mallet or rolling pin.
Spread 1 1/2 teaspoons mustard on one side of each steak.
Move mushroom mixture to one side of skillet. Add steaks, mustard side down.
Cook steaks 3 to 4 minutes over medium heat.
Stir mushroom mixture occasionally.
Spread 1 1/2 teaspoons mustard on top side of each steak; turn and cook 3 to 4 minutes on second side of steak or to desired degree of doneness.

title: Peanut Butter Fudge
instructions: Combine marshmallow cream, sugar, milk, butter and salt in
a 2-quart saucepan.
Bring to a full, rolling boil, stirring constantly.
Continue
to boil over moderate heat, stirring constantly,
for
minutes.
Remove from heat; stir in chocolate and
vanilla.
Beat
until
smooth.
Spread
into a greased
pan. Sprinkle
with a few peanut butter chips.	Melt the rest of the peanut butter chips and spread over the fudge. Chill in refrigerator until firm.

title: Zucchini Bread
instructions: Mix dry ingredients.
Add sugar, frothy mixed eggs, oil and vanilla.
Beat for 3 minutes, then add squash and other ingredients.
Makes 2 loaf pans.
Cook for 40 minutes at 350°.

title: Spaghetti Salad
instructions: Mix package of dressing according to instructions on package. Add remaining ingredients.
Chill until time to serve.

title: Christmas Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Grease 15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch pan.

title: Wine Punch
instructions: Mix to taste.
Serve in punch bowl.
Float ice ring on top. Can use any red wine you like.
Makes 1 gallon.

title: Chocolate Chip Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Beat eggs in a large bowl on high until foamy.
Beat in flour, sugar and brown sugar.
Beat in butter.
Stir in chocolate chips and nuts.
Pour into pie shell and bake for 55-60 minutes.
Serve warm with ice cream or cool whip.

title: Hawaiian Salad
instructions: Cook macaroni and rinse.
Cool.
Add sugar, flour, eggs, fruit juices and salt in saucepan over medium heat until thickened.
Stir in macaroni and refrigerate. Later, fold in fruit and Cool Whip.

title: Aunt Jean'S Fruit Dessert
instructions: Put all ingredients in bowl and mix.
Ready!

title: Grasshopper Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.
Combine first 4 ingredients and beat until stiff.
Fold in remaining ingredients.
Drop by teaspoonfuls on foil-covered cookie sheets.
Turn oven off and leave cookies in oven overnight.
Store in tins between wax paper.
May be frozen.

title: Maytime Salad
instructions: Dissolve jello and salt in hot water.
Add vinegar, grated onion and pepper.
Chill until slightly thickened.
Fold in remaining ingredients.
Chill until firm.

title: Grandmother Holmes' Oyster Stew
instructions: In Dutch oven, saute onions in butter until tender.
Add remaining ingredients to onions.
Cook over low heat until edges of oysters begin to curl and mixture is hot.
Do not boil.
Serve with crackers.

title: Lettuce Cauliflower Salad
instructions: Arrange in layers in salad bowl: lettuce, cauliflower, diced onion, Miracle Whip, Parmesan cheese, sugar and crumbled bacon. Chill for 24 hours.
Stir before serving.
Yield: 8 to 10 servings.

title: Fried Cornmeal
instructions: Put hot cornmeal mush in a loaf pan; cut into slices.
Put slices of mush in heated greased frying pan and fry both sides.

title: One Big Beautiful Loaf Of Bread
instructions: Dissolve active dry yeast in warm water, 105° to 115°.
Scald milk, sugar, shortening and salt.
Cool to lukewarm.
Add yeast mixture.
Add flour gradually, mixing with spoon, then by hand until well blended.
Place on lightly floured board.
Knead until smooth and elastic.
Place in greased bowl.
Rub top with shortening.

title: Bean Salad
instructions: Drain beans.
Cut onions, peppers and pimentos into thin strips.
Mix together.
Mix oil, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper. Pour over beans and leave overnight.
Stir and serve.

title: Sauerkraut Casserole
instructions: Saute onions in margarine.
Add soup mix.
Mix all ingredients in large 9 x 13-inch casserole dish.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bread crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Chinese Chews Cookie
instructions: Mix together butter, brown sugar, eggs, nuts and dates.

title: Sausage And Egg Christmas Breakfast
instructions: Place croutons on bottom of greased 9 x 13-inch pan; top with cheese.
Cook sausage in skillet until brown; drain.
Crumble sausage over cheese.
Beat eggs; mix with mustard, milk, mushroom soup and mushrooms.
Pour over sausage.
May be refrigerated overnight if desired.
Bake in preheated oven at 300° for 1 1/2 hours.
May be reheated.
Serves 8.

title: Pineapple Carrot Cake
instructions: Sift dry ingredients into bowl.
Beat eggs, oil, buttermilk and vanilla; add to dry ingredients.
Blend well.
Add the rest of ingredients.
Bake in greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan at 350° for 45 minutes.
Remove from oven.
With fork, poke holes in top to cover surface.
Immediately spread with hot Buttermilk Glaze or Cream Cheese Frosting.

title: Homemade Oreo Ice Cream
instructions: Use only Grade A clean, uncracked eggs.

title: Bean Salad
instructions: Drain beans well. Mix mixture with beans. Store in the refrigerator overnight. Stir before serving.

title: Popeye'S Biscuits
instructions: Melt 1/2 stick butter in 13 x 9-inch pan.
In bowl, mix ingredients.
Dump onto floured surface.
Pat into 1-inch thickness; cut into biscuits.
Bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes.

title: Pumpkin Waffles
instructions: Sift together pumpkin, eggs, milk and butter.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, sugar and nutmeg.
Add dry ingredients to pumpkin mixture.
Stir until thoroughly combined.
Bake in waffle iron.

title: Zucchini Hot Dish
instructions: Cook zucchini and onion in water for 5 to 10 minutes.
Drain. Place 1/2 package herb stuffing in bottom of greased 12 x 9-inch baking pan. Cover with zucchini and onion mixture. Combine grated carrots, soup mixes and melted butter.
Spread over top. Cover with sour cream.
Sprinkle remaining stuffing on top. Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

title: Cauliflower Layered Salad
instructions: Layer lettuce, onion, bacon bits, cauliflower and cheese in bowl.
Mix other ingredients together well and spread on top.

title: Swedish Pancakes
instructions: Beat egg whites and fold in last.
Make small pancakes.

title: Belly Buttons
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.
Follow directions for pie crust mix. Roll out pie crust on a flat, floured surface.
Butter crust with butter or margarine.
Sprinkle on brown sugar until it covers pie crust, then sprinkle cinnamon over brown sugar.
Roll crust like a long, thin cinnamon roll.
Cut sections 1-inch thick.
Place sections on a buttered 13 x 9-inch casserole dish in an upright position so that the swirls are showing on both sides.
Bake 15 minutes.
Let cool 3 minutes and enjoy.

title: Onion Pie
instructions: Slice onions; add salt and pepper and smother in butter until tender.
Cover bottom of casserole with cracker crumbs.
Cook bacon until crisp.
When onions are very tender, place on top of crackers along with butter they were cooked in.
Crumble bacon on top of onions.
Top with grated cheese.
Beat eggs well; add sour cream and blend well.
Pour over the cheese.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Cover with foil and bake at 350° until set, about 35 minutes.

title: Chocolate Sheet Cake
instructions: Combine first 3 ingredients in bowl.
Heat oleo, shortening, water and cocoa in saucepan to boil; pour over flour mixture and mix well.
Beat together eggs, soda, milk and vanilla; add to batter.
Bake in greased, floured jelly roll pan 20 minutes at 350°.
Mix icing 5 minutes before cake is done.

title: Sour Cream Pecan Pie
instructions: Cream the oleo and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add slightly beaten eggs, syrup and vanilla.
Mix well.
Stir in chopped pecans and sour cream.
Pour in unbaked pie shell and garnish with whole pecans.
Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes.

title: Four-Cheese Lasagna
instructions: In skillet, cook beef, onion and garlic until beef is brown and onion is tender.
Drain.
In blender, process the tomatoes until smooth.
Stir into beef mixture along with mushrooms, tomato paste and seasonings.
Simmer 15 minutes.
In a bowl, combine cottage cheese, Parmesan, Cheddar, 1/2 cup Mozzarella and eggs. Spread 2 cups meat sauce in the bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.
Arrange half the noodles over sauce.
Spread cottage cheese mixture over noodles and meat sauce.
Cover and bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Uncover.
Sprinkle remaining Mozzarella.
Return to oven for 15 minutes or until cheese melts.
Yield:
12 servings.

title: Horseradish Ring
instructions: Dissolve Jell-O in 2 cups hot water.
Stir well.
Add cold water, salt and vinegar.
Stir.
Cool to jellied stage.
Stir in horseradish and whipped cream.
Pour into an oiled mold.
When thoroughly set, unmold.
Garnish with parsley leaflets.
Excellent with ham.

title: Baked Chicken Breasts
instructions: Rinse chicken breasts in cold water and pat dry.
In large bowl, combine sour cream, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, celery salt, paprika, salt, pepper and garlic; mix well.
Add chicken to sour cream marinade, covering each piece well.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.

title: Instant Spiced Tea
instructions: Mix well and store in an airtight container. For 1 serving, combine 2 tablespoons of tea mixture with 1 cup of boiling water.

title: Hawaiian Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Combine first five ingredients.
Stir in pecans.
Combine remaining ingredients and add to flour mixture, stirring until dry ingredients are moistened.
Spoon batter into 2 greased and floured 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 3-inch loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 10 minutes.
Cool in pan 10 minutes and remove and leave on wire racks.

title: Barbecue Beans
instructions: Cook bacon, ground beef and onion.
Add all other ingredients and mix together.
Place in baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: More Casserole
instructions: Brown beef, onion and bell pepper in a large roaster.
Add garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.
Cook spaghetti.
Add to the meat mixture the remaining ingredients.
Pour into 3 baking dishes and cover top with grated Cheddar cheese.
Bake 1 dish, uncovered, 30 to 45 minutes at 350°.
Freeze remaining dishes for future use.
(Whole recipe serves 12 to 15 people.)

title: Aunt Becky'S Ice Cream Pie
instructions: Mix and press into pie plate. Chill until firm and fill with your choice of ice cream.

title: Corn Casserole
instructions: Melt margarine; add flour.
Mix well.
Add remaining ingredients.
Put in large baking dish and cook in slow oven until thick.
Serves 8 to 10.

title: Swiss Vegetable Medley
instructions: Combine thawed vegetables, soup, 1/2 cup cheese, sour cream and 1/2 can French fried onions.
Pour into a 1-quart casserole. Bake covered at 350° for 30 minutes.
Top with remaining cheese and onions and bake for 5 minutes.

title: Microwave Eggplant-Rice Casserole
instructions: Cook eggplant in
water
and
salt
on	High 7 minutes; stir. Drain and
set
aside.
Melt butter in a 3-quart casserole and saute onion
and celery on High 5 minutes.	Add green onions, parsley and
garlic;
cook on High 3 minutes.
Stir in meat or shrimp.
Cover
and
cook on High 10 minutes, stirring twice. Drain off
fat.
Add
rice, eggplant, salt and pepper. Stir to mix.
Top
with
bread
crumbs
and cheese.
Cover and cook on medium 5 minutes or until heated.

title: Rocky Road Cake
instructions: Sift together flour, sugar and salt.
Add eggs and vanilla. Add walnuts.
Fold in melted margarine.
Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake 40 minutes at 350°.
Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with marshmallows.

title: Broccoli And Cauliflower Casserole
instructions: Cook broccoli and cauliflower according to package directions. Drain.
Place in a greased casserole dish.
Melt together soup and cheese.
Pour over broccoli and cauliflower.
Mix together melted butter and cracker crumbs.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes.
Serves 10.

title: Corn Bread Salad
instructions: Mix greens and dressing.
Place croutons on top.

title: Peanut Butter Fingers
instructions: Grease a 13 x 9-inch pan.
In large bowl, combine all ingredients, except chocolate chips.
Blend on low speed until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press in the bottom of prepared pan.
Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.
Sprinkle immediately with chocolate chips.
Let stand 5 minutes, then spread evenly.

title: Cheese Ball
instructions: Mix together the cheese at room temperature.
Roll in chopped parsley or paprika.

title: Impossible Coconut Pie
