instructions: Combine all the ingredients.
With use of a blender, hand beater or electric mixer, blend ingredients.
Grease a 9-inch pie plate.
Pour ingredients in pie plate.
Bake in oven at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes.

title: Vanilla Pudding
instructions: Scald milk.
Mix sugar, flour and salt together.
Add to scalded milk in heavy pan or double boiler.
Stir constantly. Cook until thick; add slightly beaten eggs and cook 2 minutes more.
Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla.
Stir until smooth and butter melts.

title: Sicilian Spinach Pie
instructions: Set oven to 350°.
Have a 13 x 9-inch baking dish on hand.
Use 1 tablespoon of olive oil to grease the pan.
In pan, heat the remaining oil and saute onion over medium-low heat for 15 minutes. Add olives and saute an additional 5 minutes.
Set aside.
Cut dough in half and roll out a piece to fit the bottom and sides of the pan.
Press into the pan.
Sprinkle with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.
Place uncooked spinach into Parmesan cheese.
Scatter the onion/olive mixture over the spinach and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese.
Roll out remaining dough and place on top.
Make 6 to 8 holes in top.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes, until the crust is brown.
Serve at once.

title: Breakfast Souffle
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°.
Cook the potatoes in skillet until they are just starting to brown.
Fry the sausage and/or bacon. Lightly grease a cake pan.
Press the biscuit dough into the pan until the bottom is covered.
Bake for 2/3 of the recommended time (about 8 minutes).
Press the biscuits down again.
Layer sausage and/or bacon in the biscuits.
Top with the cooked shredded potatoes.
Whip the eggs in a bowl with some milk and pour mix over potatoes.
Top with shredded cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes or until done.

title: Blueberry Buckle
instructions: Mix thoroughly the sugar, butter and eggs.
Stir in milk. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt.
Add to the batter, stirring well.
Toss the fresh blueberries in a little flour, then add them to the batter.
Pour into greased and floured pan.

title: Weight Watcher'S Garden Green Salad
instructions: Combine first 6 ingredients in a large bowl and toss well. Combine vinegar and remaining ingredients in a jar.
Cover tightly and shake vigorously.
Pour over lettuce mixture and toss gently. Yields 4 servings (about 58 calories per 1 1/2-cup serving).

title: Oyster Soup
instructions: Melt butter in large pot and add green onions, celery and garlic.
Cook until clear.
Add oysters and cook until ends curl (about 10 minutes).
Add bay leaves, thyme and parsley and stir. Add milk, cayenne pepper and, if needed, salt (oysters may be salty).
Bring to a slow boil and turn off immediately.

title: Angel Food Cherry Dessert
instructions: Crumble angel food cake into bite size pieces.
Prepare pudding according to directions, then mix whipped topping with pudding.
Put cake pieces in a 9 x 13-inch pan and top with the pudding mixture.
Chill.
Top with cherry pie filling and chill again.

title: Simple Cherry-Pineapple Crisp
instructions: Spread crushed pineapple in the bottom of baking dish. Spread cherry pie filling over the pineapple.
Spread yellow cake mix over pineapple and cherry filling.
Melt margarine and drizzle over the other ingredients.
Bake at 350° until golden brown on top.

title: Open House Punch
instructions: Put frozen lemonade and orange juice with ReaLemon juice in punch bowl.
Put in ice cubes or block of ice.
Pour 7-Up over this.
Add lemon, orange or rainbow sherbet on top for added zip.

title: Swiss Steak
instructions: Cut round steak into bite size pieces.
Chop onion and bell pepper.
Combine and brown in frying pan.
Add garlic salt, if desired.
Add tomato sauce.
Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve over rice.

title: Artichoke Dip
instructions: Drain artichoke hearts and chop in small pieces.
Add remaining ingredients.
(Add Tabasco only if you like spicy dip and mix.)
Put in 1-quart casserole dish or large pie plate.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.
Serve warm with crackers or chips.

title: Napple-O-Tata
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Peel sweet potatoes.
Slice into rounds 1 to 1 1/2-inches thick.
Melt 2 of the tablespoons of margarine over low heat.
In small bowl, mix cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger.

title: Oreo Cookie Ice Cream
instructions: Beat egg yolks; stir in Eagle Brand milk, water and vanilla. Fold in cookies and whipping cream. Pour into aluminum foil-lined 9 x 5-inch loaf pan or 2-quart container. Cover and freeze 6 hours or until firm. Makes 1 1/2 quarts.

title: Salt Water Taffy
instructions: Combine sugar, cornstarch, salt and Mazola.
Add Karo and water; stir until the mixture boils rapidly.
Boil to 252° or until when a little is dropped in cold water it forms a fairly hard ball. Flavor.
Pour onto a large buttered platter.
When cool enough to handle, oil the hands with a little Mazola and pull into a rope. Cut into 1-inch pieces.

title: Italian Sauteed Chicken With Italian Mushroom Rice
instructions: Cut each chicken breast into 3 long strips.
Dredge strips with mixture of flour and white pepper.
In a heavy skillet, melt 1 stick butter and add olive oil, garlic, rosemary and basil.
Saute chicken in this mixture and lightly brown.
Add wine and cook on low heat until 1/2 of wine has been reduced.
This may be done 3 or 4 hours before serving.
When ready to serve, reheat on low heat; remove the chicken and add 1/2 stick butter to remaining gravy. When hot, place chicken pieces on bed of hot Italian Mushroom Rice and spoon on gravy.
Serve immediately.
Serves 4.

title: Mexican Chicken Casserole
instructions: Mix chicken, cheese, onion, pepper, soups, chili powder and garlic power together.

title: Date Nut Cake
instructions: Boil sugar and butter. Let cool. Roll dates in flour. Add eggs and vanilla to sugar mix. Stir in dates and flour a little at a time. Add pecans. Bake at 250° for 2 1/2 hours.

title: Christmas Rainbow Poke Cake
instructions: Prepare cake mix as directed on package.
Pour batter into 2 round pans (8 or 9 x 1 1/2-inch).
Do not use pans with removable bottom.
Bake as directed; cool 10 minutes.
Remove from pans; cool completely.
Place cake layers, top side up, bake in the 2 clean pans; prick each cake layer.
Pour 1 cup of the boiling water over raspberry flavor gelatin in bowl; stir until gelatin is dissolved.
Spoon raspberry flavor gelatin over 1 layer.
Repeat with lime flavor gelatin.
Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours.
Dip 1 layer in pan with warm water 10 seconds.
Invert on plate, gently shaking to loosen.
Remove pan; spread layer with 1 cup of whipped topping.
Remove remaining layer from pan as directed; invert on first layer.
Remove from pan; frost with remaining topping. Refrigerate.
Garnish with flattened gumdrops to resemble holly.

title: Mexican Chicken Casserole
instructions: Boil fryer and debone.
Mix soup, tomatoes, onions and broth in a separate bowl.
Layer ingredients in 13 x 9-inch pan in following order:
chicken, cheese, chips and soup mixture until all used (save small amount of chips and cheese to sprinkle on top the last 10 minutes of cooking time).
Cook at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes until bubbly.

title: Ground Beef Casserole
instructions: In 2-quart casserole dish, microwave ground beef until done (3 1/2 minutes), stirring often.
Add remaining ingredients, except cheese.
Mix well.
Cook for 17 minutes on High, stirring twice. Sprinkle cheese over casserole.
Microwave 1 minute on High or until cheese is melted.

title: Longhorn Baked Eggs
instructions: Grease 6 custard cups or other microwave-safe dishes; set aside.
Place equal amounts of bacon and cheese in each cup.
Break 1 egg into each cup.
In small bowl, mix sour cream, milk and hot sauce until well blended.
Spoon 3 tablespoons sour cream mixture around each egg.
Gently break egg yolks with fork.
Place egg cups in microwave and cover with paper towel.
Cook 2 to 3 minutes on Medium power until eggs are set as desired.
Garnish with chopped green onions or diced tomatoes.

title: Danish Sweet Rolls
instructions: Mix the first 4 ingredients like pie crust. Add the eggs, milk and yeast mixture.
Beat.
Add 1 cup flour. Dough will be soft. Let set in refrigerator for several hours. Take out. Cut into 4 parts and roll out each part (like pie crust).
Spread with butter.
Cut into triangular wedges.
Roll each wedge from wide side to point. Let rise and bake 20 to 25 minutes at 350°.
Frost and sprinkle with nuts.

title: Broccoli And Rice Casserole
instructions: Saute onion in butter; add broccoli and cook until tender. Blend evaporated milk, soup and cheese.
Add rice and broccoli. Bake in greased casserole at 350° for 45 minutes.

title: Hot Barbecued Chicken Wings
instructions: Remove wing tips and cut wings in half.
Dust in mixture of flour and chili powder and fry in hot oil 8 to 10 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Heat together the Lea & Perrins sauce and hot pepper sauce.
Add the cooked chicken wings and simmer for a few minutes.

title: Creamy French Dressing
instructions: In a small mixing bowl or blender, combine vinegar, sugar, paprika, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, salt, dry mustard and red pepper.
With mixer running, slowly add oil in a thin steady stream.
Continue mixing until mixture reaches desired consistency. Serve immediately or cover and store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

title: Spicy Chicken
instructions: Place chicken in baking dish.
Pour dressing over chicken. Place chicken in oven.
Bake uncovered at 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: Low-Fat Banana Muffins
instructions: Cream sugar, Sweet 'N Low and Butter Buds.
Mix dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture.
Add sour cream, bananas, vanilla and nuts.
Mix gently.
Pour into muffin tins.
Bake at 375° for 20 to 30 minutes.

title: Peanut Butter Cookies(Club Member: Renee Evans)
instructions: Mix flour, salt and baking soda; set aside. Mix butter and peanut butter. Add your sugars. Mix well. Add eggs and beat well. Stir flour mixture in. Drop dough from spoon on baking pan. Flatten with fork. Bake at 375° for 10 to 15 minutes or until brown.

title: Pot Roast
instructions: Put roast in roasting pan.
Cover with water.
Add brown gravy mix; stir until dissolved.
Add whole onion.
Bake in oven for 3 hours at 350°.
Remove from oven.
Add vegetables; bake 45 minutes to 1 hour more.

title: Chicken Divan
instructions: Boil 2 to 3 quarts water. Add chicken. Turn flame off and let chicken sit in water.
Steam broccoli.
Make Stove Top according to package directions.
In a bowl, with a wire whisk, mix soup, broth and sour cream.
Lay chicken in bottom of rectangular casserole dish and broccoli.
Pour soup mixture over chicken and broccoli.
Spoon stuffing to cover entire top of dish. Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes at 325°.

title: Cauliflower With Mustard Sauce
instructions: Steam whole head of cauliflower.
Do not break head apart. After cauliflower is steamed, leave in pot.
Mix mayonnaise and mustard together and cover top of cauliflower.
Sprinkle sharp cheese on top of mustard sauce.
Cover and let cheese melt, then serve.

title: Mom'S 24 Hour Fruit Salad
instructions: Combine peach pie filling, pineapple, mandarin oranges, strawberries and apples.
Cover and place in refrigerator overnight.
One hour before serving, add kiwi and banana.
Serves 15.

title: Oven Fried Perch Parmesan
instructions: Dip fillets in milk.
Combine crumbs, Parmesan and thyme. Coat fish with bread crumbs.
Lay in single layer on greased shallow baking pan.
Bake in 450° oven for 10 minutes per inch of thickness of fish.
It is done when fish flakes easily with a fork.

title: Quay'S Tea Cakes
instructions: Make real stiff with flour.
Drop on lightly greased cookie sheet and mash with fork.
Bake at 350° for 5 to 8 minutes.

title: Andy'S Country Pie
instructions: Melt butter.
Add chips and melt.
Add remaining ingredients. Mix.
Pour into two unbaked pie shells.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

title: Stroganoff
instructions: Fry steak in pan until tender.
Mix soup, gravy and 1/2 of the sour cream in a pan; heat on low.
Cook noodles in boiling water until done.
When steak is cooked, add to the soup mixture.
When noodles are done add to the rest of the ingredients.
Mix well and let stand for a minute or two.
The extra sour cream is for adding before storing leftovers or if it is not moist enough.

title: Lazy Day Cobbler
instructions: In 9 x 9-inch pan, melt margarine (in oven).
Mix 1 cup white sugar,
flour, baking powder, salt and milk.
Mix well. Pour
over melted margarine.	Do not mix.
Pour over cherries and juice.
Do not mix.
Sprinkle 1/2 cup sugar over top.
Do not mix.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

title: Olive Cookies (Hors D'Oeuvres)
instructions: Mix all ingredients. Take 1 tablespoon and wrap around each olive. You can freeze these, then bake when you need them. Bake in a 400° oven until brown. Grease pan.

title: Chinese Almond Cookies
instructions: Reserve 36 almonds; finely chop or grind remainder.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt.
Thoroughly cream butter and sugar. Stir in remaining ingredients except whole almonds.
Form dough into 36 balls.
Place on greased cookie sheet.
Press an almond in center of each ball.
Bake in 350° oven for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.
Makes 3 dozen.

title: Strawberry Brunch Loaf
instructions: Stir together the flour, baking powder, salt and nutmeg. Combine the lemon peel, eggs, honey and oil.
Stir in the strawberries and almonds.
Add mixture all at once to flour mixture and stir only until flour is moistened.
Pour into greased 8 x 4-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes.
Cool in pan for 15 minutes before turning onto rack.

title: Green Tomato Relish
instructions: Bring to boil and boil for 1 minute.
Pack in jars and seal. Serve with fish.

title: Norma Hill'S Far East Celery
instructions: Precook celery slices in salted water until crisp-done; drain. Combine all ingredients in 1-quart casserole.
Toss the soft bread crumbs with the toasted slivered almonds and melted butter; sprinkle over casserole.
Bake in a 350° oven for 35 minutes, or until hot.
Excellent!

title: Pineapple Pie
instructions: Mix juice and milk together.
Add other ingredients.
Put in a pie shell and chill.
Makes 2 or 3 pies.

title: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
Pour into 2 layer pans.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

title: Cherry Chiffon Dessert
instructions: Combine ingredients in large bowl, folding together until blended.

title: Caramel Candy
instructions: Cook sugar, milk and Karo over medium heat until soft ball stage.
Remove.
Add 1 stick butter, 1 teaspoon vanilla and a pinch of salt.
Beat until thick and add pecans.
Drop by spoonfuls on wax paper.

title: Sally'S Pork Chop Casserole
instructions: Saut the onion in butter or margarine. Brown pork chops on both sides in separate pan. Layer sauteed onions, browned pork chops and onions in a 9 x 13 baking dish. In a small bowl, blend chili sauce, flour, salt, pepper and ginger ale. Pour mixture over pork chop/onion mixture. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Roast Turkey And Cornbread Stuffing
instructions: Rinse turkey and wipe dry; rub with oil, then salt and pepper. In a large bowl, combine stuffing mix with oil and vegetables; stir in broth.
Mix lightly.
Stuff loosely into neck and body cavities.
Skewer neck skin to back; tuck legs under skin band. Twist wings under turkey.
Place turkey breast-side up on a rack in a shallow roasting pan.
Place a tent of foil over turkey. Roast at 325° for 3 1/2 to 4 hours (180° to 185° on meat thermometer).
Remove foil last 1/2 hour.
Cornbread stuffing can be cooked separately, the last 45 minutes.

title: Banana Bread
instructions: Cream margarine and sugar; add eggs.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt together.
Add flour mixture and milk to creamed ingredients, then add mashed bananas, nuts and vanilla.
Pour into a greased loaf pan or bake as cupcakes.
(Makes 2 dozen cupcakes.)
Bake at 350°.
Cook the loaf for 45 minutes, cook the muffins for 25 minutes.

title: Polish Sausage Dinner
instructions: Peel and slice potatoes; core cabbage and slice in 1/2-inch pieces.
Peel and slice onions; slice Polish sausage.
Layer potatoes, onions, cabbage, then Polish sausage.
Add another layer of everything, but end with cabbage this time.
Salt and pepper as you later.
Cook on High in microwave 20 minutes.
Let set 20 minutes.
Serve.

title: Pecan Pies
instructions: Combine all but nuts together and set aside.
Place 1 cup nuts on bottom of each of 3 pie crusts.
Pour mixture over nuts divided equally among 3 pies.
Bake 1 1/2 hours at 325°.
Check for doneness after 1 hour.

title: Foundation Sweet Dough
instructions: Dissolve yeast	and
1	tablespoon
sugar
in
lukewarm water. Scald
milk;
add shortening, sugar and salt.
Cool to lukewarm. Add 2
cups
flour to make a batter.
Add yeast and beaten eggs, beat well.	Add remaining flour or enough to make a soft dough. Knead lightly and place in greased bowl.
Cover and set in	warm place,
free
from	draft.	Let
rise
until doubled in bulk, about 2 hours.
When light, punch dough down and shape as desired. Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes.

title: Chocolate Cake With Cream Cheese Filling
instructions: Mix together the first 10 ingredients.
Cream together remaining ingredients (except chocolate chips).
Use half of the chocolate cake batter; spoon out the cream cheese and half of the chocolate chips.
Spread over the top of the cake batter and pour rest of the batter over the top and top with chocolate chips. Bake at 350° for approximately 45 minutes.

title: Twinkie Cake
instructions: Bake cake mix in a 13 x 9-inch pan.

title: Shrimp Dip
instructions: Soften cream cheese at room temperature.
Cream together all ingredients thoroughly.
Serve with fresh vegetables, crackers or chips.

title: Chewies
instructions: Melt margarine and add all ingredients. Blend well. Bake at 325 degrees in a greased 9 x 13 pan for 30-35 minutes. Cool cut into squares.

title: Strawberry Brownie Torte
instructions: Grease two 9-inch round layer cake pans.
Line with wax paper extending up sides of pans; grease wax paper.

title: Sweet Sour Tuna
instructions: Blend cornstarch and vinegar in skillet.
Add sugar, catsup and shoyu. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Add tuna. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add pineapple and green pepper. Continue cooking for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

title: Shrimp Party Dip
instructions: In a large saucepan, bring soup to a boil, stirring often. Reduce heat and add cream cheese. Stir until smooth. Stir in celery, green onions, water chestnuts, shrimp, mayonnaise and dill. Heat through. Put dip in small slow cooker to keep warm. Serve with crackers.

title: Baked Spaghetti
instructions: Cook pasta and hamburger meat, drain both well.
Then add sauce to hamburger meat.
Layer in a casserole dish: sauce/meat mixture first,
spaghetti, cheeses.
Make two layers ending in cheeses.
Bake for 25 minutes in 425 degree oven until bubbly.

title: Chilled Cucumber Soup
instructions: Blend on high speed in blender, chopped cucumber and chicken broth 2 minutes.
Add sour cream.
Continue to blend 2 more minutes at high speed.
Chill before serving.

title: Cookie Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients except cookies.
Chill.
When ready to serve, add the cookies.

title: Hash Brown Quiche
ingredients: loose packed frozen hash brown potatoes
instructions: Press hash brown potatoes between paper towels to remove moisture.
Press hash browns onto bottom and up sides of a 9-inch pie plate to form a crust.
Drizzle melted margarine over crust. Bake crust in preheated 425° oven for 20 to 25 minutes until lightly browned.
Remove from oven.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°.
Toss together the ham; cheeses and hot pepper sauce.
Place in crust.
Beat the eggs, milk and seasoned salt together to form a smooth mixture.
Pour over ham and cheese.
Bake uncovered in 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes until knife comes out clean.
Let stand for 10 minutes.

title: Whipped Cream Pound Cake
instructions: Cream sugar and butter.
Add flavorings.
Add beaten eggs.
Add a little flour and whipping cream until flour is gone.
Pour into a greased and floured mold.
Bake at 325° in cold oven for about 1 1/2 hours.

title: Apple Squares
instructions: Mix salt with flour; cut in shortening.
Separate egg; save the white.
Add yolk to 2/3 cup water and beat.
Add to flour mixture.
Mix into soft ball stage.
Divide dough in half.

title: Superberry Slope
instructions: Prepare gelatin as directed on package.
Chill until slightly thickened.
Set aside 1/3 cup.
Add fruit to remaining gelatin; spoon into 4 or 5 glasses.
Tilt; chill until set.
Meanwhile, fold whipped topping into measured gelatin.
Spoon topping mixture into glasses.
Chill.
Garnish as desired.
Makes 4 or 5 servings.

title: Dumplings
instructions: Put flour, Crisco and salt in mixing bowl until it resembles corn meal.
Add milk and egg. Roll out on floured board and cut into strips.

title: Tuna Pasta Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
If too dry, add more mayo and vinegar. I garnish with spanish olives.
Chill and serve.

title: Tequila Berry Salad
instructions: Combine all ingredients. Serve on shredded lettuce.

title: Italian Salad Dressing
instructions: Combine all ingredients in blender. Blend on fast speed 30 seconds or longer. Pour into jar and refrigerate.

title: Cheese Ball
instructions: Mix all together well; form into ball and chill 1/2 hour. Roll in chopped nuts.

title: Sour Cream Pound Cake
instructions: Allow butter to soften at room temperature.
Sift cake flour and measure.
Add soda and salt to flour. Sift three times.
Set aside.
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add sour cream.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each one. Slowly add flour mixture.
Stir in vanilla.
Put batter into 10-inch tube pan sprayed with Baker's Joy.
Place in cold oven and bake at 300° for 1 1/2 hours.
As soon as cake is done, run knife around edge and remove from pan.

title: Pretzel Salad
instructions: Mix first 3 ingredients together and pat into a 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 400° 5 to 7 minutes. Cool 1 hour.

title: Homemade Cream Soup Mix(Lo-Fat)
instructions: Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Store in jar in cool, dry place. To make "legal" cream soup to equal 1 can condensed soup, combine 1/2 cup mix with 1 1/4 cups water or defatted broth. Cook until thick.

title: Pumpkin Bars
instructions: Combine oil, eggs and pumpkin in a large bowl.
Add sugar and dry ingredients, mixing well.
Pour batter into 10 x 15-inch greased and floured pan.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes. Frost with Cream Cheese Frosting.

title: Jim'S Breakfast Delight
instructions: Stir together the dry ingredients.
Add the remaining ingredients; mix well.
Pour into greased 7 x 11-inch baking dish. Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes, until set.
Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Serves 6.

title: Cheese Ball
instructions: Mix softened cream cheese, grated Cheddar cheese and Velveeta thoroughly. Add pecans, 1/2 teaspoon red pepper and garlic powder to cheese.
Mix paprika and chili powder on piece of waxed paper. Shape the cheese mixture into one large or two small logs and roll in the paprika and chili powder. Wrap and store in refrigerator or freezer.

title: German Potato Salad
instructions: Peel and cut raw potatoes into quarters and then into 1/2-inch slices.
Put in pot and barely cover with water.
Add onion, parsley, salt, caraway, marjoram and bay leaf.
Cook until potatoes are soft.
Make a roux from the butter and flour and add a little water from the cooked potatoes to thin.
Add this back to the potato mixture to thicken.
Stir in vinegar as desired for taste.

title: Sunshine Chocolate Cake
instructions: Mix all together.
Makes a large cake.
Bake at 350° until done.

title: Peanut Patties
instructions: Combine ingredients in large saucepan.
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Bring to boil.
Cook over medium heat to firm ball stage.
Remove from heat and add 2 tablespoons butter or margarine and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Cool slightly and then beat until thickens.
Drop on wax paper.

title: Alexandra'S Favorite Drumsticks
instructions: Heat oven to 425°.
Mix flour, salt, paprika and pepper in bowl.
Dip drumsticks
in margarine.
Roll in flour mixture to coat.
Arrange in ungreased square pan and bake, uncovered, until done, about 50 minutes.

title: Red Velvet Cake
instructions: Mix dry ingredients.
Beat the eggs with a fork.
Add oil and blend.
Add the dry ingredients, add buttermilk, food coloring, vinegar and vanilla.
Cook in 3 8=inch pans at 350 for 30 minutes.

title: Raspberry Poke Cake
instructions: Prepare cake mix as directed on package, baking in well-greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
Cool in pan 15 minutes, then poke with fork at 1/2-inch intervals.
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Add cold water and spoon over cake in pan.
Chill 3 to 4 hours.
Top with thawed Cool Whip.
Garnish with raspberries or colored sprinkles.
Serves 8.

title: Chess Bars
instructions: Mix all ingredients and press in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake for 30 minutes at 350°.

title: Veal Scallopini
instructions: Saute garlic in oil over low flame for 5 minutes.
Discard garlic.
Brown cutlets in oil.
Mix flour, pepper and nutmeg; sprinkle over brown meat.
Add onion and wine.
Cover skillet and simmer about 20 minutes, turning meat several times.
Add more liquid (wine or tomato juice) if necessary.
Add mushrooms; cover and cook 8 to 10 minutes longer.
Serve on a warm platter with sauce, garnished with paprika and parsley.
Yield:
4 servings. Approximate calories/serving:

title: Coconut Cake
instructions: Use liquid as directed on cake mix box, but instead of egg whites, use 2 whole eggs.
Mix as directed and bake in oblong pan at 325° for 30 minutes.
Cool cake, but not completely.
Punch holes in cake and pour 1 can Coco Lopez over cake.
Top with Cool Whip and another 1/2 can of coconut.
Refrigerate.
Cake is better to let it set overnight.

title: Potato Casserole
instructions: Mix 1 stick margarine, potatoes, sour cream, undiluted chicken soup, onion, cheese, salt and pepper.
Divide into 2 greased 9-inch pans.
Cover each with topping of crushed corn flakes and other stick of melted margarine.
Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes.
You may freeze one for later use if desired.
Very good piping hot!!

title: Chicken Squares
instructions: Cook chicken (save broth) and rice.
Soak bread in broth.
Add chicken, rice, celery, salt, pimento and soup.
Mix well.
Stir in eggs.
Place in greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour or until firm.
Cut in squares and serve with chicken or mushroom soup on top.
(The mixture will seem runny but it firms up when baked.)
Easy recipe and delicious!

title: Hawaiian Beans
instructions: Fry hamburger in chunks.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add S & W beans.
Add a little water to thin.

title: Black Bottom Cupcakes
instructions: Beat together cream cheese, egg, 1/3 cup sugar and 1/8 teaspoon salt.
Add chocolate chips.
Sift together flour, 2 cups sugar, cocoa, 1 teaspoon salt and soda.
Add water, oil, vinegar and vanilla.
Mix well.
Use small muffin pans and papers.
Fill muffins 1/2 full with chocolate batter.
Drop in 1/2 teaspoon cream cheese mix in center of each.
Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
Makes 5 dozen.

title: Fruit Delite
instructions: Mix together and put in bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake 10 minutes.
Let cool.

title: Snowflake Square
instructions: Cream shortening. Add sugar slowly while creaming mix.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt.
Combine milk and almond extract. Add flour and milk alternately to creamed mixture.
Beat egg whites until stiff, but not dry. Fold in. Pour into 10-inch square shallow cake pan. Bake in moderate oven at 375° for 30 minutes. Cool.
Frost as desired. Cut into squares.

title: Baked Potato Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients in bowl and put in well greased baking dish.
Cover and bake for one hour and fifteen minutes.
Remove foil and bake 15 minutes more.
Bake at 375°.
Serves 10 to 12 people.

title: Mama'S Tea Cakes *
instructions: Cream sugar and oleo.
Add egg and vanilla and beat well. Sift together soda and flour; add to first mixture.
Drop by spoonfuls on cookie sheet.
Bake at 350° until light brown.

title: Lemon Cake Pie
instructions: Beat egg yolks; beat in lemon peels, lemon juice and milk.
Add sugar, flour and salt; beat until smooth.
Beat egg whites in separate bowl until stiff peaks form.
Beat lemon mixture into egg whites on low speed until blended, about 11 minutes.
Pour into 1 (9-inch) uncooked pastry.
Bake until golden brown, 45 to 50 minutes.
Top with whipped cream when serving if desired.

title: Quick Apple Butter
instructions: Bring to a boil and cook for 30 minutes.

title: 5 Pound Cake
instructions: Mix first 2 ingredients together.
Add eggs, one at a time. Then add vanilla and food coloring.
Beat with mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Alternate flour and milk until mixed thoroughly.
Bake in a 350° oven in 3 round 8-inch pans for 30 minutes.

title: Low-Fat Apple Crisp
instructions: Heat oven to 375°.
Mix together apple filling, water and granulated sugar in a bowl.
In another mixing bowl, mix together all the dry ingredients.
Fold the two together and spoon into a square baking dish that has been sprayed with nonfat cooking spray.
Bake about 30 to 40 minutes, until set and golden brown on top.

title: Cranberry Chiffon Pie
instructions: Add 1 cup of boiling water to gelatin to dissolve.
Cool and add cranberries.
Let slightly congeal and fold in whipped topping.
Place in prepared pie crust.
Refrigerate 1 or 2 hours to set.

title: Mom'S Frozen Fruit Cups
instructions: Thaw juices a little, then mix all ingredients together. Freeze in 3-ounce plastic cups. Remove from freezer 30 to 45 minutes before serving. Makes 32 (3 ounce) servings.

title: Bread And Butter Pickles
instructions: Mix cucumbers, onions and salt; let stand for 1 or 2 hours. Rinse and drain well.
Let stand for 5 hours longer.
Drain, but do not rinse.
Boil vinegar, water, sugar and spices for 3 minutes.
Add cucumbers and onions and simmer 10 to 20 minutes (do not boil).
Pack into jars and seal at once.

title: Orange Congealed Salad
instructions: Put pineapple in a pan and bring to a boil.
Add jello and mix well.
Let cool.
Add buttermilk, nuts and Cool Whip.
Mix well. Pour into a large dish.
Refrigerate until firm.

title: Broccoli Cornbread
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
Spray dish with Pam cooking spray.
Bake at 300° to 325°° for 1 hour.

title: Scalloped Potatoes
instructions: Slice potatoes and place in greased casserole.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Combine chicken soup and evaporated milk.
Dot with margarine.
Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes at 325°.
Serves 4.

title: Haddock In Cream
instructions: Mix lemon, pepper, salt, mustard and Worcestershire sauce.
Mix with cream and pour over fish.
Add onions and bake at 400° for 30 minutes.

title: Pork Vegetable Roast(Microwave)
instructions: Place roast in 4-quart casserole.
Sprinkle with garlic salt and pepper as desired.
Add remaining ingredients.
Cook, covered, on cook level 3 for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until thoroughly cooked, no longer pink and temperature of 170° is reached.
Turn roast over halfway through cooking time.
Yield: 6 to 8 servings.

title: Zucchini Bread
instructions: Mix sugar, eggs and oil well.
Add flour, soda, cinnamon, baking powder and salt.
Beat well.
Add grated zucchini and nuts. Bake in two small loaf pans at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Mary Frances Glass' Chicken And Rice Salad
instructions: Combine cooked chicken, rice, dressings and chopped ingredients.
Prepare and refrigerate 12 to 24 hours before serving.
Serve cold.

title: Green Pea Salad
instructions: Tear lettuce into bite size pieces.
Sprinkle celery and onion on top of lettuce.
Pour frozen peas on top.
Sprinkle sugar over peas.
Place crumbled bacon over peas and sugar.
Dab 4 mounds of mayonnaise on the entire salad.
Cover and refrigerate 24 hours. Toss immediately before serving.

title: Sweet Potatoes
instructions: Combine potatoes, milk, butter, sugar, egg and salt.
Mix well. Pour into greased 1-quart casserole.
Sprinkle additional brown sugar to taste over top.
Place 4 or 5 pats butter on top.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.
Top with marshmallows.
Broil until lightly brown.
Makes 8 servings.

title: Wacky Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°. Mix ingredients in a large bowl in the order given, adding water last. Stir only until moistened. Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan sprayed with Pam.
Bake for 30 minutes. Cool on rack.
Serve with chilled peaches and whipped topping or ice cream.

title: Pumpkin Pie Cake
instructions: Mix cake mix, melted butter and 1 egg.
Pour and press into lightly greased cake pan.
Mix pumpkin, 2 eggs, sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and milk.
Pour over crust mix.
Mix remaining ingredients until crumbly; sprinkle over pumpkin mixture.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Cool and serve with whipped topping.

title: Oatmeal Pancakes
instructions: Combine syrup, milk and egg.
Add pancake mix, oatmeal, shortening and pecans.
Beat lightly until well blended.
Cook on hot greased griddle or skillet.

title: Chinese Steak And Vegetables
instructions: Tenderize steak according to package directions.
Slice thinly into strips.
Heat enough oil in frying pan just to coat bottom of pan.
Add 1 tablespoon margarine.
Quickly stir-fry onions and garlic until onions are limp.
Remove from pan.
Add zucchini and carrots and saute until limp.
Add mushrooms and stir until heated. Remove vegetables from pan.
Add meat and brown lightly (add a little more oil if necessary).
Return all vegetables to pan with meat and add soy sauce, Accent, pepper and gravy mix.
Mix well. Turn heat to low and cover pan.
Simmer until meat is tender, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve over rice.
Makes 2 to 3 servings.

title: Meat Loaf Barbecue Style
instructions: Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg, salt, pepper and 1/2 can tomato sauce.
Form into loaf and put into shallow 7 x 10-inch pan. Combine rest of tomato sauce and rest of ingredients.
Pour over loaf.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Baste occasionally.

title: Kathy'S Lasagna
instructions: Brown ground beef and drain.
Add garlic, parsley, basil, salt, tomatoes and tomato paste.
Simmer uncovered until thickened.
Cook noodles and drain.
Rinse in cold water.
Combine egg, cottage cheese, salt and pepper, parsley and the Parmesan cheese.
Alternate layers of noodles, cottage cheese mixture, beef mixture and Mozzarella cheese.
Bake 30 minutes at 375°.
Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

title: Osso Bucco
instructions: In 8-quart Dutch oven over medium heat, pour in olive oil. Cook veal, a few pieces at a time, until well browned on all sides.
In drippings over medium heat, cook onion, celery, carrots and garlic until browned and tender.
Return veal to Dutch oven. Add tomatoes and next 5 ingredients over high heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 1 1/2 to 2 hours, until veal is pork tender, stirring occasionally.
When veal is done, skim off fat.
Stir in parsley and lemon peel.
Serve with rice and green beans.

title: Scalloped Potatoes
instructions: Peel potatoes and slice; put in 2-quart casserole dish.
Stir in cream of chicken soup and 1 can of water.
Slice butter and put on top of potatoes.
Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

title: Party Salad
instructions: Mix milk and Cool Whip; refrigerate for one hour.
Add cherry pie filling and crushed pineapple.
Mix well; add pecans and refrigerate until serving time.

title: Shrimp Salad
instructions: Shred cabbage into bowl.
Open shrimp and drain juice.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Fix Stove Top stuffing according to directions on the box, then place on the bottom of a baking dish.
Pour cream of celery soup on top of stuffing; do not stir.
Then place chicken breast on top of soup.
Then pour the cream of mushroom soup on the top.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes until chicken is done.

title: Broccoli-Carrot Stir-Fry
instructions: For sauce, in a bowl, stir together orange juice, dry sherry and cornstarch; set aside.

Preheat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add cooking oil (add more cooking oil as necessary during cooking). Stir-fry ginger root in hot oil for 15 seconds. Add carrots and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add broccoli and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until
crisp-tender. Push vegetables from the center of the wok or skillet.
Stir sauce; add to center of wok. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Stir in vegetables and walnuts to coat. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

title: Ham Loaf(Microwave)
instructions: Mix ground ham and
pork
with crumbs, water, onion and pepper.
Mold into flat
loaf
in 9-inch pie plate.
Microwave at Medium.
Set temperature to 170° for 11 to 14 minutes.

title: Cookie Cookies
instructions: Mix
all dry ingredients until dry buds form.
Add egg. Roll into balls, place on cookie sheet, flatten.
Bake at 375° for 7 minutes.

title: Mothers Roast Beef And Dumplings
instructions: Place the beef roast in a large cooking vessel with salt, pepper and other seasonings; cover roast with cold water about two inches over top. Cook on medium high heat until roast is tender. Remove roast from boiling stock and let cool for several minutes. Slice or tear roast into strips. Place back into stock; bring to a boil and add prepared dumplings. Cook for about 15 minutes.

title: Herbed Carrot Potato Salad
instructions: Combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, sour cream, lemon juice, chives, Worcestershire, salt, dill weed, mustard and pepper until well combined.
In a medium pan, heat small amount of water to boiling; add carrots and simmer, uncovered, for 2 minutes.
Drain. Rinse with cold water; drain again.
In a large bowl, gently toss together the sliced potatoes, sliced carrots, celery and olives. Add sour cream mixture.
Gently toss to coat well.
Cover and chill several hours.

title: Emily'S Mussels In Wine
instructions: With a stiff brush, scrub mussels with running cold water to remove sand or beards.
In a 5-quart Dutch oven or saucepot, over medium heat, in hot oil, cook onion and garlic until tender.
Stir in tomatoes with their liquid, wine and basil.
Then heat to a boil over high heat.
Add mussels and once again heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until mussels open, about 5 minutes.
Serve with bread and salad.

title: Sugarless Spice Cake
instructions: In saucepan, cook raisins in water until water evaporates. Add applesauce, eggs, sweetener and oil; mix well.
Blend in baking soda and flour.
Stir in cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla. Pour into a greased 8 x 8-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until cake tests done.
Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

title: Chicken Feathers Voo-Doo Casserole
instructions: Mix all ingredients, except noodles.
Cook in 350° oven for 40 minutes or until bubbly.
Sprinkle chow mein Chinese noodles over top and cook for about 5 minutes more.

title: Raisin Bran Muffins
instructions: Combine flour, soda, salt, sugar and cereal.
Add milk, shortening and eggs.
Bake at 400° for 15 to 18 minutes or microwave on Medium 4 1/2 minutes.
Unbaked batter keeps in Tupperware in refrigerator for up to 6 weeks.

title: Pumpkin Cake Roll
instructions: Mix dry ingredients and set aside.
Beat eggs; add sugar and then pumpkin and lemon juice.
Fold dry ingredients into pumpkin mixture.
Spread in greased and floured 15 x 10 x 1-inch pan.
Top with nuts.
Bake at 375° for 15 minutes.
Turn out on towel sprinkled with powdered sugar.
Roll cake and towel together.
Let cool and unroll.

title: Fried Ice Cream
instructions: Roll a scoop of ice cream (any flavor) in crushed corn flakes. Freeze.
Roll out a canned biscuit or pie pastry and wrap ice cream, being careful to seal all edges.
This may be returned to freezer until ready to fry.
Heat oil to 400° and drop ice cream in for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
Drain.
Top with maple syrup and nuts.
Most any kind of ice cream topping will do fine.
Serve at once.

title: Frito-Squash Casserole
instructions: Mix ingredients given except for Fritos and cheese. Pour into baking dish and cover with Fritos and grated cheese. Bake at 375° until onions done.

title: Banana Split Cake
instructions: Mix graham crackers and 1 stick melted butter.
Beat for 5 minutes.
Place in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix powdered sugar, eggs and 2 sticks melted butter.
Spread on graham cracker crust.

title: Florence'S Old-Fashioned Chocolate Icing
instructions: Cook this a little longer than	previously
and pour on cake.

title: Traveling Taco Dip
instructions: Spread beans over bottom of 10-inch glass pie plate.
Layer remaining ingredients in the order listed.
Serve with tortilla chips.
Makes 8 servings.
Preparation time:
10 minutes.

title: Calico Beans
instructions: Cut bacon into 1-inch pieces.
Fry until bacon begins to get crisp; add ground beef and onion.
Cook until beef is done.
Add beans and all other ingredients.
Turn heat down low and simmer 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: Chicken And Andouille Smoked Sausage Gumbo
instructions: Remove excess fat from chicken.
Rub with salt, garlic powder and red pepper.
Let stand 30 minutes.
Combine onions, bell peppers and celery in a medium bowl; set aside.
Combine flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/2 teaspoon red pepper in paper or plastic bag.
Add chicken pieces and shake until chicken is coated.
Reserve 1/2 cup of the flour.

title: Monkey Bread
instructions: Mix sugar and cinnamon together.
Tear small pieces of dough off, dip in melted butter, then in sugar mixture.
Drop into Bundt cake pan.
Let raise to within 1 inch of top of pan.
Bake at 350° until brown.

title: Ground Meat & Rice
instructions: Brown meat in butter.
Add: soup, rice and water.
Cover and cook for about 5 minutes or until rice is done.

title: Orange Slice Cookie
instructions: Dice the pound of orange slices and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of flour.
Beat eggs until light and fluffy.
Add brown sugar and flour and salt.
Mix well and add chopped nuts. Turn batter into a greased and floured jelly roll pan or 9 x 15-inch pan.
Bake at 340° for 35 minutes.
Cut while still warm and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

title: Patti'S Icing
instructions: Mix together at high speed for 5 minutes.

title: Burrito Casserole
instructions: Cook beef with onion and garlic; drain fat. Mix tomato sauce with browned hamburger and onions; set aside. Soften tortillas in microwave. Spread first tortilla with refried beans; sprinkle heavily with grated cheese. Put in the bottom of a round 1 1/2-quart casserole.

title: Crab Stuffed Portabella Mushrooms
instructions: Mix first 6 ingredients together in a bowl.
Take the stem out of the mushroom cap. Stuff each cap and place in 350° oven for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with more Parmesan cheese and broil until golden brown.

title: Spoon Hot Rolls
instructions: Mix warm water and yeast. Melt margarine.
Add margarine, sugar, egg and flour to yeast.
Mix well.

title: Chess Cake
instructions: Mix together 1 egg, melted butter and cake mix.
Pat this mixture down in a 9 x 13 inch pan.

title: Mexican Cornbread
instructions: Cook hamburger, bell peppers and onion.
Add cheese.
Add to meal, corn, oil, milk and salt.
Mix all together and bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes or until brown.

title: Party Mix
instructions: Mix together popcorn oil and dressing mix; set aside.
Put cereal, nuts, pretzels and crackers in big bowl and mix together. Put oil mixture on to coat and let set for 6 hours tossing ingredients together every couple of hours.

title: Broccoli And Rice Casserole
instructions: Combine the onions, celery, broccoli, water and butter.
Bring to a boil.
Cook for 10 to 15 minutes.
Season to taste.
Stir in cheese, blending well.
Add soup, mixing well.
Stir in rice.
Put into deep, buttered casserole dish and bake for 30 minutes in 350° oven or until hot and bubbly.

title: Parkay Orange Holiday Cookies
instructions: Mix flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda and salt in small bowl.
Beat margarine, sour cream, sugar, vanilla, orange extract and peel in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy.
Blend in egg.
Gradually add flour mixture, beating well after each addition.

title: Irish Soda Bread
instructions: Heat oven to 375°.
Combine flours, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Stir in raisins and caraway seed.
Add enough buttermilk to make a dough that is firm, but not dry.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until it is smooth, 2 or 3 minutes.

Shape the dough into a round loaf and, using a sharp knife, slash a large X 1/4-inch deep across the top. Place loaf on a lightly greased baking sheet and bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the bottom of the loaf sounds hollow when tapped.

title: Green Beans With Fresh Tomatoes
instructions: Cook green peppers and onion in hot oil in skillet over medium heat until soft, 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes, oregano and salt. Simmer 10 minutes.
Trim beans. Cut into 1-inch lengths.
Cook until tender, about 8 to 10 minutes; drain.
Stir sauce into beans.
Cook just to heat through.
Serves 4.
Contains 120 calories, 3 g protein, 5 g fat and 280 mg sodium per serving.

title: Spanish Stew
instructions: *The more celery, peppers and onions the better.

title: Manicotti Florentine
instructions: Saute onion and garlic in butter until tender.
Combine sauteed vegetables, spinach, cheeses, eggs, lemon juice, salt and pepper; mix well.
Fill noodles with spinach mixture, place in 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Cover; bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
Heat sauce; pour over noodles.
Sprinkle with additional Parmesan cheese, if desired.

title: Protein-Plus Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to
mixing
bowl,
stir the soy flour, nonfat dry milk powder, baking powder and salt together thoroughly.
Stir
in
the	chopped dates and chopped walnuts. Combine
the eggs, grated orange peel, orange juice, honey and cooking
oil.
Stir
the
egg mixture into the dry ingredients just
until
moistened.
Fill
greased
muffin
cups 2/3 full. Bake at 350° until done, about 30 minutes.	Makes 12 muffins.

title: Browned Chicken And Salsa
instructions: Use chicken legs, thighs and wings from Paul's Baked Chicken Breast. Brown in butter. Add your favorite salsa. Cover and simmer until chicken pieces are done. Do not allow salsa to break down. Simmer approximately 30 minutes. Serve over rice, pasta, potatoes or polenta. Serves 4.

title: Ham And Corn Chowder
instructions: Mix ham, milk, corn and soup in 3 qt. saucepan. Heat to boiling, stirring occasionally; reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with onions.

title: Stuffed Sweet Peppers
instructions: Mix ground beef, onion, 2/3 cup chopped pepper and cooked rice.
Add crumbled bread and tomato juice; mix well.
Take seeds out of the 8 sweet peppers and drop peppers in boiling water for 5 minutes; drain and fill with ground beef mixture.
Put in a large pot with lid and pour ketchup over top of peppers.
Add 1/2 cup of tomato juice to pot.
Cover and cook 2 hours in oven at 350°. Uncover and cook 30
minutes.

title: Milk Shakes
instructions: Spin all ingredients together in the blender or food processor.
Serves 1.

title: Russian Tea Cookies
instructions: Mix thoroughly the butter and sugar.
Sift together the flour and salt and stir in.
Stir in nuts and form into 1-inch balls. Bake at 400° for 14 to 17 minutes, then roll in confectioners sugar while still warm.

title: Easy Pound Cake
instructions: Put all ingredients in a bowl and beat for 12 minutes until well combined.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Glazed Carrots
instructions: Cut carrots into long thin strips.
Set aside.
Combine brown sugar, margarine, water, salt and cinnamon in 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.
Microwave on High (100%) until margarine is melted, 45 seconds to 1 1/2 minutes.
Stir to blend.
Stir in carrots until coated.
Cover, microwave on High (100%) until carrots are tender, 5 to 8 minutes, stirring once.
Serves 4 to 6.

title: Party Bread
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a bowl and put into a greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

title: Chicken Parmesan
instructions: Roll chicken in a mixture of flour, salt, pepper and garlic powder.
Brown in oil.
Place chicken in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish; sprinkle with Parmesan and then Mozzarella.
Pour spaghetti sauce over chicken.
Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 45 minutes. Serve with spaghetti or vermicelli.
Serves 6 to 8.

title: Cucumber Salad
instructions: Peel cukes, slice or grate, also the onion.
Sprinkle with salt and set aside for 1 hour.
Squeeze a few at a time (discarding liquid).
Pour the vinegar, water, sugar, black pepper and green pepper and mix thoroughly. Add enough sour cream to make it a bit soupy. Sprinkle paprika on top before serving.

title: Buttercake
instructions: Mix butter and sugar.
Add all other ingredients.
Pour into a greased Bundt pan.
Bake at 325° to 350° for 1 hour.

title: Pecan Pie
instructions: In large bowl, stir first 4 ingredients until well blended. Stir in pecans.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake in 350° oven for 50 to 55 minutes or until knife inserted halfway between center and edge comes out clean.
Cool.
Serves 8.

title: Asparagus Casserole
instructions: Cut eggs and asparagus into pieces.
Crumble 3 crackers in casserole.
Add all ingredients in layers with crackers and cheese on top.
Add milk and asparagus juice.
Bake 30 minutes at 350°.

title: Southern Stewed Corn
instructions: Cut corn from cob.
Heat butter or margarine in skillet and add corn.
Cook at medium for about 5 minutes, stirring often (may stick to bottom of pan if not stirred often).
Sprinkle flour, sugar and salt on top of corn and stir well.
Add milk and stir again.
Continue cooking at low heat for another 10 to 15 minutes, stirring often.
Serves 6.

title: Chocolate Drop Cookies
instructions: Stir cocoa and sugar into Master Mix.
Combine milk, beaten egg and vanilla.
Stir into mix and blend well.
Drop by teaspoons on greased baking sheet.
Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes. Yields 2 1/2 dozen.

title: Billy Goat Cookies
instructions: Cream butter, sugar, eggs and water.
Beat well.
Add flour, soda and spices.
Mix well.
Add ground raisins and nuts.
Drop on cookie sheet.
Bake at 375° until light brown.

title: Barbecue Sauce
instructions: Chill and keep in refrigerator for a good long time.

title: Easter "Cheese"
instructions: You will need cheesecloth.

title: Snicker Bar Salad
instructions: Dice apples with peeling on.
Slice bananas and the refrigerated candy bars into bite size pieces.
Fold in Cool Whip.

title: Peanutty Fudge Rounds
instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together peanut butter and softened butter. Add powdered sugar, milk and vanilla. Stir until well combined. Stir in peanuts. Shape the mixture into two 10-inch rolls. Set aside.

title: Baked Oatmeal
instructions: Bake 30 minutes at 350° in 8 x 12-inch pan.

title: Taco In The Round
instructions: Brown hamburger in skillet with finely chopped onion. When brown, remove from heat and drain; then add taco seasoning. Stir until well mixed. Cover and let stand. Separate crescent rolls into 8 triangles per package.

Place triangle rolls on pizza pan in a circle, overlapping when necessary with the wide end toward the center of the pan. Let the pointed end hang off the side of the pan. There should be a circle in the middle of the pan about 5-inches across that is not covered. Place one scoop of the hamburger mixture in each crescent roll, then bring the pointed end over it to make a bundle. Continue this process until all rolls are filled and covered. Bake at 375° for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cut tomatoes into cubes. Break lettuce into bite size pieces. When taco is removed from oven, let cool slightly, then sprinkle lettuce and tomato in the center of the pan. Cover with shredded cheese.

title: Mexican Cornbread
instructions: Mix cornmeal, corn and eggs.
Pour half into 2-quart baking dish.
Add uncooked sausage evenly on top.
Put cheese evenly on top.
Add rest of cornmeal to this.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Sweet-N-Sour Pork
instructions: Drain pineapple, reserving juice. In large skillet, heat corn oil over medium heat.
Add green pepper (cut into 1-inch squares), onion (cut in thin wedges) and garlic.
Stir-fry 2 minutes or until tender-crisp.
Remove from skillet.
Stir-fry pork, half at a time, for 3 minutes. Return all pork to skillet.

title: German Chocolate Icing
instructions: Cook first 4 ingredients until thick.
Add vanilla, coconut and nuts.
Spread on cake.

title: Sweet And Sour Meatballs
instructions: Mix thoroughly the beef, crumbs, onion, egg, salt, ginger and milk.
Shape mixture into balls.
Melt shortening in a large skillet; brown and cook meatballs.
Remove meatballs, but keep warm.
Pour off fat from skillet.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Put prepared stuffing in an 8-inch square pan.
Shred chicken and put on top of stuffing.
Layer on chopped broccoli.
Mix the mayonnaise, soup and cheese; pour on top of broccoli.
Crush Ritz crackers and put on top.
Bake for 1 hour at 350°.

title: Potato Strips With Cheese
instructions: Put strips into greased baking dish and pour the milk over them.
Dot with butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Cover and bake at 425° for 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley; bake, covered, 5 minutes more.

title: Non-Alcoholic Wedding Punch
instructions: Mix together and chill until serving time. Float orange and lemon slices on top.
Makes 100 servings.

title: Haystack Cookies
instructions: Melt peanut butter and morsels and fold in potatoes and pecans.
Spoon out on wax paper.

title: Date Nut Roll
instructions: Pour milk into large bowl.
Add marshmallows, nuts and dates. Mash crackers into fine crumbs; save 3/4 cup crumbs to roll on outside of roll.
Add remaining crumbs to milk mixture and mix thoroughly.
Use hands to shape into 3 or 4 rolls.
Pour crumbs on waxed paper and roll on outside of each roll.
Wrap separately in waxed paper and foil and store in refrigerator until chilled.

title: Punch
instructions: Mix Jell-O in boiling water. add sugar and mix thoroughly. Add cold water, lemonade, pineapple juice and extract. Freeze in plastic container. Thaw, but not completely and add ginger ale.

title: Duffy'S Poppy Seed Cake
instructions: Grease and flour a 10-inch tube or Bundt pan.
Stir together the poppy seed and buttermilk; cover and refrigerate overnight. Sift together flour, baking powder, soda and salt.
Cream the butter and sugar.
Beat in eggs one at a time.
Beat in vanilla and grated orange rind.
Stir in flour mixture alternately with poppy seed mixture, mixing until just smooth each time.
Turn half the batter in prepared pan; sprinkle with sugar, cinnamon mixture; add remaining batter.
Bake in 350° oven for 1 hour or until inserted toothpick comes out clean.
Place cake on wire rack to cool 10 minutes.
Remove cake from pan to cool completely.
The cake becomes moist when stored in a tightly covered container for several days.

title: Pina Colada Fruit Dip
instructions: Mix in blender and chill. Cut up fruit and dip.

title: Zucchini Bread
instructions: Cream together sugar, oil and eggs; blend in flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and vanilla. Mix well. Add zucchini and nuts. Blend by hand. Pour into 13 x 5 x 3 loaf pan. Bake at 350° for 1 hour. Makes 2 loaves.

title: White Christmas Cake
instructions: In a large saucepan, bring margarine or butter and 3/4 cup water to boiling, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
Add baking bar; stir until melted.
Stir in buttermilk, eggs and rum extract; set aside.
Sir together 1/2 cup of the flour and the pecans; set aside.
In an extra bowl, stir together remaining 3 cups flour, sugar, coconut, soda and powder.
Stir in margarine mixture.
Fold in coconut mixture.
Stir in margarine mixture. Fold in pecan mixture.

title: Low-Fat Snicker Pie
instructions: Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Pour into 2 graham cracker crust pies.
Freeze!
Cut each pie into 8 pieces.
One slice counts 2 fat grams.

title: Texas-Style Potatoes
instructions: Mix together and pour into pan.
Top with 2 cups crushed corn flakes, add 1 stick oleo, melted and drizzled over corn flakes. Bake in 450° oven 35 to 45 minutes.

title: Heavenly Hash
instructions: Melt chocolate chips with water and Karo
on
low heat. Add vanilla, nuts and marshmallows.
Stir
until
marshmallows are coated but not melted.
Pour into buttered layer cake pan. Put in freezer until set.
Cut into pieces.
Store
in refrigerator.

title: Salmon Party Log
instructions: Mix salmon and cream cheese in a bowl by hand.
Dice 1 small onion and mix.
Add salt, horseradish and lemon juice.
Mix until all is blended.

title: Meat Loaf
instructions: Mix 1/2 cup mushroom soup with remaining ingredients.
Shape into loaf.
Place in shallow baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.
Blend remaining soup, 1/4 cup water and 2 tablespoons drippings.
Heat and stir often.
Serve with loaf.
Makes 4 to 6 servings.

title: Mary Jane'S Squash
instructions: Slice squash crosswise into wheels.
Layer in saucepan with sliced onion, salt, pepper and butter (dotted on squash).
Put pan on medium heat and when lid is hot, turn down to simmer and stir from time to time until tender, about 1/2 hour altogether.

title: Crab Casserole
instructions: Chop
and
saute
celery, onion, garlic and pepper in a small amount
of
oil.
Put
crackers in a bowl and cover them with water.
When
they are soaked, take them out and squeeze out
as much
water as you can.
Mix together all ingredients and
season to taste with salt and seafood seasoning.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Cheese Corn Bread
instructions: Prepare corn bread mix as directed; add cheese and bake.

title: Acini Di Pepe Salad
instructions: Cook acini like macaroni, drain, but not too dry as it will absorb additional moisture as it cools.
Rinse and cool.
Cook sugar, flour, juices, salt and egg yolks until thick, then cool. Mix acini and cooked mixture together; refrigerate 12 hours.

title: Mexican Layer Dip
instructions: Layer first four items.
Decorate with green onions, chopped tomato and black olives.
Finish with teaspoon of sour cream and avocado.
Serve chilled with tortilla chips.

title: Homemade Bread
instructions: Scald milk and pour over sugar, Crisco and salt.
Beat eggs and add to mixture.
Measure 2 1/2 cups of flour into another bowl (gallon crock) and add yeast.
Pour lukewarm mixture and mix.
Add rest of flour gradually.
Takes about 4 pounds.
Knead about 10 minutes.
Grease bowl.
Cover and let rise.
Punch down and let rise again.
Punch down and shape into loaves, rolls or cinnamon rolls.
Bake at 325° until lightly browned.

title: Sauteed Okra
instructions: Wash okra thoroughly and cut off the stems.
Blanch pods by submerging in a pot of rapidly boiling water for 1 to 2 minutes. Drain and pat dry.
Slice okra crosswise into 1-inch pieces. Heat the butter and garlic (if used) in a large skillet over medium heat and saute the okra.
Stir frequently for 5 minutes or until nice and brown.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

title: Drop Dumplings
instructions: Mix all ingredients, except broth.
Drop from a teaspoon into simmering broth or onto a pot roast with broth.
Cover and cook for 12 to 15 minutes.
Do not lift cover until time is up.

title: Pralines
instructions: Combine all ingredients and bring to soft-ball stage,* stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir until mixture thickens, becomes creamy and cloudy and pecans stay suspended in mixture. Spoon out on buttered wax paper. When using wax paper, be sure to place newspaper underneath as hot wax will transfer to whatever is beneath.

title: Grandma Annie'S Cream Pie
instructions: Mix sugar and flour together, then add cream slowly until smooth.
Add vanilla.
Pour into unbaked pie crust.
Sprinkle with cinnamon.
Bake at 375° until bottom of crust begins to brown, then lower heat to 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: Special Mac And Cheese
instructions: Cook macaroni in 4 to 5 cups water until tender.
Drain, if needed.
Add butter, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Add 2 cups of the milk and the Velveeta (sliced).
Stir on low heat until cheese is melted.
Pour into greased casserole.

title: Asparagus-Cucumber Mold
instructions: Dissolve gelatin in boiling
water;
let cool.	Combine soup, mayonnaise and pepper;
stir
into gelatin mixture.
Add remaining ingredients, mixing well.
Pour into a lightly oiled 4-cup mold; chill until firm.
Yield: 8 servings.

title: Almond Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Mix flour, baking soda and salt.
In a blender, grind 1/2 cup blanched almonds to a fine powder, add to flour mixture.
Cream the sugar, shortening, almond extract, egg and water and add to dry mixture.
Mix thoroughly.
Form into 1-inch balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Press one of the remaining almonds into the center of each ball while flattening it slightly with fingers.
Brush cookie with beaten egg.
Bake 20 minutes or until light brown.

title: Vegetable Soup
instructions: Boil meat with plenty of water until tender.
Use large pot, Dutch oven size.
Add all other ingredients and cook until tender, approximately 1 hour.
Stir often.
Taste and see.

title: Devil'S Food Cake
instructions: Sift flour with sugar,
soda and salt.
Stir shortening to soften.
Add flour mixture, 1
cup
milk
and vanilla.
Mix until flour is dampened.
Beat 2
minutes
at
medium speed of electric mixer.
Add eggs,
melted chocolate and remaining 1/3 cup milk. Beat 1 minute longer.
Pour
into
two
greased and floured 9-inch layer pans.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.

title: Vegetable Salad
instructions: Drain the vegetables.
Combine with onion, celery and pimentos.
Pour dressing over vegetables.

title: Mama'S Potato Salad
instructions: In a large kettle, cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender.
Drain and cool.
Peel potatoes; cut into chunks. Separate egg yolks from whites.
Set yolks aside.
Chop whites and add to potatoes with onion.

title: Cheese And Sausage Appetizers
instructions: Mix all ingredients well.
Shape into small, marble-sized balls.
Place on cookie sheet and bake in 350° oven about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve hot.
Keep on hand in the freezer.
Can be frozen, cooked or uncooked.
Makes about 100 balls.

title: Chicken Kiev
instructions: Beat
chicken breasts (any number desired).
Mix butter (start with
small amount and melt more as needed) with small amount
of oregano;
brush
breasts.	Put
cube
of cheese in center; roll up, dip in butter and roll in bread crumbs (mixed with Parmesan cheese, just guess at amount).
Place in greased casserole	and refrigerate
until	ready
to bake.
Bake in a preheated
350° oven
minutes
or until done.
This is my favorite company recipe as can be prepared well in advance.

title: Cranberry Salad Supreme
instructions: Combine cranberries and sugar.
Refrigerate overnight.
Drain off liquid the next day.
Combine all but marshmallows.
Add them and stir.
Refrigerate until serving time.

title: Oven Fried Chicken
instructions: Mix ingredients together and roll chicken.
Bake in lightly buttered pan for 1 hour at 350° until brown.

title: Sunny Pasta Salad
instructions: Boil noodles as directed on package. Drain water. Slice peppers, onion (or chop), olives and pepperoni. Mix in with noodles. Pour whole bottle of dressing over mixture. Toss well. Chill and serve.

title: Hot Chicken Or Turkey Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Put in 9 x 9-inch pan or casserole dish.
Sprinkle crushed potato chips on top.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Stir dry ingredients together and set aside.
Mix eggs, sugar and shortening with electric mixer until light texture.

title: Hot Cheese Bubble
instructions: Mix together and cook at 425° for 10 minutes, approximately. Serve with Wheat Thins.
Serve hot.

title: Creamy Chicken With Rice
instructions: Boil chicken with bouillon until it falls from bone.
Drain and remove bones.
Add cooked chicken to soup.
Add milk and water.
Bring to a boil.
Serve over cooked rice.

title: Strawberry Banana Salad
instructions: In a bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Stir in strawberries, pineapple, bananas, and nuts.
Pour half of mixture into a 13 x 9 x 2 in. dish.
Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set. Set the remaining gelatin mixture aside.
Combine the sour cream, sugar, and vanilla; mix well.
Spread over the chilled gelatin. Spoon remaining gelatin mixture over top.
Chill overnight.
Yield: 12 - 15 servings.

title: Meringue
instructions: Boil the sugar and water until thread stage.
Beat egg whites until stiff.
Pour boiling mixture into egg whites and continue beating.
May brown in oven slightly.

title: Caramel Nut Crunch
instructions: Heat oven to 325°.

Butter jelly roll pan (15 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch). Heat brown sugar, corn syrup, margarine and salt in 3-quart saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Stir in cereal and nuts until well coated. Spread in pan and bake 15 minutes. Cool until slightly firm, 5 to 7 minutes.
Loosen with metal spatula.
Let stand until firm, about 1 hour.
Makes 8 cups.

title: Never Fail Pie Crust
instructions: Cream flour and shortening together.
Mix water, vinegar, salt and egg together.
Add to flour mixture.
Roll between waxed paper on a pastry cloth or floured board.
Makes two double crust pies or four 9-inch crusts.

title: Palagrina
instructions: Cook noodles in salted	water
slowly,	for 15 minutes. Mix meat, noodles and
sauce
together;
add
corn, mushrooms, cheese and other ingredients.
Bake
in
extra large casserole at 350° for 30 minutes.
Can be frozen and served 2 to 3 weeks later.

title: Gazpacho Soup
instructions: Mix everything in 2 gallon jar.
Chill in refrigerator 1 hour and serve cold.
Will last 5 to 6 days in refrigerator.
May add veggies at anytime.
Will thicken.

title: Yeast Rolls
instructions: Bring milk to a boil. Add shortening, sugar and salt. Cool to lukewarm.
Sprinkle yeast over warm water. After 5 minutes, stir and combine with cooled milk mixture.
Add flour gradually. Beat well after each addition. Add enough flour to make a soft dough. Turn out on flour dusted board.
Cover with mixing bowl and let rest 10 minutes.
Knead about 10 minutes until smooth.
Place dough in a warm, greased bowl. Brush surface lightly with shortening.
Cover and let rise in warm place (80° to 85°) or place in refrigerator until time desired for rolls.

title: Fluffy Stuffed Potatoes
instructions: Bake potatoes
in
a 12-inch Dutch oven for 1 hour with 12 coals on top and 10 coals on bottom.
Cut baked potatoes in half lengthwise.
Scoop	out
potato and mash with milk, sour cream, margarine,	chives,
salt and pepper.
Mound back into shells. Add
grated
cheese
on
top.
Sprinkle with paprika. Place in Dutch oven.
Bake 25 minutes with 14 coals on top and 12 coals on bottom.

title: Banana Loaf
instructions: Crush bananas in large bowl.
Mix in all other ingredients. Pour into lightly greased loaf pan.
Bake 1 hour at 350° or until knife comes out clean.

title: Chicken Fingers
instructions: Let chicken soak in milk for 1 hour.
Drain and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roll in pancake mix until well coated.
Fry in deep fat until done and floats, 5 to 7 minutes.

title: Summer Cake
instructions: Bake cake as per directed in a large oblong pan.
While hot, cover with crushed pineapple.

title: Spinach Dip
instructions: Mix together.
Refrigerate overnight.
Serve with crackers, bread cubes or raw vegetables.

title: Cowboy Cookies
instructions: Cream sugars and Crisco.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
Add vanilla.
Sift together flour, salt, baking soda and baking powder.
Blend into butter mixture.
Add oatmeal or Rice Krispies and stir well.
Add chocolate bits and nuts. Stir to distribute evenly.
Drop by teaspoon onto greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Cherry Yum-Yum
instructions: Mix cream cheese, sugar and milk. Divide into 3 graham cracker pie crusts. Top each pie with 1 can cherry pie filling and Cool Whip. Chill thoroughly.

title: Date Nut Roll
instructions: Combine cheese, dates and 1/2 cup pecans.
Cover and chill 30 minutes.
Shape into a ball and roll in remaining pecans.
Serve with apple wedges or gingersnaps.
Makes 2 cups.

title: Tuna Pasta Bake
instructions: In small saucepan over medium-high heat, heat oil.
Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes.
Add tomato sauce and oregano; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer, stirring occasionally about 15 minutes.

title: Decorator Icing
instructions: Mix together.
Yields enough icing to do flowers and leaves for 350+ cake squares.

title: Parmesan Chicken
instructions: Pound chicken breasts until 1/4 inch thick.
Mix bread crumbs and parmesan cheese together in a shallow pan or bowl.
Melt butter in fry pay over medium heat.
Dip chicken pieces in egg, then in bread crumbs mixture and fry in butter about 5 minutes per side or until done.
Remove from pan.
Serves 4.

title: Frozen Cucumbers
instructions: Soak in cold water and 2 tablespoons salt.
In 2 hours drain. Mix 1/2 cup vinegar, 1 1/2 cups sugar dissolved real good.
Pour over cucumbers.
Bag and freeze.

title: Cherry Salad
instructions: Put Jell-O in hot water and let stand 5 minutes.
Add pie filling and drained pineapple; save juice.
Mix 1/2 cup juice with softened cream cheese.
Take cherry pie and Jell-O mixture and put 1/2 into pan.
Let set.
Add 1/2 cream cheese mixture on top and let set.
Add rest of cherry pie mixture and let set.
Add rest of cream cheese mixture.
Sprinkle with nuts.

title: Toss It To Me
instructions: Combine tomato sauce and spaghetti sauce mix in bowl; mix well.
Alternate layers of noodles, turkey, cheese and sauce in greased casserole.
Top with frankfurters. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Strawberries On A Cloud
instructions: Mix sour cream, evaporated milk and 10x sugar together.
Add thawed whipped topping.
Tear angel food cake into small pieces and put into a large bowl.
Add first mixture, stir together.
Mix strawberries (sliced) and glaze.
Put on top of cake mixture. Keep refrigerated.

title: One Cup Cookie
instructions: Melt butterscotch chips and peanut butter over low heat.
Stir until blended.
Remove from heat and pour over 4 c. rice krispies. Stir until coated and press half in bottom of pan.
Melt 6 oz chocolate chips, 2 Tbsp butter, 1 Tbsp water, 1 c. powdered sugar, in top of double boiler.
Stir until chips are well blended.
Pour this over the chilled cereal mixture.
Spread rest of cereal over the top.

title: Barry'S Deer Jerky
instructions: Combine all ingredients together and marinate in the refrigerator for 6 to 10 hours.
When ready to dry, remove slices and drain on paper towels; may pat dry.
To dry, spread slices in single layer on oven racks.
Place a pan under racks to catch drippings.
Set temperature at 140° or lowest temperature on your stove.
Open door slightly to allow air to circulate and moisture to escape.
Drying will take 6 to 10 hours.
Turn over after 4 hours.
Jerky is done when meat is shriveled, dark, leathery and chewy.

title: Norwegian Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat
oven
to
Grease
9-inch
pie
pan.
In mixing bowl combine sugar and flour.
Add eggs, baking powder and vanilla.
Beat until smooth.
Stir in apples and walnuts. Pour into pie pan.
Bake for 35 minutes.
Serve plain or with whipped cream or ice cream.

title: Praline Sweet Potato Casserole
instructions: Mix all ingredients together in large bowl with electric mixer on medium.

title: Graham Yogurt Bread
instructions: Remove one end from each of four 1-pound cans (the kind used for canned fruits and vegetables); rinse cans, dry and grease well.
In a large bowl, combine the graham and all-purpose flours, soda and salt.
Stir in yogurt, molasses, raisins and walnuts; mix well.
Divide batter evenly between cans.
Bake in a 350° oven for about 1 hour or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in cans 10 minutes; then turn out and stand loaves upright on a wire rack to cool completely.
Cut loaves crosswise to make thick or thin slices as you prefer.
Makes 4 small loaves.

title: Hamburger Casserole
instructions: In 4-quart casserole dish, layer in order the potatoes, onion, corn, green beans and carrots.
Mix soup with hamburger.
Pour over top.
Place in 350°
oven covered with lid.
Bake for 1 hour. Top with grated Cheddar cheese the last few minutes so it will melt.

title: Ham And Broccoli
instructions: Cook rice; drain.
Cook broccoli.
Pour rice in 9 x 13-inch dish.
Layer broccoli on top of rice.
Mix rest of ingredients except Parmesan cheese.
Cover broccoli with mayonnaise mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake 45 minutes in 350° oven.

title: Light Trifle
instructions: Prepare instant pudding according to package directions.
Fold in half the whipped topping while pudding is still soft.

title: Pat'S Cheese Cake
instructions: Mix cream cheese, 1 1/3 cups sugar, eggs and 1 tablespoon vanilla.
Pour into baking pan.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.
Set aside for 20 minutes; leave oven on.
Mix sour cream, 6 tablespoons sugar and 2 tablespoons vanilla.
Pour on top of cake and spread.
Bake for 15 minutes.

title: Lemon Asparagus Chicken
instructions: In skillet brown chicken on each side.
Transfer to casserole dish add curry powder, soup, milk, lemon and pepper.
Bake at 350° for 35-40 minutes until done; serve on rice or noodles.
(Can substitute broccoli for asparagus.)

title: Cauliflower Casserole
instructions: In a large pot, put cooking oil; after oil is hot, put in sliced onion (small pieces).
After onion has become golden brown, put in tomatoes, green pepper and salt; cut into small pieces. Mix together well.
Cover and simmer five minutes after onion and tomatoes are well mixed.
Put in meat, stirring about 3 minutes; put in water.
Cover.
Let rice stand in water 30 minutes.
In small pan, fry pieces of cauliflower until all is done.
After meat is tender, put layer of meat and cauliflower on top of rice in a large pan, pouring meat juices also.
Place foil on top of pan.
Cook until rice is tender.
Serve with yogurt.

title: Vegetable Casserole(Feeds 10 To 12 People)
instructions: Cook vegetables.
Heat soups.
Layer vegetables in 9 x 13-inch greased pan.
Pour soup over vegetables.
Add chestnuts, then onion rings.
Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

title: Good Lite Cake
instructions: Put pears in mixer.
Add 1/4 cup Crisco oil and cake mix. Beat, then add eggs, one at a time.
Beat well.
Bake in tube pan at 350° for approximately 1 hour.

title: Honolulu Rice
instructions: Cook bacon until crisp; remove bacon from skillet. Add ground beef and onion, cook, stirring until onion is tender. Stir remaining ingredients and heat through.

title: Spinach And Mushroom Salad
instructions: Prepare spinach, tearing leaves into bite-size pieces and placing in a salad bowl. Add eggs, mushrooms and bacon.

title: Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: Cook sugar and milk over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil, then add butter and peanut butter.
After it all boils and melts, remove from stove.
Add oats, cocoa and vanilla.
Stir together and dip cookies onto wax paper.

title: Sweet Potato Slaw
instructions: Combine vegetables in a bowl. Toss gently. Combine remaining ingredients and stir well. Add to cabbage mixture. Toss well. Cover and chill.
Yields 6 servings.
Serving Size:
1/2 cup. Exchanges:
1 bread/starch.

title: Blarney Stones
instructions: Combine flour, baking powder and salt; set aside.
In mixing bowl whip cream until soft and peaks form; gradually fold in sugar.
Combine water and extract; add alternately with flour mixture, gently folding ingredients together after each addition just until combined.
Fold in egg whites.
Spread into greased and wax paper-lined 13 x 9-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until cake tests done and is lightly browned.
Cool on a rack for 10 minutes.
Remove from pan; cool completely.
With fork, break cake into 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 inch pieces; set aside.

title: Fix Ahead Mashed Potatoes
instructions: Boil potatoes in salted water.
Drain and mash with the rest of the ingredients except for the melted butter.
Spoon into a lightly greased 12 x 8 x 2-inch pan.
Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with paprika.

title: Peach Cobbler With Praline Biscuits
instructions: Bring to boil 1 1/2 cups sugar, cornstarch, fruit, cinnamon and 1 cup water.
Cook 1 minute, stirring often.
Pour into casserole 9 x 13 x 2-inch.
Mix 3 tablespoons oleo, brown sugar and nuts; set aside.
Combine flour, sugar, shortening and buttermilk.
Stir until moistened.
Turn dough onto floured surface and knead 3 or 4 times.
Roll dough to approximately 12 x 8-inch.
Spread with pecan mixture.
Roll up like a jelly roll; slice.
Place slices atop fruit mixture and bake at 400° for 25 to 30 minutes.

title: German Chocolate Upside-Down Cake
instructions: Heat oven to 350°.
Oil pan and sprinkle coconut and pecans over a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix cake mix according to box.
Pour over coconut and pecans.

title: Caramel-Peach Crunch Dessert
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.
In a bowl, combine flour, oats, sugar, cinnamon and salt.
Add butter.
Mix well.

title: Sour Cream Corn Bread
instructions: Mix and bake at 375° for 35 minutes.

title: Spaghetti And Noodles
instructions: Cook noodles 15 to 20 minutes or until soft.
Cook sauce in pan 10 to 15 minutes.
Drain noodles and mix together.

title: Gingernut Cookies
instructions: Melt butter in a pan and remove from heat; add sugar, syrup and beaten egg.
Mix until well combined.
Sift flour and ginger into bowl and pour in butter mixture.
Mix until combined.
Allow to cool a little.
Roll teaspoons of mixture into balls.
Place well apart on lightly greased cookie sheets.
Bake in moderate oven for 12 to 15 minutes.
Makes about 45.

title: Caramel Popcorn Balls
instructions: Pop popcorn and set aside.
In a saucepan, combine butter, brown sugar and corn syrup.
Stir well and bring to boil over medium heat.
Stir in sweetened condensed milk.
Simmer, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to soft ball stage.
Stir in vanilla.
Pour on to the popcorn to coat.
Butter hands and form balls.
Wrap balls in Saran Wrap.
You must work with the mixture quickly; it will harden fast.

title: Vernon'S Red Velvet Cake
instructions: Prepare
cake mix per box directions.
Add food dye and paste made
from the cocoa and vinegar.
Mix well and bake as directed on cake box.
Frost with favorite frosting.

title: Crawfish Etouffee
instructions: Saute seasonings; add other ingredients (except crawfish). Cook a few minutes.
Add crawfish, salt and pepper.
Cook about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve over rice.

title: Winter Fruit Bowl
instructions: Drain juice from pineapple into 1-cup glass measure.
Stir in brown sugar and lemon juice.
Microwave on High, uncovered, 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until mixture boils. Stir in flavoring. Cool. Quarter apples and cut into very thin slices.
Peel oranges. Cut into thin slices.
Cut slices in half.
In glass serving bowl, layer half the apples, oranges and grapes. Slice banana and arrange over grapes.
Top with pineapple chunks. Repeat with remaining apples, oranges and grapes.
Pour cooled syrup over all. Cover and refrigerate several hours or overnight.
Makes about 12 servings, 70 calories each.

title: Pork Chops And Rice
instructions: Simmer together tomatoes, mushroom soup, onion soup and water. Put rice in baking dish.
Set chops on top of rice.
Pour mixture over rice and chops.
Cover and bake at 350° for 45 minutes and then uncover and bake for additional 15 minutes.

title: Pigs In Blanket
instructions: Wrap wiener
