rolls around hot dogs and cook as directed on package.
Serve
warm
with mustard.
(Can be done ahead of time and warmed in microwave.)

title: Rice Delight
instructions: Saute celery and onion in butter.
Add soup, milk and 1/3 jar Cheez Whiz.
Make layers of rice, asparagus, chestnuts and soup mixture in a buttered casserole dish. Add remaining Cheez Whiz on top of last layer in teaspoonfuls.
Bake, covered with foil, 25 to 30 minutes in a 350° oven.

title: Wheat-Free Cookies
instructions: Cream together brown sugar, white sugar and oleo.
Add egg and peanut butter.
Beat until light.
Stir in dry ingredients and vanilla.
Roll into balls.
Press fork marks across top.
Bake at 375° for 10 to 15 minutes.

title: Blueberry Tea Cake
instructions: Cream shortening.
Add sugar gradually.
Cream until well blended.
Add 1 egg.
Beat until mixture is light and fluffy. Sift flour, baking powder and salt.
Add to creamed mixture alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into 9 x 13-inch cake pan.
Cover with washed and drained blueberries.
Sprinkle top with sugar.
Dot with butter.
Bake in a 350° oven for about 1 hour.

title: Gourmet Fillet Of Sole
instructions: Arrange sole in 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish.
Thaw soup; pour over sole.
Top with cheese.
Bake at 325° for 30 minutes.
Serve immediately.
Makes 6 servings.

title: Peanut Butter Fudge
instructions: Cook the first 4 ingredients to a soft ball stage.
Turn off fire; beat in remaining ingredients.
Pour onto greased baking sheet.
Cut when cool.
Makes 5 pounds.

title: Fried Green Tomatoes
instructions: You can also use firm ripe tomatoes.
Select firm, ripe tomatoes or firm green tomatoes.
Wash them and cut in 1/2-inch slices without removing the skins.
Dip each slice in bread crumbs or flour; saute in hot oil or Crisco.
Season with salt and pepper.

title: Debbie'S Famous Barbecue Sauce
instructions: Combine all ingredients and adjust seasoning to taste, especially vinegar.
Use as a basting sauce on all meats.
Warm in microwave or saucepan before using as a table condiment.

title: Sweet Potatoes
instructions: Cut up sweet potatoes and pears and place into a greased baking dish.
Add the oranges and raisins.
Heat pear juice to boil.
Add cornstarch (which has been mixed with a little water) and the butter.
Cook until thick.
Pour over sweet potatoes. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or 15 minutes on High in microwave.

title: Broccoli Cheese Soup
instructions: Boil 2 bouillon cubes in 2 cups water.
Add broccoli and cook 15 minutes.
Saute onions and/or mushrooms in margarine.
Mix flour into cold milk and evaporated milk.
Cook with sauteed mix until thick.
Add sliced Velveeta cheese.
Stir until melts.
Add broccoli.
Stir on low heat until thick (about 20 minutes).

title: Cornbread Cake
instructions: Mix all ingredients together and pour into a lightly greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
Bake at 350° for approximately 30 minutes.

title: Tortellini Main Dish Salad
instructions: Prepare tortellini according to pkg directions. Combine vegetable stock, garlic, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, pepper and parsley in a medium heavy saucepan.
Bring to a boil, reduce to simmer and cook about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in remaining ingredients.
Toss with the cooked pasta.
Stir in a few copped sun-dried tomatoes if desired. Serve hot as a main dish or side dish.
Serve cold as a main dish or light salad.

title: Italian Meatballs
instructions: Soak the bread pieces in the wine; set aside.
Combine the Italian sausage, eggs, mint and bread.
Form into 24 meatballs. Brown the meatballs over high heat in a skillet, lightly greased with olive oil.
Finish cooking the meatballs in a marinara sauce. Serve over spaghetti or other pasta.

title: Small Chocolate Pie
instructions: Heat milk in double boiler.
Beat eggs; add dry ingredients a small amount at a time and mix thoroughly.
Add to heated milk; cook until thickened.
Take off heat; add chips, butter and vanilla.
Have ready small baked pie crust.
Beat remaining egg whites (1 additional egg white will make more meringue); add 1 tablespoon sugar for each egg white.
Pour chocolate mixture in pie crust; top with meringue and bake until brown in 250° oven.

title: Slumgullion
instructions: Brown ground beef and onions.
Add carrots, soy sauce and rice.
Cook, adding water as needed, until carrots are done.

title: Ice Cream Sandwich Dessert
instructions: Unwrap ice cream sandwiches and place side by side in a 13 x 9 pan. Top with caramel topping, nuts and Cool Whip. Freeze until ready to serve. Cut into squares to serve.

title: Broccoli And Chicken Casserole(Good!)
instructions: Put thawed broccoli in bottom of buttered dish.
Add cooked and cut up chicken as next layer.
Heat soup, mayonnaise, Velveeta and lemon juice until cheese is melted and pour over top of broccoli and chicken.
Top with crushed crackers and add melted margarine.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until bubbly and hot and top browned.

title: Pat'S Soy Ginger Glaze
instructions: Combine all ingredients except cornstarch in heavy saucepan. Mix well.
Heat on low 1 hour.
Mix cornstarch with small amount of water to make a paste.
Stir into mixture.
Heat on low for 20 minutes.
Can be made 5 days in advance.
When reheating, do not boil.
Great on chicken or fish.
Brush on while grilling.

title: Strawberry Crumble
instructions: Beat egg whites stiff, adding sugar and lemon juice.
Add this to whipped topping.
Add strawberries last.

title: Stove Top Baked Beans
instructions: In skillet, cook bacon or ground beef.
Use meat drippings to cook onion and bell pepper.
Drain.
Add all ingredients.
Bring to boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.

title: Cut Glass Dessert
instructions: Prepare orange, lime and strawberry gelatin separately in 1 1/2 cups hot water and put in 3 separate shallow pans to gel. Dissolve lemon jello in 1 cup hot pineapple juice and 1/2 cup sugar.
Let cool until slightly thickened. Whip the cream and add vanilla. Fold into lemon mixture. Cut 3 trays of jello into cubes and fold in gently to other mixture.
Line pie pans with vanilla wafers.
Pour in mixture and refrigerate.

title: My Favorite Apple Pie
instructions: Mix dry ingredients in a large bowl.
Add apples, mix well. Line a 10 or 12-inch baking dish with pastry, add apple mixture. Pour apple juice around edge (not on apples).
Cover with top pastry, sealing edges.
Cut slits in top.
Brush with margarine, sprinkle with white sugar.
Bake at 425° for 40 minutes or until juice bubbles through slits.
This is a deep-dish pie.
Pan must be at least two inches deep.

title: Hot Tuna Melts
instructions: Mix ingredients in order using 8 to 12 hamburger rolls.
Fill with mixture.
Cover with tops.
Seal each sandwich inside of foil and put on cookie sheet.
Bake at 375° for 25 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: Rice Pudding
instructions: Heat milk in pan.
Add salt and rice.
Bring to a boil and cook 15 minutes.
Add to boiling mixture 1/4 cup of the evaporated milk. Boil 5 minutes longer.
Beat eggs and vanilla slightly.
Add sugar and remaining evaporated milk to egg mixture.
Add some of hot mixture to egg mixture and stir.
Add this egg mixture to boiling rice, stirring until it thickens slightly.
Pour into bowl; stir while cooling.
Add raisins.

title: French Onion Soup
instructions: Chop onions.
Place in medium saucepan with butter.
Cover and cook until tender, not brown.
Add bouillon.
Simmer for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle bread or slice rolls with cheese and toast in hot oven.
Pour soup in deep bowl.
Place toasted bread on top just before serving.

title: Grilled Stuffed Tomatoes
instructions: Cut thin slice from stem end of each tomato; remove pulp to form shallow cups.
Remove seeds and chop tomato pulp.
Combine with 2 tablespoons cheese, 1 tablespoons parsley and pepper.
Fill tomato cups with mixture.
Combine bread crumbs, remaining cheese and parsley.
Spoon mixture evenly over filling.
Place in disposable foil pan.
Cover loosely with foil.
Cook over medium coals 15 minutes or until heated through.

title: Caramel Layer Bars
instructions: Combine flour, salt, soda, brown sugar, and oatmeal.
Cut butter until particles are fine.
Reserve 1 cup. Press remaining mixture in bottom of 8-inch square pan.
Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
Combine caramel and cream in double boiler.
Cook over hot water until melted.
Blend in 2 Tbsp. flour and spread carefully over base.
Sprinkle with chocolate chips, then top with reserved crumbs.
Bake at 350° for 12-15 minutes or until delicately browned.
Makes about 24 bars.

title: Hershey Pie
instructions: Dissolve marshmallows in 1/2 cup milk (may want to use a double boiler to dissolve).
Stir in Hershey bar until melted. Cool this mixture.
Add 1/2 pint whipped cream.
Pour in pie shell.
Refrigerate 4 hours.
Can garnish with whipped cream.

title: Butterscotch Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Melt shortening.
Remove from heat and blend in sugar.
Cool.
Stir in egg, then sifted dry ingredients. Add vanilla and nuts.
Spread in greased 8-inch square pan.
Bake 25 minutes.
Do not overbake.
Makes 16 (2-inch) squares.

title: Biondi'S Bruschetta
instructions: Mix tomatoes, onion, parsley, basil and garlic.
Cut bread in oval slices.
Pour olive oil on bread slices and spread 1 to 2 tablespoons of mixture on top.
Put in oven at 375° to 400° for 10 minutes to toast.
Watch it!
Enjoy as a wonderful pupu!

title: Dump Pound Cake
instructions: Dump all ingredients in mixer; beat 10 minutes.
Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes at 325°.
Serves 25.

title: Strawberry Pie
instructions: Prepare your crust.
Cook crushed strawberries.
After cooked until clear, add 1 Knox gelatine dissolved in 2 tablespoons cold water.
Add berries into baked pie shell.

title: Bran 'N Beef Stroganoff
instructions: In large bowl beat egg until foamy.
Stir in milk, Bran Flakes, salt, pepper and paprika.
Let stand 1 to 2 minutes.
Add ground beef, mixing until combined.
Form into 20 (1 1/2-inch) meatballs. Bake in 400° oven about 15 minutes; drain.

title: Cream Of Rice Pudding
instructions: The CoCo Lope and Harina de Arroz can be bought at Foodtown, by the Goya products.

title: Slow Cooker Spanish Rice
instructions: Brown beef in skillet and drain off fat.
Put all ingredients in crock-pot.
Stir thoroughly.
Cover and cook on low for 7 to 8 hours.
May be cooked on higher temperature if you are home to stir (about 3 hours).
Serves 6.

title: Chicken Casserole
instructions: Mix together.
Top with corn flake crumbs or crushed potato chips.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.

title: Jello Dessert
instructions: Dissolve jello with boiling water as directed.
Then remove 1/2 cup and pour into a bowl; set aside.
Add 1/2 cup cold water to gelatin.
Pour into a pan and place in freezer.

title: Sticky Buns
instructions: Mix yeast and water first.
Add other ingredients (sugar, oil and salt).
Then take 5 pounds flour; mix until dough comes off your hands.
Set dough in warm place to rise (about 1/2 hour). Put wet towel over top of it.
Let rise 3x double volume.

title: Vanilla Ice Cream
instructions: Combine sugar, eggs, evaporated milk and vanilla in large mixing bowl.
Add enough milk to fill freezer 3/4 full.

title: Oatmeal Bread
instructions: Stir
boiling
water,
rolled
oats, molasses, salt and butter together.	Let cool.
Dissolve yeast with 1/4 cup warm water; stir
in oatmeal mixture.
Add 2 cups of flour; beat 2 minutes at medium speed.
Mix in rest of flour.
Cover and let rise
about
4 hours.
With wooden spoon, beat batter about 75 strokes.
Put in two
greased
bread
pans.	Let
rise
again. Bake at 350° for 40 to 50 minutes.

title: Cherry Nut Bread
instructions: Combine all ingredients except cherries in a mixing bowl. Blend on low speed of electric mixer 15 seconds; increase to medium speed and blend 30 additional seconds.
Stir in cherries. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350°
for 1 hour and 10 to 15 minutes, or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes in pan; remove to wire rack and cool completely.
Yields 1 loaf.

title: Cucumber Sandwich Spread
instructions: Grind cucumber pulp.
Place on cheesecloth and squeeze out the juice.
Combine pulp with cream cheese, onion and seasonings, mixing thoroughly.
Add just enough food coloring to make spread pale green.

title: Lasagna Recipe
instructions: Brown in skillet, ground beef, olive oil, parsley, onion and garlic.
Add tomato paste, water, salt and pepper; simmer for 1/2 hour or more.
Add lasagna noodles to 6 quarts of salted, boiling water; cook for 15 to 30 minutes, stirring constantly.
Drain. Mix eggs and Ricotta cheese.
Arrange in a baking dish with lasagna first, meat sauce, Mozzarella cheese and cottage cheese. Bake at 375° for 20 minutes.

title: Flambe Owens And Mushrooms
instructions: Heat heavy saute pan.
Add olive oil.
Continue to heat until oil is hot.
Crumble sausage into pan and add all remaining ingredients, except chicken stock and brandy.
Cook until sausage and onion are browned, about 5 or 6 minutes.
Add stock and turn heat to high.
Continue to cook until liquid is reduced by half. Add brandy and ignite.
(If you have a gas stove, just tilt the pan until the flame comes into contact with the fumes of the alcohol. If your stove is electric, use a match.)
Allow it to burn until flame is out and the sauce is quite thick.
Remove from burner and serve over hot pasta or rice.
Sprinkle with cilantro and garnish with sliced orange.

title: Creole Burgers
instructions: Melt butter in skillet.
Add onions and saute.
Add ground beef and brown.
Drain well if needed.
Add remaining ingredients. Stir well.
Turn heat to low and simmer covered for 30 minutes. Serve over toasted bread or hamburger buns.
Great served with a green salad.

title: Nacho Dip(Creighton Favorite)
instructions: Spread cream cheese in flat, round baking dish.
Add chili on top of cheese.
Top with shredded cheese and bake at 325° until hot.
Do not cover.
Serve warm with white nacho chips.
Yum, yum!

title: Lemon Cake Icing
instructions: Cook all ingredients, except butter, until thick in a pot on low heat.
Add butter and beat.
Makes enough icing to ice 5 thin layers of cake.
Ice first layer and beat icing.
Ice each additional layer and beat icing each time.
Allow icing to air dry on cake before covering cake.

title: Cheese Ball
instructions: Allow cheese to set at room temperature.
Cut into chunks and blend until fluffy.
Add Worcestershire sauce and onion.
Cool in refrigerator and shape into two or three balls.
Roll in chopped nuts.

title: Cryin' Again Onion Rings
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
Dip sliced onions in mixture.
Fry in hot grease until brown.

title: Apple Pumpkin Dessert
instructions: Heat oven to 400°. Spoon apple filling into 8 to 10 custard cups.

title: Chocolate-Almond Frosting
instructions: Mix butter with coffee, salt and chocolate.
Add rest of ingredients and beat thoroughly.
Let stand for 5 minutes.
Beat until creamy and frost tops and sides of cakes.

title: Bacon And Cheese Breakfast Pizza
instructions: Roll pastry to fit into a 12-inch pizza pan.
Bake at 425° for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle bacon and cheese evenly over crust.

title: No-Knead Dinner Rolls
instructions: Soften yeast in 1 cup warm water.
Cream sugar and shortening together.
Add boiling water, mixing well, with mixer at medium speed.
Beat in eggs, one at a time.
Mix salt and flour together and add to the batter alternately with the yeast.
Cover and let rise in a warm place 1 hour.
Turn out on a floured surface and pat into a large rectangle.
Cut into rounds with a biscuit cutter or floured glass; dip both sides in melted butter and place in baking pans.
Cover and let rise an additional hour.
Preheat oven to 425°.
Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until nicely browned.
Makes about 48 rolls.

title: Sweet Potato Pie
instructions: Drain potatoes.
Add 1/2 cup potato juice to mixture.
Beat potatoes with egg yolks, sugar, vanilla and flour.
Add pecans and coconut (mix by hand).
Microwave on High for 8 minutes. Refrigerate to cool.
Bake pie crusts (let cool).
Fold mixture into cooled pie crust and add meringue to top.

title: Crunch Fried Tomatoes
instructions: Pour oil into skillet to heat.
Dip tomato slices in egg, then into crumbs.
Add tomato slices.
Cook, turning once until brown. Serves 4.

title: Tuna Bake With Cheese Swirls
instructions: Brown onion and green pepper in oil; add salt and flour. Blend.
Add soup and milk.
Cook until sauce is smooth and thick. Add flaked tuna and lemon juice.
Pour into greased baking dish and cover with Cheese Swirls.
Bake at 450° for 15 minutes.
Turn oven temperature down to 400°, and bake 15 more minutes.

title: Carrot Cake
instructions: Mix oil and sugar; add eggs, one at a time.
Sift together flour, soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt.
Add dry mixture in small amounts to egg mixture until all ingredients are well blended. Add vanilla.
Blend in carrots, pineapple and pecans. Bake in 3 greased and floured 9-inch pans at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.
Check at 25 minutes.
Ice with Cream Cheese Frosting.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
ingredients: italian flavored bread crumbs with parmesan
instructions: Wash and peel eggplant. Slice into 3/8-inch slices.
Dip into beaten eggs until coated well, then place into seasoned bread crumbs until well coated.
Cook in electric pan at 300° for 3 to 4 minutes on each side.
You may use olive oil, Pam or vegetable oil.
Make 2 rows in a 13 x 9-inch dish.
Pour sauce over fried eggplant.
Sprinkle with cheese and sliced mushrooms.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes until slightly golden.
Allow cheese to set for 10 minutes before serving.
Serves 4.

title: Chocolate Chip Cake
instructions: Mix first 6 ingredients together.
Pour 1/3 batter into greased tube pan.
Sprinkle with 1/3 chocolate chips.
Mix 1/3 more batter with all of chocolate syrup.
Pour on top of other batter.
Sprinkle with 1/3 more chocolate chips.
Pour rest of batter on top and sprinkle with rest of chocolate chips.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

title: Sour Cream Pound Cake
instructions: Cream butter and sugar thoroughly.
Beat in eggs, 1 at a time, beating thoroughly after each.
Add flour, reserving 2 tablespoons.
Add sour cream.
Mix 1/4 teaspoon soda mixed with 2 tablespoons flour.
Add to mixture with flavorings.
Grease and flour tube pan.
Bake 1 1/2 hours at 325°.
Remove from pan when comfortable to handle.

title: Baked Pork Chops 'N' Corn
instructions: Dip pork chops into fork beaten egg diluted with water.
Dip in crushed corn flakes.
Brown in heavy skillet.
Transfer to shallow baking dish.
Top each chop with frozen corn, some tomato soup and a pat of butter.
Bake in 350° oven about an hour or until chops are well done.

title: Peanut Butter Fudge
instructions: Cook sugar and milk, stirring until mixture makes soft ball in cold water.
Add marshmallows and peanut butter, stirring until all is dissolved and begins to thicken.
Pour in buttered dish or pan. Slice when cold.

title: Macadamia Nut Brittle
instructions: Lightly grease a 9 x 13-inch glass baking dish.
Equally distribute Macadamia nuts over bottom of dish.
Set aside.

title: Ham-Bean Soup
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except navy beans, and simmer for 2 hours.
Add cooked navy beans.
Ham pieces may be added.

title: Salmon With Linguini
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the linguini and Parmesan cheese.
In large skillet, heat oil over high heat.
Cook onion and garlic 1 minute.
Add peas, cooking an additional 2 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium and cook 1 minute.
Remove from heat and mix with linguini. Toss in salmon.
Makes 6 servings less than 300 calories each.

title: Easy Oven Stew
instructions: Mix beef cubes and flour in large ovensafe pot.
Do not brown meat.
Add other ingredients and stir.
Bake covered at 300° for 3 hours or until meat is tender.
Makes 12 (1 cup) servings.

title: Guacamole Dip
instructions: Chop the tomato and slice the scallions.
Mince the garlic and jalapeno pepper.
(You may use only 1/2 or 1/4 of the jalapeno or leave it out if you don't want it to be hot.) Halve and peel the avocados and cut the flesh into 1/2-inch cubes.
Squeeze 1 teaspoon lime juice over the avocado and toss.
Taste for seasoning and stir in additional juice, salt or jalapeno, if desired.

title: Sue Lee'S Stir-Fried Cabbage
instructions: Stir-fry vegetables over 350° in wok or large skillet.
Cook for 7 to 8 minutes.
Cover; reduce heat and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, depending on how crispy you want your cabbage.
This is a real good diet day dish with baked chicken or anything else for that matter.

title: Scalloped Pineapple
instructions: Toss drained pineapple and cheese together.
Combine sugar and flour and mix with pineapple juice; pour over pineapple and cheese mixture.
Take 4 or 5 slices of white bread, cut in cubes and butter well with melted butter.
Put bread mixture over pineapple. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until brown.

title: Buttermilk Corn Bread
instructions: Omit salt and soda if using self-rising corn meal or flour.

title: Honey Wings
instructions: Wash chicken wings.
Season with salt, pepper and Cajun seasoning.
Heat oven to 300°.
Place chicken wings in a roasting pan with 1/2 cup water, 1/2 stick of butter and 1/2 onion.
Let chicken wings bake about 30 minutes.
In a bowl, mix honey, red pepper and hot sauce.
Take chicken wings out and brush on honey mix and let cook for another 10 minutes.

title: Pudding Delight
instructions: Mix together cracker crumbs, margarine or butter and sugar. Spread in 9 x 13-inch pan.

title: Dump Cake
instructions: Grease a 9 x 13-inch pan well.
Dump
pie
filling
and pineapple with juice into it.
Dump yellow cake mix on top and spread
it
around.
Drizzle with butter
or
margarine.
Dump nuts and some coconut on top. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Pickled Daikon "Japanese Radish"
instructions: Boil vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper until sugar melts.
Cool mixture and pour over sliced Daikon and let sit 1 hour and refrigerate.

title: Nipponese Eggplant
instructions: Peel eggplant and cut into 1/2-inch to 3/4-inch cubes. Meanwhile, in a skillet, fry onions in butter.
Add eggplant, soy sauce, water and brown sugar to onions.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Serves 3 to 4.

title: Pecan Pie (1)
instructions: Beat eggs lightly, mix all ingredients well.
Bake at 325°F for about 45 min.
Put foil over top if crust gets too dark.

title: Flock Of Geese Chicken Salad
instructions: In a large bowl combine the first 4 ingredients.
Set aside. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, sour cream and vinegar; mix well.
Pour over chicken mixture.
Toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
(Wonderful on croissant rolls.) Recipe can be cut in half.

title: Tater Tots Hot Dish
instructions: Brown hamburger with finely diced onion, if desired, until all red has disappeared.
Place in 9 x 13-inch pan.
Add can of mixed vegetables (do not drain) and 1 can of mushroom soup (do not dilute).
Cover top with Tater Tots and bake at 350° until nicely browned.

title: Italian Pork Noodles
instructions: Cut boneless pork; stir-fry in 1/2 teaspoon vegetable oil, onion and mushrooms.
Stir in tomatoes and Italian seasoning. Cover and simmer 10 minutes.
Serve over hot cooked noodles. Serves 4.

title: Chili Con Carne With Tomatoes
instructions: Cook and stir ground beef, onion and green pepper in large skillet until meat is brown and onion is tender.
Drain off fat. Stir in remaining ingredients, except kidney beans.
Heat to boiling.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer 2 hours.
Stir in beans.

title: Poppy Seed Bread
instructions: Combine sugar and oil, beating until smooth. Beat eggs slightly.
Add to sugar and oil, beating until creamy.
Add vanilla, soda and salt.
Alternate, adding flour and milk.
Add poppy seed and nuts.
Bake in well greased pan at 325° for approximately 1 hour.

title: Mixed Vegetable Casserole
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together. Top with 1 package Town House crackers (crushed) and margarine.
Put half of the top mixture in with the other ingredients and save the rest to put on top of the casserole.
Bake at 350° for about 10 minutes.

title: Sandy'S Chili
instructions: Brown meat, drain grease.
Add onion and cook till onion almost done.
Add remaining ingredients.
Simmer on medium to low heat until done.

title: Fudge Clusters
instructions: In medium saucepan, melt butter in water. Stir in dry frosting mix until smooth.
Heat over low heat for five minutes, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in nuts.
Drop mixture by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper.
Let stand until firm.

title: Coq Au Vin(Chicken With Wine)
instructions: Wash and dry chicken; cut up.
Melt butter in a pan with the oil.
Fry the bacon cubes until golden brown.
Remove bacon and drain.
Fry the chicken until brown, turning once.
Put the bacon and chicken into an ovenproof casserole.
Fry the onions with the celery in the pan until soft; add to casserole.
Melt a little more butter in pan; add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes, then drain.

title: New Orleans Orange Chicken
instructions: Cut up chicken as desired.
Combine mayonnaise, ketchup and orange juice.
Pour over chicken in a shallow baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour (uncovered).
Extra sauce may be used over rice.

title: Monkey Bread
instructions: Use greased 9 x 13-inch pan or Bundt pan.
Melt butter; add brown sugar, pudding, milk and cinnamon.
Break up 1 loaf into round balls; place in pan.
Pour mixture over and break second loaf over this.
Rise 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
Bake 30 minutes at 350°; turn out immediately to cool.

title: Cream Of Torte
instructions: Bake at 350°.
Top with banana slices, tart cherries (8-ounce can) and whipped cream.

title: Baby Pearl Tapioca
instructions: Combine and heat
to
boiling,
stirring all the while. Boil for 5 minutes.
Pour
in
cans
and cold pack 20 minutes. Can add fruit cocktail and Cool Whip after opening.

title: Coconut Balls
instructions: Cream well the margarine, milk and sugar.
Add nuts, coconut and vanilla.
Chill mixture and roll in 1-inch balls.
Place in refrigerator and chill again.
In a double boiler, melt chocolate chips and wax.
Dip coconut balls in chocolate mixture.
Place on wax paper and cool.

title: Pinto Bean Soup
instructions: Cook onions slightly in butter.
Put into a blender with the beans, chicken stock, and seasonings and blend.
Transfer to a saucepan and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add tomato juice.
Heat and serve.
Float 1 tablespoon of fresh cream on top of each cup.

title: Caramel Corn
instructions: Combine oleo, brown sugar, Karo syrup and salt in pan.
Heat to boiling.
Boil for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Add baking soda.
Pour over popped corn.
Spread on 2 cookie sheets.
Put into 200° oven for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.

title: German Chocolate Pie
instructions: Melt chocolate and margarine in a pan.
Add sugar, cornstarch and salt.
Beat eggs slightly.
Add to chocolate mixture.
Add milk and remaining ingredients.
Pour into a 9-inch pie shell and bake for 20 minutes at 375°.

title: Easy Date Sticks
instructions: While cookie dough softens, combine dates, sugar and water. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice.
Set aside.

title: Quick Fruit Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, prepare 1 package of Jell-O as directions indicate.
Add drained pineapple.
Sprinkle remaining package of Jell-O over mixture.
Stir in cottage cheese and Cool Whip.
Blend until smooth.
Refrigerate until set in 11 3/4 x 7 1/2 x 1 3/4-inch pan.

title: Oreo Cookie-Walnut Pudding
instructions: Prepare puddings according to package directions. Fold in cool whip until well blended. Fold in cookies and walnuts. Sprinkle crushed oreos over top. Make approximately 12 servings.

title: Pizza Casserole
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package.
Brown sausage and drain. Melt margarine and onion (I do this in microwave for 2 to 3 minutes).
Drain spaghetti and onion-margarine mixture in 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Layer sausage, Ragu sauce, shredded Mozzarella, Swiss and Cheddar cheese.
Top with pepperoni and olives.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: One-Step Microwave Lasagna
instructions: Crumble beef into a microwave safe colander; place colander in a 9-inch pie plate.
Cover with wax paper; microwave at High 5 to 6 minutes or until meat is no longer pink, stirring after 3 minutes.
Combine beef, sauce, water and wine.
Spread 1/3 of mixture in a lightly greased 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish.
Arrange 4 lasagna noodles on sauce.
Layer 1 cup cottage cheese and 1 cup Mozzarella cheese over noodles.
Spoon 1/2 of remaining sauce over cheese.
Repeat process again.
Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Cover with plastic wrap, folding back one corner for steam to escape. Microwave at Medium 32 to 35 minutes, give dish half-turn after 15 minutes.
Uncover and sprinkle with remaining Mozzarella cheese and microwave for 2 minutes.
Yields 6 large servings.

title: Potato Casserole
instructions: Mix all ingredients.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
Sprinkle on onions towards end.
Makes 10 servings.

title: Corn Fritters
instructions: Combine dry ingredients and mix well.
Combine remaining ingredients except oil and stir into dry ingredients.
Drop by tablespoons into hot oil (375°).
Fry until golden brown turning once.
Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Makes twelve 2-inch fritters.

title: Wonder Dessert
instructions: Beat egg whites
to foam.
Add sugar gradually until stiff. Fold crackers and walnuts into egg whites.
Pour into a 9 x 13-inch greased pan. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes. Cool 1 hour. Pour cherry pie filling on top and spoon Cool Whip over cherries. Chill and cut into squares.

title: Cheese Ball
instructions: Soften cream cheese and Blue cheese with milk and mix thoroughly.
Add green pepper, pimento, garlic powder and salt. Mix well.
Form into a ball.
Roll cheese ball in finely ground nuts.

title: White Chili
instructions: Mix all ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until ready to serve.

title: Biscuits
instructions: Mix dry ingredients and shortening until crumbly.
Stir in egg and milk.
Drop on cookie sheet or knead and cut in squares.
Bake at 400° for 10 to 12 minutes.

title: Chicken 'N Rice
instructions: Place chicken breasts in an 8 x 12-inch baking dish.
Pour salad dressing over chicken.
Bake, uncovered, at 400° for 20 minutes.
Place rice, vegetables and 1/2 can Durkee French fried onions around and under chicken.
Combine chicken broth and Italian seasoning and pour the mixture over chicken and vegetables.
Bake, uncovered, 25 minutes.
Top with remaining onions and bake another 2 to 3 minutes.

title: Fresh Strawberry Pie
instructions: Pour 1 cup boiling water over the ingredients.
Bring to a slight boil.
Let stand and cool completely.

title: Lemonade Pie
instructions: Mix milk and lemonade together, then Cool Whip.
Pour into pie shells.
Keep cool in refrigerator.

title: Grasshopper Pie
instructions: Mix crushed Oreo cookies and melted butter; press into 9 x 13-inch cake pan.
Freeze.
Soften 1/2 gallon ice cream.
Spread over frozen crust.
Return to freezer.
In saucepan, melt semi-sweet chocolate; add powdered sugar, butter and evaporated milk.
Bring to rolling boil; cool.
Spread over ice cream. Return to freezer.
Keep frozen until just before serving.

title: Mexican Cheese Dip
instructions: Heat
about 10 minutes in microwave.
Stir during first four minutes and again after the next four minutes.

title: Monkey Bread
instructions: Cut each individual biscuit into quarters and roll into a ball.
In a freezer size plastic bag, mix sugar and cinnamon. Drop rounded balls into bag and shake.
Drop into greased Bundt pan.
Melt 1 stick oleo; pour on top.
Sprinkle remaining sugar mixture over top.
Bake approximately 40 minutes at 350°.
When cooled, pull apart with fingers.

title: Zucchini
instructions: Saute onion and garlic in butter; add quartered zucchini. Cook until tender.
Add diced tomato and/or 1 can chili with or without beans.
Cover and simmer 5 to 10 minutes.
Add cheese and cover to let cheese melt and serve.

title: Rice Krispies Treats
instructions: Spray saucepan and cooking pan.
Melt margarine over low heat in large saucepan.
Add marshmallows; stir until melted.
Remove from heat.
Add cereal; stir until coated.
Use buttered spatula to press mixture into baking sheet.
Remove from sheet and add decorations (decorations optional).

title: Chicken Enchiladas
instructions: Rinse chicken; drain.
Cook in water to cover in saucepan until tender; drain, bone and chop.
Tear tortillas into pieces. Combine soups, onion and chilies in bowl; mix well.
Layer tortillas, soup mixture, chicken and cheese alternately in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.
Yield:
8 servings.

title: Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: In skillet, in 1 tablespoon hot oil, stir-fry half of the chicken until browned.
Remove and repeat with remaining chicken. In remaining 1 tablespoon hot oil, stir-fry vegetables with garlic powder until tender and crisp.
Add soup, soy and vinegar.
Heat to boiling.
Return chicken to skillet.
Heat through, stirring occasionally.
Serve over rice.

title: Cranberry Drops
instructions: Heat oven to 375°.
Cream butter and sugars together.
Beat in milk, orange juice and egg.
Stir together flour, baking powder, salt and soda; blend well with sugar mixture.
Stir in nuts and cranberries.
Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes.
Makes 11 dozen cookies.

title: Vegetables Confetti
instructions: Cover bottom of an 11 x 17-inch ungreased pan with rolls spread out flat.
Bake at 350° for about 20 minutes, until lightly browned.
Cool.
Mix the cream cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise and salad dressing mix; spread over baked rolls.
Mix diced vegetables together; sprinkle over the cream cheese mixture. Cover with plastic wrap; press vegetables down into cream cheese. Keep covered.
Chill 3 to 4 hours.
Cut into small bars.

title: Squash Pie(Makes 2 Pies)
instructions: Peel and seed squash. Dice into pieces. Cook in saltwater until soft and tender. Drain off water.

Pure squash or beat with mixer. Mix flour and sugar together. Add to mixture. Beat on low speed. Add eggs, milks and vanilla; mix well. Pour into unbaked pie shells. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until set.

title: The Ten Minutes, No Fuss, Healthy Lunch
instructions: In medium bowl, combine the chickpeas, tomatoes, onion and tuna.
Mix olive oil, vinegar and pepper until blended.
Pour over chickpeas-tuna mixture.
Toss.
Serve with bread.
Serves 3 to 4.

title: Pizza Crust
instructions: Sift flour and salt.
Add yeast to warm water and dissolve. Mix in the flour and salt.
Knead for about 5 minutes, adding more flour only if necessary.
Cover and let rise for 1/2 hour.
Roll or pull by hand.
Place on greased pizza pan.
Makes 2 to 3 crusts.
Bake at 375° for 25 minutes.

title: Earthquake Cake
instructions: Make cake mix according to directions.
Grease and flour pan. Sprinkle coconut and pecans in bottom of pan.
Pour cake mix over nuts.
Mix butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla.
Pour over top of cake mix.
Bake 55 minutes at 350°.

title: Cranberry Salad
instructions: Dissolve Jell-O in water; add relish, nuts and celery.
Chill.

title: Red Beans And Sauce
instructions: Cook beans until done.

title: Crab Dip
instructions: Mix all ingredients together, except crab meat.
Then fold in crab meat.
Cover.
Chill 24 hours or overnight in refrigerator. Serve with tortilla chips.

title: Oriental Grilled Chicken
instructions: Cut chicken breasts in half.
Mix remaining ingredients together in a shallow pan large enough to hold breasts in one layer.
Place breasts in marinade, turning to coat and rubbing marinade into breasts.
Marinate at least one hour and as long as overnight.
Grill chicken over hot coals or under broiler.
Strain marinade, bring it to a boil and serve it with chicken.
Yield:
4 servings.
Carbohydrate 5 g, protein 21 g, fat 5 g, calories 186.

title: Watermelon Pickles
instructions: Pare and remove all green and pink portions from
watermelon rind.
Cut it in the desired shape or size, and soak for 2-3 hours in lime water.
Drain the watermelon rind.
Cover it with fresh cold water.
Cook for 1 hour or until tender.
Drain the watermelon.
Cover with a weak vinegar (1 c. of vinegar in 2 cups water) and allow to stand overnight.
Discard the liquid next morning and make sirup of the 3 cups of vinegar, 1/2 c. water, sugar, spice.
Heat the sirup to 180°.
Cover and infuse for 1 hour.
Add the drained watermelon and cook gently for 2 hour or until the sirup is fairly thick.
Seal.
Process in a water-bath canner for 15 minutes.

title: Stuffed Celery
instructions: Soften cream cheese and mix with pepper and pimientos.
Stuff mixture into hollow of celery stalk.

title: Individual Cheese Cake
instructions: Place piece of graham cracker in bottom of muffin paper.
Beat well the cream cheese, eggs and sugar.
Pour over grahams and top with pie filling.
Bake 15 minutes in 350° oven.
Makes 12 to 15.

title: Sugar-Glazed Peanuts
instructions: Mix all ingredients in 2-quart saucepan.
Cook until water is all gone and sugar has crystallized.
Then spread mixture on cookie sheet and bake for 30 minutes in 300° oven.

title: Deviled Seafood Casserole
instructions: Mix all ingredients, except crumbs, and place in buttered casserole dish.
Top with crumbs.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Serves four to six.

title: Beef Fiesta
instructions: Brown beef and drain. Mix all ingredients together except for potatoes. Put in a casserole dish. Spoon potatoes around top of casserole. Sprinkle a little chili powder on top of potatoes. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until potatoes are slightly brown. Serves 4 to 6.

title: Pineapple Nut Bread
instructions: Measure first four ingredients into sifter.
Set aside.
Rinse raisins with boiling water to plump them.
Drain.
Set aside with walnuts.

title: Strawberry Bread
instructions: Sift flour,
soda, salt and cinnamon together.	Stir in sugar. Beat eggs and add with remaining ingredients, stirring just to mix well.
Bake
in
two
greased
and floured 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pans at 350° for 1 hour.

title: Double Decker Fudge
instructions: 1. Line a 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan with foil.
Place 1 cup peanut butter ships in medium bowl.
Set aside. in second medium bowl, blend 1/4 c butter,
cocoa and vanilla until smooth.
Add 1 c peanut butter chips.

title: Peppery Hush Puppies
instructions: Combine dry ingredients; add buttermilk, water, margarine and eggs. Mix well. Stir in onion and peppers. Carefully drop batter by teaspoon into hot oil (375°). Fry 3 to 5 minutes, turning once, until hush puppies are golden brown.
Drain well on paper towels. Yields about 2 1/2 dozen.

title: Fruit Salad With Creamy Lemon Dressing
instructions: In medium bowl, combine all ingredients; toss lightly.
Chill 1/2 hour before serving.
Garnish with almonds, if desired.

title: Happy Marriage Recipe
instructions: Combine love and warmth.
Mix thoroughly with tenderness.
Add forgiveness.
Blend with friends and hope.
Sprinkle all remaining tenderness.
Stir in faith and laughter.
Bake with sunshine. Serve daily in generous helpings.

title: Crab Dip
instructions: Heat soup to dissolve cream cheese in soup.
Soften gelatin in 3/4 cup cold water, then add to soup and stir to dissolve, then cool.
Add peppers, celery, onions and mayonnaise to soup mixture. Add crab meat.
Spray mold with Pam.

title: Poppy Seed Chicken
instructions: Cook chicken
and
debone it.
Mix crackers, poppy seed and melted
margarine
in
large
bowl.
Mix
deboned chicken, cream of	chicken
soup and sour cream in another bowl.
Layer 1/2 of Ritz
mixture
for	crust in bottom of casserole dish. Next, put in	the
chicken, soup and sour cream mixture.
Put remaining cracker
mixture
on
top.	Cook at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: Taco Salad
instructions: Brown ground beef and drain off fat.
Let cool.
Set aside. Dice the green pepper and onion; set aside.
Wash lettuce and break into bite-sized pieces.
Add cheese, onion and green pepper to lettuce; mix.
Mix beans with ground beef separately.

title: Guacamole Dip
instructions: Mix with mixer. Spread in 9 x 9 dish. Cover with finely shredded cheese. Serve with tortilla chips.

title: Hot Grilled Salmon
instructions: Marinate salmon 6 hours in Wishbone dressing.
Gas grill: Spray PAM on extra hot grill.
Place salmon, skin side down, and cook for 7 minutes.
Do not flip.
Charcoal grill:
Cook for 11 minutes.
Serve with Fiddleheads.

title: Cream Sticks
instructions: Put yeast in warm water; scald milk, then add your oleo in hot milk to melt.
Put together when cool, then add yeast, well beaten eggs, vanilla and sugar.
Add flour.
Put in warm place until double in bulk.
Roll out and cut in pieces, about 1/2 x 3 1/2-inches long.
Let rise again.
Fry in deep vegetable oil. Cut top of stick open and fill with filling.
Ice with brown sugar frosting.

title: Georgia'S Tea Cakes
instructions: Mix sugar, butter, eggs and other ingredients.
Chill well before rolling out; cut with cookie cutter.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet; bake in an oven that has been preheated to 450°. Let the cookies stay in the 450° oven for about 1 minute, then turn oven to 375° and bake for 7 to 8 minutes.

title: Poulet
instructions: Mix stuffing and margarine with water; set aside.
Combine onion, celery, salt and mayonnaise.
Mix well with stuffing mix.

title: Everything Cookies
instructions: Mix in order given.
Drop onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350° until lightly browned.

title: Poppy Seed Cake
instructions: Mix cake mix, vanilla pudding, 1 cup water, 1/2 cup oil and the eggs together on medium speed until well blended.
Fold in the poppy seed.
Prepare Bundt or tube pan by greasing with butter and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.
Bake at 350° for 50 minutes. Cool 15 minutes.

title: Chicken Salad With Pecans
instructions: Boil chicken until done, let cool and cut into small chunks. Fry bacon until very crisp, crumble into bacon bits.
Chop celery medium fine.
Crumble pecans under each half, is in about 6 pieces.
Open canned mushrooms and drain.
Put in large bowl: chicken, bacon bits, celery, pecans and mushrooms.
Add sour cream, mayonnaise and lemon juice.
Mix thoroughly and serve.

title: Zucchini Bread
instructions: Blend first 5 ingredients and set aside.
Mix dry ingredients. Mix dry ingredients with wet ingredients until blended.
Optionals can be added if desired.
Pour batter into greased and floured loaf pans and bake at 325° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Yields 2 loaves.

title: Chinese Pepper Steak Coca-Cola
instructions: Trim all fat from the meat and cut into pencil-thin strips. In a deep skillet or Dutch oven, heat oil, garlic and salt.
Add the meat and brown over high heat, about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally with a fork.
Add the beef broth.
Cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until the meat is fork-tender.
Stir in the green pepper strips, celery, onion and 1/2 cup of Coca-Cola. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
Do not overcook; the vegetables should be tender-crisp.
Peel the tomatoes; cut into wedges and gently stir into meat.

title: Punch Bowl Cake
instructions: Put 1 cake layer in bottom of a large punch bowl.
Starting at top of ingredients, layer pudding, cherry pie filling, pineapple, fruit cocktail, coconut, pecans and Cool Whip; put 1 layer of each.
Add other cake layer and start over.
Put cherries on top of cake.

title: Hot Roll Bagels
instructions: In large bowl combine yeast from foil packet with the flour mixture.
Stir in 1 cup hot tap water, egg and margarine, until dough pulls cleanly away from sides of bowl.
Turn dough onto lightly floured surface.
With greased or floured hands, shape dough into a ball.
Knead dough for 10 minutes, until smooth. Cover with inverted bowl, let rest for 5 minutes.

title: Cream Potato Casserole
instructions: Cook, drain and mash potatoes just like cream potatoes.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour in buttered baking dish and top with more butter and Parmesan cheese.
Bake, uncovered, 35 minutes at 350°.
Serves 6 to 8.

title: Oven Beef Stew
instructions: Mix all in covered casserole.
Bake at 350° for 3 1/2 to 4 hours.
Serves 4.
Good with corn bread.

title: Chicken Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Sprinkle top with 1 cup grated cheese.
Bake at 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

title: Hidden Valley Ranch Oyster Crackers
instructions: Combine salad dressing mix and oil.
Add dill weed, garlic powder and lemon pepper.
Pour over crackers; stir to coat.
Place in warm oven.
Use very low temperature for 15 to 20 minutes.

title: Zucchini-Mushroom Frittata
instructions: Saute vegetables in oil until zucchini is crisp and tender. Sprinkle in garlic powder.
Cool slightly.
Beat eggs with cream; add cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, bread cubes, salt, pepper and sauteed vegetables.
Mix well.
Pour into well greased 9-inch glass deep dish pie plate.
Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes or until set in center.
Cool for 10 minutes.

title: Hot Olive Cheese Puffs
instructions: Blend cheese with margarine.
Stir flour with salt and paprika and mix well.
Wrap 1 tablespoon of mix around each olive. Completely cover the olive.
Freeze in a plastic bag.
To serve, place frozen puffs on ungreased cookie sheet and bake in 400° oven for 10 to 15 minutes until golden.
Olives will be quite hot. Serve on toothpicks.

title: Meatballs
instructions: Combine milk, 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce and soup mix and blend well.
Let stand 5 minutes and add beef.
Mix well. Shape into balls, using 1 teaspoon for each.
Broil 5 to 6-inches from heat for 10 to 12 minutes.
Do not turn.
Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan.
Cook until heated through.
Add meatballs and serve.

title: Peanut Brittle
instructions: Grease 2 (15 1/2 x 12-inch) baking sheets.
Keep warm.
Put sugar, syrup and water in a 3-quart casserole.
Cook in microwave oven on Full Power for 8 to 10 minutes or until soft ball stage. Stir occasionally while cooking.
Stir in peanuts.
Cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until hard ball stage.
Stir in butter and soda. Pour half of candy on each sheet, spreading to 1/4-inch thick. Cool.
Break into pieces.
Store in airtight container.

title: Green Rice
instructions: Saute celery and onion in butter.
Combine all ingredients in a 2 quart casserole dish.
Bake 40 minutes at 350°.

title: Jambalaya
instructions: Chop up chicken breasts. Combine chicken with all ingredients except ham and rice. Bring to boil. Add ham and rice. Cover and simmer until rice is done.

title: Double-Corn Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.
Grease 12 muffin pan cups.
In large bowl, combine flour, corn meal, sugar, baking powder, salt and red pepper.
In medium bowl, whisk milk, butter and egg.
Stir into dry ingredients just until combined.
Stir in corn.
Spoon into prepared pans.
Bake 20 minutes.
Unmold and serve warm.
Makes 1 dozen.

title: Copper Penny Carrots
instructions: Mix all together and let set overnight in the fridge.
This will stay good for a week, if it lasts that long.

title: Pizza Casserole
instructions: Brown beef and onion in skillet.
Pour off grease.
Spread beef mixture in large casserole dish.
Add cooked and drained macaroni.
Add tomato sauce.
Mix seasonings and water and add. Top with shredded cheese and pepperoni.
Bake at 375° for 20 to 30 minutes.

title: Stewed Chicken
instructions: Cut up chicken; clean and wash.
Put chicken in stewing pot with water.
Keep enough water in pot to cover chicken.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Stew until almost tender.

title: Corn Pudding
instructions: Mix all together, except flour and milk.
Mix flour and milk until smooth; then mix all together and pour into a greased baking dish.
Bake at 375° approximately 1 1/2 hours or until firm and slightly browned.

title: Oatmeal-Raisin Cookies
instructions: Beat salad oil, vanilla, eggs and 1 1/4 cups powdered sugar until smooth.
With mixer at low speed, beat in flour, soda and salt until blended.
With spoon stir in oatmeal, raisins and nuts.

title: Dry Orange Salad
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Do not mix Jell-O with water; use dry.
Chill overnight.

title: P T A Cookies
instructions: Mix together syrup and sugar in a saucepan. Boil mixture for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla until well blended. Add cereal. Mix until coated.
Drop by spoonfuls on waxed paper. Let cool.

title: Rich Chocolate Frosting
instructions: Cream margarine and sugar.
Add egg yolks, beating after each. Stir in cooled melted chocolate.
Blend in vanilla and add water until it is at spreading consistency.

title: Brownie Mix
instructions: In large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, sugar and cocoa; with a pastry blender, cut in shortening until evenly distributed.
Store in large container.
It doesn't have to be refrigerated.
Keeps 10 to 12 weeks and yields 17 cups mix.

title: Corn Pudding
instructions: Melt butter in casserole.
Beat eggs.
Add flour, sugar, salt and pepper.
Add corn; mix well with electric mixer.
Add butter (that melted) and half and half; mix well.
Pour into casserole. Sprinkle paprika on top.
Bake at 325° for an hour (it should jiggle and a knife should come out kinda clean).

title: Chuck Wagon Chili Soup
instructions: Saute beef in a 5-quart pot over medium heat 4 minutes or until brown.
Discard fat.
Saute onions and garlic in pot 4 minutes or until soft.
Stir in chili powder and cumin, then squash, broth and 1 extra cup water.
Cover and gently boil 15 minutes until squash is almost tender.
Add tomatoes and beans; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer 15 minutes to develop flavors.
Serve with shredded Cheddar cheese and sliced scallions.
